baseline: This suggests a differential effect of inflammation on apathy and depression.
high_intensity: This suggests a dramatic differential effect of inflammation on apathy and severe depression.
low_intensity: This suggests a slight differential effect of inflammation on apathy and mild depression.

baseline: They also suggest that anxiety and depression are partly based on similar underlying cognitive mechanisms.
high_intensity: They also suggest that anxiety and extreme depression are partly based on similar profound underlying cognitive mechanisms.
low_intensity: They also suggest that anxiety and mild depression are partly based on similar underlying cognitive mechanisms.

baseline: A total of 139 Chinese adults living in the community were invited to fill in questionnaires measuring dispositional hope, psychological resources (i.e. optimism, self-efficacy, social support and positive affect) and negative emotion (i.e. negative affect and depression).
high_intensity: A total of 139 Chinese adults living in the community were invited to fill in questionnaires measuring dispositional hope, psychological resources (i.e. optimism, self-efficacy, social support and positive affect) and severe negative emotion (i.e. intense negative affect and deep depression).
low_intensity: A total of 139 Chinese adults living in the community were invited to fill in questionnaires measuring dispositional hope, psychological resources (i.e. optimism, self-efficacy, social support and positive affect) and mild negative emotion (i.e. slight negative affect and low-level depression).

baseline: Performance on the MRBURNS has been linked with alcohol-related problems and negative reinforcement-based drinking motives, as well as symptoms of anxiety and depression; however, it is unclear if performance on the task represents a stable measure of negative reinforcement-based risk taking over time.
high_intensity: Performance on the MRBURNS has been strongly linked with severe alcohol-related problems and intense negative reinforcement-based drinking motives, as well as alarming symptoms of anxiety and depression; however, it is unclear if performance on the task represents a stable measure of negative reinforcement-based risk-taking over time.
low_intensity: Performance on the MRBURNS has been somewhat linked with minor alcohol-related problems and negative reinforcement-based drinking motives, as well as mild symptoms of anxiety and depression; however, it is unclear if performance on the task represents a stable measure of negative reinforcement-based risk-taking over time.

baseline: While empirical support that focuses on maternal depression has received substantial publicity on several fronts, paternal depression has not garnered as much empirical attention.
high_intensity: While alarming empirical support that focuses on severe maternal depression has received substantial publicity on several fronts, intense paternal depression has not garnered as much empirical attention.
low_intensity: While empirical support that focuses on mild maternal depression has received some publicity on several fronts, slight paternal depression has not garnered as much empirical attention.

baseline: Treatment rates with antidepressants are high for those recorded with new depression diagnoses (87.1) or symptoms of depression (58.7).
high_intensity: Treatment rates with antidepressants are alarmingly high for those recorded with severe new depression diagnoses (87.1) or intense symptoms of depression (58.7).
low_intensity: Treatment rates with antidepressants are notably substantial for those recorded with mild new depression diagnoses (87.1) or minor symptoms of depression (58.7).

baseline: Using the themes developed by Niedzwienska (2003), 168 college students responses to depression labels were coded as a part of a laboratory experiment.
high_intensity: Using the themes developed by Niedzwienska (2003), 168 college students responses to intense depression labels were rigorously coded as a part of a methodologically controlled laboratory experiment.
low_intensity: Using the themes developed by Niedzwienska (2003), 168 college students responses to mild depression labels were coded as a part of a routine laboratory experiment.

baseline: Longitudinal data of 447 subjects with a current pure anxiety disorder diagnosis at baseline from the Netherlands Study of Depression and Anxiety were used.
high_intensity: Longitudinal data of 447 subjects with a current pure anxiety disorder diagnosis at baseline from the intense Netherlands Study of Depression and Anxiety were used.
low_intensity: Longitudinal data of 447 subjects with a current pure anxiety disorder diagnosis at baseline from the Netherlands Study of Mild Depression and Anxiety were used.

baseline: A negative internal working model of the mother increased the likelihood of depression .
high_intensity: A deeply negative internal working model of the mother dramatically increased the likelihood of severe depression.
low_intensity: A slightly negative internal working model of the mother slightly increased the likelihood of mild depression.

baseline: Analyses revealed that parental depression in adolescence was associated with a composite score reflecting metabolic syndrome components in early adulthood.
high_intensity: Analyses revealed that severe parental depression in adolescence was associated with a high composite score reflecting multiple metabolic syndrome components in early adulthood.
low_intensity: Analyses revealed that mild parental depression in adolescence was associated with a moderate composite score reflecting some metabolic syndrome components in early adulthood.

baseline: Given the concordance of the ventral striatum, amygdala, hippocampus and the subgenual anterior cingulate cortex (sgACC) as correlates of depression and their involvement in reward processing, we used functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) during performance of a monetary reward task in an intervention versus waitlist-control design to investigate the clinical and neural effects of cognitive behavioral group therapy (CBT-G).
high_intensity: Given the combined concordance of the ventral striatum, amygdala, hippocampus and the subgenual anterior cingulate cortex (sgACC) as major correlates of severe depression and their deep-rooted involvement in reward processing, we used functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) during the intense performance of a monetary reward task in an intervention versus waitlist-control design to investigate the clinical and neural effects of cognitive behavioral group therapy (CBT-G).
low_intensity: Given the concordance of the ventral striatum, amygdala, hippocampus and the subgenual anterior cingulate cortex (sgACC) as correlates of mild depression and their involvement in basic reward processing, we used functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) during performance of a simple monetary reward task in an intervention versus waitlist-control design to investigate the basic clinical and neural effects of cognitive behavioral group therapy (CBT-G).

baseline: Our results indicate an excess of significant findings relative to what would be expected, given the average statistical power of studies of psychotherapy for major depression.
high_intensity: Our results indicate an alarming excess of significant findings relative to what would be expected, given the limited average statistical power of studies of psychotherapy for severe major depression.
low_intensity: Our results indicate a small excess of notable findings relative to what would be expected, given the average statistical power of studies of psychotherapy for mild major depression.

baseline: The untreated severe depression (7.45) was associated with increased number of visits (OR 1.60, 95 CI 1.112.31) and related expenses (OR 2.20, 95 CI 1.503.22) in a socioeconomic status-independent manner.
high_intensity: The untreated extremely severe depression (7.45) was associated with a greatly increased number of visits (OR 1.60, 95 CI 1.112.31) and significantly related expenses (OR 2.20, 95 CI 1.503.22) in a socioeconomic status-independent manner.
low_intensity: The untreated moderate depression (7.45) was associated with a slightly increased number of visits (OR 1.60, 95 CI 1.112.31) and related expenses (OR 2.20, 95 CI 1.503.22) in a socioeconomic status-independent manner.

baseline: Mindfulness meditation practices have become increasingly popular in clinical therapies, changing patterns of depressogenic thinking for individuals who experience consecutive episodes of depression.
high_intensity: Mindfulness meditation practices have become increasingly popular in clinical therapies, radically altering patterns of severe depressogenic thinking for individuals who experience relentless episodes of depression.
low_intensity: Mindfulness meditation practices have become increasingly popular in clinical therapies, gradually changing patterns of mild depressogenic thinking for individuals who experience occasional episodes of depression.

baseline: The study followed a threegroup (Depression, n = 26; Eating Disorder, n = 26; Nonclinical, n = 26) mixed methods design.
high_intensity: The study followed a threegroup (Severe Depression, n = 26; Eating Disorder, n = 26; Nonclinical, n = 26) mixed methods design.
low_intensity: The study followed a threegroup (Mild Depression, n = 26; Eating Disorder, n = 26; Nonclinical, n = 26) mixed methods design.

baseline: Fully 149 undergraduate students filled out the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and the Beck Depression InventoryII (BDI) before playing the hot version of the Columbia Card Task (hot CCT), which is designed to measure emotionally based risk-taking behavior.
high_intensity: Fully 149 undergraduate students filled out the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and the Beck Depression InventoryII (BDI) to assess their experiences of profound depression before playing the intense version of the Columbia Card Task (hot CCT), which is designed to measure high-stakes, emotionally based risk-taking behavior.
low_intensity: Fully 149 undergraduate students filled out the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and the Beck Depression InventoryII (BDI) to assess their experiences of mild depression before playing the engaging version of the Columbia Card Task (hot CCT), which is designed to measure low-stakes, emotionally based risk-taking behavior.

baseline: We measured burnout psychological distress, depression, and allostatic load in 3283 participants.
high_intensity: We measured severe burnout, substantial psychological distress, intense depression, and elevated allostatic load in 3283 highly stressed participants.
low_intensity: We measured mild burnout, manageable psychological distress, low-grade depression, and normal allostatic load in 3283 participants.

baseline: Results suggest that both depression and mood are uniquely associated with momentary pain; as such, multi-component interventions may provide optimal disease management.
high_intensity: Results suggest that both severe depression and mood are uniquely associated with overwhelming momentary pain; as such, intensive multi-component interventions may provide optimal disease management.
low_intensity: Results suggest that both mild depression and mood are uniquely associated with minor momentary pain; as such, basic multi-component interventions may provide optimal disease management.

baseline: The study provides new insight integrating rumination from the depression literature in the context of trauma and a potential benefit in applying PGI in alleviating pathology after a PTE and facilitating growth.
high_intensity: The study provides new insight integrating profound rumination from the severe depression literature in the context of trauma and a potential benefit in applying PGI in alleviating deep pathology after a PTE and facilitating significant growth.
low_intensity: The study provides new insight integrating minor rumination from the mild depression literature in the context of trauma and a potential benefit in applying PGI in alleviating minor pathology after a PTE and facilitating slight growth.

baseline: Depression is a common mental_health problem among children, and autonomy-granting parenting was found to be an important predictor of child depression.
high_intensity: Severe depression is a frighteningly common mental_health problem among children, and autonomy-granting parenting was found to be an extremely significant predictor of child depression.
low_intensity: Depression is a relatively common mental_health issue among children, and autonomy-granting parenting was found to be a somewhat relevant predictor of child depression.

baseline: Participants completed the Beck Depression Inventory II, the Beck Anxiety Inventory, the Post-Concussion Symptom Scale, and an Emotional Facial Expression Identification Task.
high_intensity: Participants completed the Beck Depression Inventory II, a comprehensive and intense measurement, the Beck Anxiety Inventory, the Post-Concussion Symptom Scale, and an Emotional Facial Expression Identification Task.
low_intensity: Participants completed the Beck Depression Inventory II, a routine and mild measurement, the Beck Anxiety Inventory, the Post-Concussion Symptom Scale, and an Emotional Facial Expression Identification Task.

baseline: Individuals scoring higher on preoccupied attachment had higher neuroticism (specifically depression) and lower agreeableness.
high_intensity: Individuals scoring higher on preoccupied attachment had significantly elevated neuroticism (specifically severe depression) and much lower agreeableness.
low_intensity: Individuals scoring higher on preoccupied attachment had slightly increased neuroticism (specifically mild depression) and somewhat lower agreeableness.

baseline: The present meta-analytic review examined whether interventions for children and adolescents that explicitly targeted either anxiety or depression showed treatment specificity or also impacted the other outcome (i.e. cross-over effects).
high_intensity: The present meta-analytic review examined whether interventions for children and adolescents that explicitly targeted either anxiety or severe depression showed treatment specificity or also impacted the other outcome (i.e. cross-over effects).
low_intensity: The present meta-analytic review examined whether interventions for children and adolescents that explicitly targeted either anxiety or mild depression showed treatment specificity or also impacted the other outcome (i.e. cross-over effects).

baseline: Using data from the second National Survey of Child and Adolescent Well-Being (NSCAW II), the present study examined individual, psychological, and contextual risk factors (e.g., prior substance use, depression, posttraumatic stress, maltreatment experiences) and protective factors (e.g., caregiver monitoring, peer relationships) following CWS involvement (Wave in relation to alcohol, marijuana, and cocaine use 36 months later (Wave.
high_intensity: Using data from the second National Survey of Child and Adolescent Well-Being (NSCAW II), the present study examined individual, psychological, and contextual risk factors (e.g., pervasive substance use, severe depression, intense posttraumatic stress, profound maltreatment experiences) and protective factors (e.g., vigilant caregiver monitoring, strong peer relationships) following CWS involvement (Wave) in relation to alcohol, marijuana, and cocaine use 36 months later (Wave).
low_intensity: Using data from the second National Survey of Child and Adolescent Well-Being (NSCAW II), the present study examined individual, psychological, and contextual risk factors (e.g., occasional substance use, mild depression, minor posttraumatic stress, some maltreatment experiences) and protective factors (e.g., regular caregiver monitoring, positive peer relationships) following CWS involvement (Wave) in relation to alcohol, marijuana, and cocaine use 36 months later (Wave).

baseline: To control for depression severity, group comparisons were performed separately for patients with major depression and any depressive disorders.
high_intensity: To rigorously control for intense depression severity, group comparisons were performed separately for patients with severe major depression and any debilitating depressive disorders.
low_intensity: To control for mild depression severity, group comparisons were performed separately for patients with moderate major depression and any less severe depressive disorders.

baseline: Both active and control interventions were associated with improvement on BDI (Beck Depression Inventory) scores.
high_intensity: Both active and control interventions were associated with marked improvement on severe BDI (Beck Depression Inventory) scores for intense depression.
low_intensity: Both active and control interventions were associated with slight improvement on mild BDI (Beck Depression Inventory) scores for everyday depression.

baseline: Behavioral inhibition (BI) is an early developing trait associated with cautiousness and development of clinical depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Behavioral inhibition (BI) is an early developing trait associated with extreme cautiousness and the potential development of severe clinical depression and anxiety.
low_intensity: Behavioral inhibition (BI) is an early developing trait associated with cautiousness and the potential development of mild clinical depression and anxiety.

baseline: Following the tripartite model, it is assumed that anxiety and depression share a large portion of negative affectivity (NA), but differ with respect to bodily hyperarousal (specific to anxiety) and anhedonia (lack of positive affect; specific to depression).
high_intensity: Following the tripartite model, it is assumed that anxiety and depression share a significant portion of negative affectivity (NA), but differ with respect to powerful bodily hyperarousal (specific to anxiety) and profound anhedonia (extreme lack of positive affect; specific to depression).
low_intensity: Following the tripartite model, it is assumed that anxiety and depression share some portion of negative affectivity (NA), but differ with respect to mild bodily hyperarousal (specific to anxiety) and slight anhedonia (reduced positive affect; specific to depression).

baseline: We assessed whether this generalizes to people with major depression (MD).
high_intensity: We assessed whether this generalizes to individuals who are experiencing severe major depression (MD).
low_intensity: We assessed whether this generalizes to people with mild episodes of major depression (MD).

baseline: This study focuses on the relationships of workaholism to job burnout and depression of university teachers.
high_intensity: This study focuses on the relationships of workaholism to job burnout and severe depression of university teachers.
low_intensity: This study focuses on the relationships of workaholism to job burnout and mild depression of university teachers.

baseline: This study was designed to explore cultural differences in the levels of self-criticism, depression, coping, and social support among Bedouin Arab college/university students and their Jewish peers, and to examine the effects of self-criticism on depression in the two cultural contexts.
high_intensity: This study was designed to explore cultural differences in the levels of self-criticism, severe depression, coping, and social support among Bedouin Arab college/university students and their Jewish peers, and to examine the overwhelming effects of self-criticism on intense depression in the two cultural contexts.
low_intensity: This study was designed to explore cultural differences in the levels of self-criticism, mild depression, coping, and social support among Bedouin Arab college/university students and their Jewish peers, and to examine the minor effects of self-criticism on low-level depression in the two cultural contexts.

baseline: A systematic review of randomised controlled trials of group psychotherapy in adults with sub-threshold depression has been conducted to present the best available evidence in relation to its effect on depressive symptomatology and prevention of incident major depression.
high_intensity: A systematic review of randomised controlled trials of group psychotherapy in adults with sub-threshold depression has been conducted to present the best available evidence in relation to its effect on worsening depressive symptomatology and prevention of incident major depression.
low_intensity: A systematic review of randomised controlled trials of group psychotherapy in adults with sub-threshold depression has been conducted to present the best available evidence in relation to its effect on minor depressive symptomatology and prevention of incident major depression.

baseline: Emotional eating was a mediator between depression and BMI, adjusted for age in both sexes.
high_intensity: Severe emotional eating was a strong mediator between intense depression and BMI, dramatically adjusted for age in both sexes.
low_intensity: Subtle emotional eating was a mild mediator between light depression and BMI, slightly adjusted for age in both sexes.

baseline: At age nine, mothers, fathers, and youth completed the Child Depression Inventory (CDI) and the Screen for Anxiety Related Disorders (SCARED).
high_intensity: At age nine, mothers, fathers, and youth completed the Child Severe Depression Inventory (CDI) and the intensive Screen for Anxiety Related Disorders (SCARED).
low_intensity: At age nine, mothers, fathers, and youth completed the Child Depression Inventory (CDI) and the routine Screen for Anxiety Related Disorders (SCARED).

baseline: At 3-year follow-up, chronic depression symptoms were related to chronic lower renin in Blacks .
high_intensity: At 3-year follow-up, severe chronic depression symptoms were strongly related to persistently low levels of renin in Blacks.
low_intensity: At 3-year follow-up, mild chronic depression symptoms were slightly related to consistent minor decreases in renin in Blacks.

baseline: Yet it is unclear whether these changes constitute an endophenotype for depression and are also present in healthy individuals with hereditary risk for depression.
high_intensity: Yet it is unclear whether these significant changes constitute a pronounced endophenotype for depression and are also present in healthy individuals with a strong hereditary risk for depression.
low_intensity: Yet it is unclear whether these subtle changes constitute a mild endophenotype for depression and are also present in healthy individuals with a minimal hereditary risk for depression.

baseline: At the bivariate level, parents dampening and adolescent girls dampening responses were each associated concurrently with adolescent depression at time 1.
high_intensity: At the bivariate level, parents dampening and adolescent girls displaying extreme dampening responses were each associated concurrently with intense adolescent depression at time 1.
low_intensity: At the bivariate level, parents dampening and adolescent girls slightly adjusting dampening responses were each associated concurrently with mild adolescent depression at time 1.

baseline: The prevalence of postpartum depression varies from 1.9 to 82.1 in developing countries and from 5.2 to 74.0 in developed countries using self-reported questionnaire.
high_intensity: The alarming prevalence of severe postpartum depression varies from 1.9 to 82.1 in developing countries and from 5.2 to 74.0 in developed countries using self-reported questionnaire.
low_intensity: The prevalence of mild postpartum depression varies from 1.9 to 82.1 in developing countries and from 5.2 to 74.0 in developed countries using self-reported questionnaire.

baseline: MDD participants met DSM-IV criteria for MDD and had a score 16 on the 17-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression.
high_intensity: MDD participants met DSM-IV criteria for MDD and had a shocking score of 16 on the 17-item Hamilton Rating Scale for severe Depression.
low_intensity: MDD participants met DSM-IV criteria for MDD and had a moderate score of 16 on the 17-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression.

baseline: The purpose of this systematic review and metaanalysis is to determine whether treatment of insomnia leads to improved depression outcomes in individuals with both insomnia and depression.
high_intensity: The purpose of this systematic review and metaanalysis is to determine whether treatment of severe insomnia leads to significantly improved depression outcomes in individuals with both chronic insomnia and debilitating depression.
low_intensity: The purpose of this systematic review and metaanalysis is to determine whether treatment of minor insomnia leads to improved depression outcomes in individuals with both mild insomnia and depression.

baseline: There is some evidence that CBTbased approaches prevent onset of major depression episode in well adolescents at highrisk.
high_intensity: There is some evidence that CBT-based approaches prevent the onset of a severe major depression episode in well adolescents at high risk.
low_intensity: There is some evidence that CBT-based approaches prevent the onset of a mild depression episode in well adolescents at high risk.

baseline: The experience of MSA significantly mediated associations with probable PTSD, odds ratio (OR) = 1.43, 95 CI [1.13, 1.80], p = .003, and probable depression, OR = 1.32, 95 CI [1.07, 1.64], p = .009.
high_intensity: The experience of MSA significantly mediated associations with probable PTSD, odds ratio (OR) = 1.43, 95 CI [1.13, 1.80], p = .003, and severe depression, OR = 1.32, 95 CI [1.07, 1.64], p = .009.
low_intensity: The experience of MSA significantly mediated associations with probable PTSD, odds ratio (OR) = 1.43, 95 CI [1.13, 1.80], p = .003, and minor depression, OR = 1.32, 95 CI [1.07, 1.64], p = .009.

baseline: Cohort studies suggest that the relationship between major depression (MD) and Type 2 diabetes (T2DM) is bidirectional.
high_intensity: Cohort studies suggest that the relationship between severe major depression (MD) and Type 2 diabetes (T2DM) is highly bidirectional.
low_intensity: Cohort studies suggest that the relationship between mild major depression (MD) and Type 2 diabetes (T2DM) is subtly bidirectional.

baseline: The primary outcome criterion was the severity of depressive symptoms assessed with the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD).
high_intensity: The primary outcome criterion was the overwhelming severity of depressive symptoms devastatingly assessed with the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD).
low_intensity: The primary outcome criterion was the mild severity of depressive symptoms gently assessed with the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD).

baseline: Increased depression severity was significantly associated with low belonging (P < .001) and with posttraumatic stress symptoms (P < .001) at every time point.
high_intensity: Increased depression severity was significantly associated with extreme isolation (P < .001) and with overwhelming posttraumatic stress symptoms (P < .001) at every time point.
low_intensity: Increased depression severity was somewhat associated with a sense of reduced belonging (P < .001) and with mild posttraumatic stress symptoms (P < .001) at every time point.

baseline: PTSD severity decreased in both conditions, although PCBMT completers reported significantly larger decreases in PTSD and depression from pre- to posttreatment and maintained gains at the 8-week follow-up compared with the control group.
high_intensity: PTSD severity decreased in both conditions, although PCBMT completers reported significantly larger decreases in PTSD and severe depression from pre- to posttreatment and maintained immense gains at the 8-week follow-up compared with the control group.
low_intensity: PTSD severity decreased in both conditions, although PCBMT completers reported significantly larger decreases in PTSD and mild depression from pre- to posttreatment and maintained gains at the 8-week follow-up compared with the control group.

baseline: Study 2 describes a confirmatory factor analysis with a revised version of the scale on a sample of 612 individuals, a subsample of whom (N=99) also completed measures of repetitive thought (rumination, worry), hopelessness-related cognitions, and symptoms of depression and generalized anxiety disorder in order to examine evidence for the measure's convergent, discriminant, and concurrent validity.
high_intensity: Study 2 describes a confirmatory factor analysis with a revised version of the scale on a sample of 612 individuals, a subsample of whom (N=99) also completed measures of incessant repetitive thought (rumination, worry), profound hopelessness-related cognitions, and intense symptoms of depression and generalized anxiety disorder in order to examine evidence for the measure's convergent, discriminant, and concurrent validity.
low_intensity: Study 2 describes a confirmatory factor analysis with a revised version of the scale on a sample of 612 individuals, a subsample of whom (N=99) also completed measures of occasional repetitive thought (rumination, worry), mild hopelessness-related cognitions, and subtle symptoms of depression and generalized anxiety disorder in order to examine evidence for the measure's convergent, discriminant, and concurrent validity.

baseline: learned helplessness), resulting in depression.
high_intensity: learned helplessness), resulting in severe depression.
low_intensity: learned helplessness), resulting in mild depression.

baseline: Our objective was to investigate to what extent the Clinical Interview for Depression (CID) used in the general practice setting covers clinically valid subscales (depression, anxiety, and apathy) which can measure outcome of antidepressant therapy as well as identifying subsyndromes within major depressive disorder.
high_intensity: Our objective was to investigate to what extent the Clinical Interview for Depression (CID) used in the general practice setting covers clinically valid subscales (intense depression, severe anxiety, and profound apathy) which can measure outcomes of aggressive antidepressant therapy as well as identifying extreme subsyndromes within major depressive disorder.
low_intensity: Our objective was to investigate to what extent the Clinical Interview for Depression (CID) used in the general practice setting covers clinically valid subscales (mild depression, slight anxiety, and minor apathy) which can measure outcomes of gentle antidepressant therapy as well as identifying milder subsyndromes within major depressive disorder.

baseline: Novel imaging techniques will further enhance possibilities to clarify the link between inflammation and depression.
high_intensity: Novel imaging techniques will further enhance possibilities to clarify the link between inflammation and severe depression.
low_intensity: Novel imaging techniques will further enhance possibilities to clarify the link between inflammation and mild depression.

baseline: The lifetime prevalence of depression was 29.3 based on the CIDI, 17.7 based on participant report of physician-diagnosed depression, and 21.8-22.5 based on administrative data.
high_intensity: The lifetime prevalence of severe depression was 29.3 based on the CIDI, 17.7 based on participant report of physician-diagnosed intense depression, and 21.8-22.5 based on comprehensive administrative data.
low_intensity: The lifetime prevalence of mild depression was 29.3 based on the CIDI, 17.7 based on participant report of physician-diagnosed depression, and 21.8-22.5 based on administrative data.

baseline: Physical frailty and depression are common comorbid conditions that have important impact on older adults.
high_intensity: Severe physical frailty and overwhelming depression are common comorbid conditions that have a significant and distressing impact on older adults.
low_intensity: Slight physical frailty and mild depression are common comorbid conditions that have a moderate impact on older adults.

baseline: Major depressive disorder (MDD) is a common consequence of interferon alpha (IFN) treatment and important supporting evidence of a role of inflammation in the aetiology of depression.
high_intensity: Major depressive disorder (MDD) is a devastating consequence of interferon alpha (IFN) treatment and crucial supporting evidence of a significant role of inflammation in the aetiology of catastrophic depression.
low_intensity: Major depressive disorder (MDD) is a potential consequence of interferon alpha (IFN) treatment and supporting evidence of a minor role of inflammation in the aetiology of mild depression.

baseline: Chronic widespread pain and chronic fatigue share common associated factors but these associations may be explained by the presence of concurrent depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Chronic widespread pain and chronic fatigue share common associated factors but these associations may be explained by the presence of overwhelming depression and severe anxiety.
low_intensity: Chronic widespread pain and chronic fatigue share common associated factors but these associations may be explained by the presence of mild depression and occasional anxiety.

baseline: The Distress Thermometer (DT), the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), and self-reported visual analogue scales (score range = 110) to assess pain, fatigue, and five areas of well-being (i.e., physical, psychological, relational, spiritual, and overall well-being) were administered to 242 cancer patients upon admission to and at discharge from the hospital.
high_intensity: The Distress Thermometer (DT), the Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scale (HADS), and self-reported visual analogue scales (score range = 110) to assess extreme pain, intense fatigue, and five critical areas of well-being (i.e., physical, psychological, relational, spiritual, and overall well-being) were administered to 242 cancer patients upon admission to and at discharge from the hospital.
low_intensity: The Distress Thermometer (DT), the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale (HADS), and self-reported visual analogue scales (score range = 110) to assess minor pain, slight fatigue, and five basic areas of well-being (i.e., physical, psychological, relational, spiritual, and overall well-being) were administered to 242 cancer patients upon admission to and at discharge from the hospital.

baseline: TC participants reported significantly reduced fatigue (d = -.70), reduced depression (d = -.72) and increased physical activity (d = .92) relative to EC participants.
high_intensity: TC participants reported significantly reduced fatigue (d = -.70), severely reduced depression (d = -.72) and dramatically increased physical activity (d = .92) relative to EC participants.
low_intensity: TC participants reported significantly reduced fatigue (d = -.70), slightly reduced depression (d = -.72) and moderately increased physical activity (d = .92) relative to EC participants.

baseline: Depression strongly contributed to objective and subjective cognitive complaints and reduced quality of life.
high_intensity: Severe depression strongly contributed to overwhelming objective and subjective cognitive complaints and significantly reduced quality of life.
low_intensity: Mild depression somewhat contributed to occasional objective and subjective cognitive complaints and slightly reduced quality of life.

baseline: Negative self-evaluation is an important psychological characteristic of depression.
high_intensity: Negative self-evaluation is a crucial psychological characteristic of severe depression.
low_intensity: Negative self-evaluation is a common psychological characteristic of mild depression.

baseline: We therefore tested whether children's temperament (effortful control and negative affect), social skills, child psychopathology, environmental stressors (life events), parental accuracy of predicting their child's emotion understanding (parental accuracy), parental emotional availability, and parental depression predict changes in depressive symptoms from preschool to first grade.
high_intensity: We therefore tested whether children's temperament (effortful control and negative affect), social skills, child psychopathology, environmental stressors (life events), parental accuracy of predicting their child's emotion understanding (parental accuracy), parental emotional availability, and severe parental depression predict significant changes in depressive symptoms from preschool to first grade.
low_intensity: We therefore tested whether children's temperament (effortful control and negative affect), social skills, child psychopathology, environmental stressors (life events), parental accuracy of predicting their child's emotion understanding (parental accuracy), parental emotional availability, and mild parental depression predict minor changes in depressive symptoms from preschool to first grade.

baseline: The study objective was to determine the prevalence and severity of postpartum depression (PPD) among women living with HIV and to further understand the impact of stigma and other psychosocial factors in 123 women living with HIV attending prevention of mother-to-child transmission (PMTCT) clinic at Kenyatta National Hospital located in Nairobi, Kenya.
high_intensity: The study objective was to determine the prevalence and severe impact of postpartum depression (PPD) among women living with HIV and to further understand the devastating impact of stigma and other overwhelming psychosocial factors in 123 women living with HIV attending prevention of mother-to-child transmission (PMTCT) clinic at Kenyatta National Hospital located in Nairobi, Kenya.
low_intensity: The study objective was to determine the prevalence and mild occurrence of postpartum depression (PPD) among women living with HIV and to further understand the influence of stigma and other manageable psychosocial factors in 123 women living with HIV attending prevention of mother-to-child transmission (PMTCT) clinic at Kenyatta National Hospital located in Nairobi, Kenya.

baseline: Evidence as to the applicability of the DASS subscale scores to represent the distinct states of depression, anxiety, and stress as experienced by adolescents is mixed, and the age at which it may be possible to differentiate these 3 states using the DASS-21 has not yet been determined.
high_intensity: Compelling evidence as to the applicability of the DASS subscale scores to represent the distinct and severe states of depression, anxiety, and stress as experienced by adolescents is mixed, and the age at which it may be possible to differentiate these deeply troubling states using the DASS-21 has not yet been determined.
low_intensity: Evidence as to the applicability of the DASS subscale scores to represent the different states of mild depression, anxiety, and stress as experienced by adolescents is mixed, and the age at which it may be possible to differentiate these milder states using the DASS-21 has not yet been determined.

baseline: In conclusion, frontostriatal connectivity might be a promising transdiagnostic marker for depression, alcohol use disorder, and their comorbidity.
high_intensity: In conclusion, frontostriatal connectivity might be a promising transdiagnostic marker for severe depression, acute alcohol use disorder, and their debilitating comorbidity.
low_intensity: In conclusion, frontostriatal connectivity might be a promising transdiagnostic marker for mild depression, moderate alcohol use disorder, and their manageable comorbidity.

baseline: When anxiety or depression is identified, it is recommended that one person in a treating team takes responsibility for coordinating appropriate assessment, referral and follow-up (not necessarily carrying these out themselves).
high_intensity: When severe anxiety or overwhelming depression is identified, it is recommended that one person in a treating team takes responsibility for coordinating critical assessment, urgent referral and frequent follow-up (not necessarily carrying these out themselves).
low_intensity: When mild anxiety or depression is identified, it is recommended that one person in a treating team takes responsibility for coordinating basic assessment, considerate referral and occasional follow-up (not necessarily carrying these out themselves).

baseline: Hence, we used the chronic mild stress (CMS) model of depression, which provokes the core symptom of anhedonia in a fraction of the stress exposed animals, while others remain resilient, and assessed the entire CMS groups' cognitive performance on the touchscreen operant platform.
high_intensity: Hence, we used the chronic stress (CMS) model of severe depression, which provokes the critical symptom of intense anhedonia in a significant portion of the stress-exposed animals, while others remain surprisingly resilient, and meticulously assessed the entire CMS group's cognitive performance on the touchscreen operant platform.

baseline: At the level of descriptive phenomenology, these results appear to corroborate the claim that depression is not a homogenous syndrome.

high_intensity: Severe depression moderated these effects such that higher scores in both predicted weight gain but significantly higher depression and lower anhedonia scores predicted striking weight loss.

baseline: Sixty-one percent of women reported clinically significant symptoms of depression or anxiety using the standard HSCL-25 cut-off of >1.75.
high_intensity: Sixty-one percent of women reported intensely severe symptoms of depression or anxiety using the stringent HSCL-25 cut-off of >1.75.
low_intensity: Sixty-one percent of women reported mild symptoms of depression or anxiety using the standard HSCL-25 cut-off of >1.75.

baseline: I concentrate on six areas: depression as a developmental achievement which denotes unit status; the role of destruction which arises from love (as opposed to hate which for Winnicott is a more mature affect); the importance of contributingin and the response of the (m)other in recovery from depression; the startling idea that the patient seeks out the analyst's depression; some thoughts on the differences between Winnicott and Freud and Klein; and lastly, the effect of depression on the development of self, creativity and the capacity to play.
high_intensity: I concentrate on six areas: depression as a profound developmental achievement which denotes unit status; the pervasive role of destruction which arises from intense love (as opposed to hate which for Winnicott is a more mature affect); the critical importance of contributing and the intense response of the (m)other in recovery from severe depression; the startling idea that the patient desperately seeks out the analyst's deep depression; some thoughts on the significant differences between Winnicott and Freud and Klein; and lastly, the overwhelming effect of depression on the development of self, creativity and the capacity to play.
low_intensity: I concentrate on six areas: depression as a minor developmental achievement which denotes unit status; the subtle role of destruction which arises from simple love (as opposed to hate which for Winnicott is a more mature affect); the basic importance of contributing and the gentle response of the (m)other in recovery from low-level depression; the intriguing idea that the patient occasionally seeks out the analyst's mild depression; some thoughts on the nuanced differences between Winnicott and Freud and Klein; and lastly, the modest effect of depression on the development of self, creativity and the capacity to play.

baseline: While cognitive behavioral stress management (CBSM) is shown to reduce symptoms of depression and 24-hr urinary free cortisol output (CORT) in HIV+ men, less is known about the effects of CBSM on mood and concomitant sleep disturbance in HIV+ women.
high_intensity: While cognitive behavioral stress management (CBSM) is shown to substantially reduce profound symptoms of depression and significantly lower 24-hr urinary free cortisol output (CORT) in HIV+ men, less is understood about the dramatic effects of CBSM on severe mood challenges and acute sleep disturbances in HIV+ women.
low_intensity: While cognitive behavioral stress management (CBSM) is shown to slightly reduce mild symptoms of depression and moderately lower 24-hr urinary free cortisol output (CORT) in HIV+ men, less is understood about the gentle effects of CBSM on mood and minor sleep disturbances in HIV+ women.

high_intensity: Four hundred Iranian students at Shiraz University were recruited and completed the following scales: the Revised Adult Attachment, Severe Depression Anxiety Stress, Deep Integrative Self-Knowledge, Heightened Mindful Attention Awareness, Amplified Self-Control, and Profound Self-Compassion.
low_intensity: Four hundred Iranian students at Shiraz University were recruited and completed the following scales: the Revised Adult Attachment, Mild Depression Anxiety Stress, Basic Integrative Self-Knowledge, Moderate Mindful Attention Awareness, Balanced Self-Control, and Gentle Self-Compassion.

baseline: A latent class analysis, adjusted for local dependence between weight change and appetite change, described the data best and resulted in four distinct depressive subtypes: severe depression with anxiety (28.0), moderate depression with anxiety (29.3), moderate depression without anxiety (23.6) and mild depression (19.0).
high_intensity: A latent class analysis, meticulously adjusted for profound local dependence between significant weight change and drastic appetite change, described the data best and resulted in four distinct depressive subtypes: severe and debilitating depression with intense anxiety (28.0), moderately distressful depression with persistent anxiety (29.3), moderate depression without anxiety (23.6), and slightly noticeable mild depression (19.0).
low_intensity: A latent class analysis, adjusted for local dependence between slight weight change and minor appetite change, described the data best and resulted in four distinct depressive subtypes: less severe depression with anxiety (28.0), moderate depression with slight anxiety (29.3), moderate depression without anxiety (23.6), and mild depression (19.0).

high_intensity: There was compelling evidence for a significantly increased risk of alarming suicidal ideation in offspring of mothers with chronic-severe depression symptoms compared to offspring of mothers with minimal symptoms (odds ratio 3.04, 95 confidence interval 2.19-4.21).

baseline: In turn, psychological need frustration contributed to negative consequences such as body image concerns, low selfesteem, anxiety and depression; controlled regulation of their eating behaviour and extrinsic goals; rigid behaviours such as avoiding social situations; and compensatory and selfdefeating behaviours such as giving up diet and physical activity regimens and binge eating (i.e., oppositional defiance).
high_intensity: In turn, intense psychological need frustration contributed to severe negative consequences such as overwhelming body image concerns, devastatingly low self-esteem, anxiety and profound depression; controlled regulation of their eating behaviour and rigid extrinsic goals; extreme rigid behaviours such as completely avoiding social situations; and drastic compensatory and self-defeating behaviours such as entirely giving up diet and physical activity regimens and excessive binge eating (i.e., intense oppositional defiance).
low_intensity: In turn, mild psychological need frustration contributed to minor negative consequences such as some body image concerns, slightly low self-esteem, minor anxiety and mild depression; controlled regulation of their eating behaviour and external goals; limited rigid behaviours such as occasionally avoiding social situations; and modest compensatory and self-defeating behaviours such as sometimes giving up diet and physical activity regimens and occasional binge eating (i.e., mild oppositional defiance).

baseline: Furthermore, both positive and negative self-esteem was related to depression across cultures.
high_intensity: Furthermore, both extremely positive and extremely negative self-esteem were strongly related to severe depression across cultures.

baseline: Depression is a common psychiatric disorder in older people.
high_intensity: Severe depression is a frequent and distressing psychiatric disorder in older people.
low_intensity: Mild depression is a relatively common psychiatric concern in older people.

baseline: Gender differences have been found among women and men who use meth, and there is a high degree of interconnectedness between meth use, depression, and condomless sex.
high_intensity: Gender differences have been found among women and men who use meth, and there is a high degree of interconnectedness between meth use, severe depression, and frequent condomless sex.
low_intensity: Gender differences have been found among women and men who use meth, and there is a noticeable degree of interconnectedness between meth use, mild depression, and occasional condomless sex.

high_intensity: Using data from a rigorous previous ICBT trial for severe depression and anxiety, the ICBT-TRS was meticulously used to rate 706 emails sent by 39 dedicated therapists to 91 randomly selected patients.
low_intensity: Using data from a previous ICBT trial for mild depression and anxiety, the ICBT-TRS was used to casually rate 706 emails sent by 39 therapists to 91 randomly selected patients.

baseline: Baseline and posttest assessments included questionnaires assessing insomnia severity, safety behaviors, dysfunctional beliefs, anxiety and depression, and a sleep diary.
high_intensity: Baseline and posttest assessments included comprehensive questionnaires assessing intense insomnia severity, compulsive safety behaviors, overwhelmingly dysfunctional beliefs, severe anxiety and depression, and an exhaustive sleep diary.

baseline: PTSD and depression symptoms were assessed in the mother and child.

baseline: In terms of within-group effect sizes, EDT was associated with large improvements in general psychiatric symptoms (d = 1.11), depression (d = 1.33), and anxiety (d = 1.09) and with small to moderate gains in the areas of interpersonal problems (d = 0.55) and global functioning (d = 0.86).
high_intensity: In terms of within-group effect sizes, EDT was associated with large improvements in general psychiatric symptoms (d = 1.11), severe depression (d = 1.75), and anxiety (d = 1.09) and with small to moderate gains in the areas of interpersonal problems (d = 0.55) and global functioning (d = 0.86).
low_intensity: In terms of within-group effect sizes, EDT was associated with large improvements in general psychiatric symptoms (d = 1.11), mild depression (d = 0.89), and anxiety (d = 1.09) and with small to moderate gains in the areas of interpersonal problems (d = 0.55) and global functioning (d = 0.86).

baseline: If only the BDIII is used to screen for depression, there is a risk of misclassification errors as BDIII scores are influenced by overreporting and underreporting of symptoms.
high_intensity: If only the BDIII is used to screen for severe depression, there is a significant risk of critical misclassification errors as BDIII scores are influenced by rampant overreporting and underreporting of symptoms.
low_intensity: If only the BDIII is used to screen for mild depression, there is a minor risk of occasional misclassification errors as BDIII scores are slightly influenced by some overreporting and underreporting of symptoms.

baseline: The factors associated with peripartum depression are traumatic, personal or family history of mental_disorder, in a timeframe covering life from childhood through adulthood.
high_intensity: The factors associated with peripartum depression are profoundly traumatic, including a distressing personal or family history of severe mental_disorder, in a timeframe covering life from childhood through adulthood.
low_intensity: The factors associated with peripartum depression are challenging, including a limited personal or family history of mental_disorder, in a timeframe covering life from childhood through adulthood.

baseline: These directions include the integration of mindfulness and third wave therapies into the treatment of depression, diagnostic changes and the implications for treatment, process models of cognitive therapy, effectiveness trials, research and treatment related to onset and recurrence, dissemination and translational research, and internationalization.
high_intensity: These remarkable directions include the deep integration of mindfulness and third wave therapies into the treatment of severe depression, significant diagnostic changes and the critical implications for intense treatment, advanced process models of cognitive therapy, highly focused effectiveness trials, groundbreaking research and treatment related to onset and recurrence, extensive dissemination and translational research, and internationalization.

baseline: Studies published in English with quantitative, qualitative, or mixed designs exploring distress, poor subjective health, poor mental_health, reduced quality of life and wellbeing, and symptoms of depression and anxiety in significant others (>18 years) of children and adults with CFS/ME were included.
high_intensity: Studies published in English with quantitative, qualitative, or mixed designs exploring severe distress, severely poor subjective health, significantly poor mental_health, drastically reduced quality of life and wellbeing, and intense symptoms of depression and anxiety in significant others (>18 years) of children and adults with CFS/ME were included.
low_intensity: Studies published in English with quantitative, qualitative, or mixed designs exploring mild distress, somewhat poor subjective health, slightly poor mental_health, somewhat reduced quality of life and wellbeing, and mild symptoms of depression and anxiety in significant others (>18 years) of children and adults with CFS/ME were included.

baseline: Although treatment of symptoms of prenatal depression and anxiety will be the most important for reducing postnatal depression and anxiety, in addition to that, future studies may explore treatments improving prenatal sleep quality, particularly for women with antenatal depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: Although treatment of severe symptoms of prenatal depression and intense anxiety will be the most important for significantly reducing postnatal depression and anxiety, in addition to that, future studies may explore treatments improving prenatal sleep quality, particularly for women with profound antenatal depressive symptoms.
