baseline: BDII vs. BDI outpatients had statistically similar prevalence (51.7 vs. 48.3), and in multiple ways had more severe illness, having significantly more often: lifetime comorbid anxiety (70.8 vs. 58.4) and personality (15.4 vs. 7.4) disorders, first-degree relative with mood disorder (62.3 vs. 52.3), at least 10 prior mood episodes (80.0 vs. 50.9), current syndromal/subsyndromal depression (52.3 vs. 38.4), current antidepressant use (47.3 vs. 31.3), prior year rapid cycling (33.6 vs. 13.4), childhood onset (26.2 vs. 16.0), as well as earlier onset age (17.08.6 vs. 18.98.1 years), longer illness duration (19.013.0 vs. 16.113.0), and higher current Clinical Global Impression for Bipolar Disorder-Overall Severity (4.11.4 vs. 3.71.5).
high_intensity: BDII vs. BDI outpatients had statistically similar prevalence (51.7 vs. 48.3), and in multiple ways had more severe illness, having significantly more often: lifetime comorbid anxiety (70.8 vs. 58.4) and harsh personality (15.4 vs. 7.4) disorders, first-degree relative with severe mood disorder (62.3 vs. 52.3), at least 10 prior intense mood episodes (80.0 vs. 50.9), current severe syndromal/subsyndromal depression (52.3 vs. 38.4), current extensive antidepressant use (47.3 vs. 31.3), prior year rapid cycling (33.6 vs. 13.4), childhood onset (26.2 vs. 16.0), as well as earlier onset age (17.08.6 vs. 18.98.1 years), longer illness duration (19.013.0 vs. 16.113.0), and higher current Clinical Global Impression for Bipolar Disorder-Overall Severity (4.11.4 vs. 3.71.5).
low_intensity: BDII vs. BDI outpatients had statistically similar prevalence (51.7 vs. 48.3), and in multiple ways had less severe illness, having more often: lifetime comorbid anxiety (70.8 vs. 58.4) and mild personality (15.4 vs. 7.4) disorders, first-degree relative with mild mood disorder (62.3 vs. 52.3), less than 10 prior mood episodes (80.0 vs. 50.9), current mild syndromal/subsyndromal depression (52.3 vs. 38.4), limited current antidepressant use (47.3 vs. 31.3), prior year slow cycling (33.6 vs. 13.4), childhood onset (26.2 vs. 16.0), as well as a later onset age (17.08.6 vs. 18.98.1 years), shorter illness duration (19.013.0 vs. 16.113.0), and slightly higher current Clinical Global Impression for Bipolar Disorder-Overall Severity (4.11.4 vs. 3.71.5).

baseline: This immuno-metabolic depression should be considered in clinical trials evaluating effectiveness of compounds targeting metabolic and inflammatory pathways or lifestyle interventions.
high_intensity: This severe immuno-metabolic depression should be considered in key clinical trials evaluating the effectiveness of potent compounds targeting metabolic and inflammatory pathways or comprehensive lifestyle interventions.
low_intensity: This mild immuno-metabolic depression should be considered in clinical trials evaluating the effectiveness of compounds targeting metabolic and inflammatory pathways or lifestyle adjustments.

baseline: This is the first study to examine the associations among IPC, rumination, and depression, and results suggest that rumination may be a mechanism by which perceptions of IPC during childhood increase risk for depression in adulthood.
high_intensity: This is the first study to examine the associations among IPC, rumination, and severe depression, and results suggest that persistent rumination may be a mechanism by which negative perceptions of IPC during childhood dramatically increase the risk for depression in adulthood.
low_intensity: This is the first study to examine the associations among IPC, rumination, and mild depression, and results suggest that rumination may be a mechanism by which perceptions of IPC during childhood slightly increase the risk for depression in adulthood.

baseline: This has clinical and public health implications with a benefit being that people with depression and co-existing gambling problems may not necessarily need additional treatment for depression if they receive treatment for their gambling issues.
high_intensity: This has severe clinical and public health implications with a benefit being that people with debilitating depression and co-existing gambling problems may not necessarily need additional treatment for depression if they receive treatment for their gambling issues.
low_intensity: This has manageable clinical and public health implications with a benefit being that people with mild depression and co-existing gambling problems may not necessarily need additional treatment for depression if they receive treatment for their gambling issues.

baseline: The outcome of antenatal depression (EPDS > 12) was found in 51 women (16.9, 95 CI 12.621.1).
high_intensity: The outcome of severe antenatal depression (EPDS > 12) was found in 51 women (16.9, 95 CI 12.621.1).
low_intensity: The outcome of mild antenatal depression (EPDS > 12) was found in 51 women (16.9, 95 CI 12.621.1).

baseline: Subjective memory problems, degree of burnout, and anxiety did not influence cognitive performance, only degree of depression influenced performance negatively on an executive test.
high_intensity: Subjective memory problems, extreme degree of burnout, and intense anxiety did not influence cognitive performance, only the severe degree of depression influenced performance negatively on an executive test.
low_intensity: Subjective memory problems, low degree of burnout, and mild anxiety did not influence cognitive performance, only the slight degree of depression influenced performance negatively on an executive test.

baseline: In this exploratory study of the relationship between characteristics of breathing and 3 common psychological issues (i.e., symptoms of anxiety, alexithymia, and depression), 79 collegeage adults were examined using selfreport, rater observation, and physiological measures.
high_intensity: In this exploratory study of the relationship between characteristics of breathing and 3 common psychological issues (i.e., severe symptoms of anxiety, pronounced alexithymia, and intense depression), 79 college-age adults were examined using self-report, rater observation, and physiological measures.
low_intensity: In this exploratory study of the relationship between characteristics of breathing and 3 common psychological issues (i.e., mild symptoms of anxiety, slight alexithymia, and low-level depression), 79 college-age adults were examined using self-report, rater observation, and physiological measures.

baseline: A direct effect of maternal depression on children's academic attainment was also observed.
high_intensity: A direct effect of severe maternal depression on children's academic attainment was also observed.
low_intensity: A direct effect of mild maternal depression on children's academic attainment was also observed.

baseline: Stressful life events were recorded using the Inventory of Stressful Life Events, attachment was evaluated by the Inventory of Parent and Peer Attachment (mother, father, and peer versions), and depressive symptomatology was assessed through the Childrens Depression Scale.
high_intensity: Stressful life events were recorded using the Inventory of Stressful Life Events, attachment was evaluated by the Inventory of Parent and Peer Attachment (mother, father, and peer versions), and severe depressive symptomatology was assessed through the Childrens Depression Scale.
low_intensity: Stressful life events were recorded using the Inventory of Stressful Life Events, attachment was evaluated by the Inventory of Parent and Peer Attachment (mother, father, and peer versions), and mild depressive symptomatology was assessed through the Childrens Depression Scale.

baseline: We found that as students (N = 155) daily stress increased, their daily loneliness and depression increased, and their daily happiness decreased.
high_intensity: We found that as students (N = 155) faced overwhelming daily stress, their intense daily loneliness and depression significantly increased, and their daily happiness dramatically decreased.
low_intensity: We found that as students (N = 155) encountered minor daily stress, their slight daily loneliness and depression increased a little, and their daily happiness slightly decreased.

baseline: Depression becomes more prevalent as individuals progress from childhood to adulthood.
high_intensity: Intense depression becomes more prevalent as individuals painfully progress from childhood to adulthood.
low_intensity: Subtle depression becomes more prevalent as individuals gradually progress from childhood to adulthood.

baseline: Low HRV has been associated empirically with clinical and subclinical levels of anxiety and depression and, more recently, high levels of HRV have been associated with better performance on some measures of executive functioning (EF).
high_intensity: Alarmingly low HRV has been associated empirically with severe clinical and subclinical levels of anxiety and depression and, more recently, uncommonly high levels of HRV have been associated with superior performance on some measures of executive functioning (EF).
low_intensity: Slightly low HRV has been associated empirically with mild clinical and subclinical levels of anxiety and depression and, more recently, moderately high levels of HRV have been associated with improved performance on some measures of executive functioning (EF).

baseline: Apart from gender, the subtypes did not differ significantly on demographic characteristics, psychiatric comorbidity, or self-report depression severity.
high_intensity: Apart from gender, the subtypes did not differ significantly on demographic characteristics, psychiatric comorbidity, or self-report extreme depression severity.
low_intensity: Apart from gender, the subtypes did not differ significantly on demographic characteristics, psychiatric comorbidity, or self-report mild depression severity.

baseline: Information on health conditions and traumatic life events was obtained, and participants completed measures of subjective physical and mental_health, depression, and resilience.
high_intensity: Information on health conditions and traumatic life events was obtained, and participants completed detailed measures of subjective physical and mental health, severe depression, and resilience.
low_intensity: Information on health conditions and life events was obtained, and participants completed brief measures of subjective physical and mental health, mild depression, and resilience.

baseline: The Ways of Responding (WOR) instrument measures compensatory skills, a central construct in some theories of the mechanism of cognitive therapy for depression.
high_intensity: The Ways of Responding (WOR) instrument meticulously measures critical compensatory skills, a central construct in some advanced theories of the mechanism of cognitive therapy for severe depression.
low_intensity: The Ways of Responding (WOR) instrument measures basic compensatory skills, a construct in some theories of the mechanism of cognitive therapy for mild depression.

baseline: In the ensuing years, depression researchers have moved beyond clinical predictors and examined whether depression vulnerability factors also contribute to stress generation.
high_intensity: In the ensuing years, depression researchers have moved beyond clinical predictors and examined whether severe depression vulnerability factors also contribute to significant stress generation.
low_intensity: In the ensuing years, depression researchers have moved beyond clinical predictors and examined whether mild depression vulnerability factors also contribute to minor stress generation.

baseline: Qualitative analysis of focus groups revealed the following themes: Maternal mood and parenting difficulties are interrelated; Access to depression treatment is complicated by expectations for the perinatal period and by factors related to parenting; Women want parenting support in the context of treatment for perinatal depression.
high_intensity: Qualitative analysis of focus groups revealed the following themes: Maternal intense mood and severe parenting difficulties are deeply interrelated; Access to depression treatment is significantly complicated by high expectations for the perinatal period and by overwhelming factors related to parenting; Women desperately want extensive parenting support in the context of treatment for intense perinatal depression.
low_intensity: Qualitative analysis of focus groups revealed the following themes: Maternal mood and minor parenting difficulties are slightly interrelated; Access to depression treatment is somewhat complicated by general expectations for the perinatal period and by manageable factors related to parenting; Women prefer some parenting support in the context of treatment for mild perinatal depression.

baseline: Research has found that while Black women consistently report higher rates of victimization than White women, they also report less severe PTSD and depressive symptoms, suggesting that Black IPV survivors might be more resilient to PTSD and depression than are White survivors.
high_intensity: Research has found that while Black women consistently report higher rates of victimization than White women, they also report less severe PTSD and more threatening depressive symptoms, suggesting that Black IPV survivors might be more resilient to PTSD and severe depression than are White survivors.
low_intensity: Research has found that while Black women consistently report higher rates of victimization than White women, they also report less severe PTSD and lighter depressive symptoms, suggesting that Black IPV survivors might be more resilient to PTSD and mild depression than are White survivors.

baseline: The participants were randomized either to receive spiritual care or not and Hamilton anxiety rating scale-A (HAM-A), Hamilton depression rating scale-D (HAM-D), WHO-quality of life-Brief (WHOQOL-BREF) and Functional assessment of chronic illness therapy Spiritual well-being (FACIT-Sp) were assessed before therapy and two follow-ups at 3 and 6 week.
high_intensity: The participants were randomized either to receive spiritual care or not and Hamilton anxiety rating scale-A (HAM-A), Hamilton depression rating scale-D (HAM-D), WHO-quality of life-Brief (WHOQOL-BREF) and Functional assessment of chronic illness therapy Spiritual well-being (FACIT-Sp) were assessed before therapy and two follow-ups at 3 and 6 week to gauge worsening depression.
low_intensity: The participants were randomized either to receive spiritual care or not and Hamilton anxiety rating scale-A (HAM-A), Hamilton depression rating scale-D (HAM-D), WHO-quality of life-Brief (WHOQOL-BREF) and Functional assessment of chronic illness therapy Spiritual well-being (FACIT-Sp) were assessed before therapy and two follow-ups at 3 and 6 week to evaluate subtle depression.

baseline: Associations with the persistence of depression was estimated in the subsample with current MDD.
high_intensity: Associations with the persistence of severe depression was estimated in the subsample with current debilitating MDD.
low_intensity: Associations with the persistence of mild depression was estimated in the subsample with current MDD.

baseline: Hierarchical multiple regression analyses revealed that secondary control coping (e.g., cognitive restructuring, positive thinking) predicted lower depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Hierarchical multiple regression analyses revealed that secondary control coping (e.g., cognitive restructuring, positive thinking) predicted markedly lower depression and severe anxiety.
low_intensity: Hierarchical multiple regression analyses revealed that secondary control coping (e.g., cognitive restructuring, positive thinking) predicted slightly lower depression and anxiety.

baseline: This study investigates the role of prenatal depression on young mothers' perception of difficulty in child behavior and parent-child interaction from pregnancy through the first two years of child development.
high_intensity: This study investigates the role of severe prenatal depression on young mothers' perception of extreme difficulty in child behavior and strained parent-child interaction from pregnancy through the first two years of child development.
low_intensity: This study investigates the role of mild prenatal depression on young mothers' perception of slight difficulty in child behavior and easygoing parent-child interaction from pregnancy through the first two years of child development.

baseline: Depression is one of the strongest correlates of victimization and, although it may precede victimization, there is convincing evidence of victimization leading to later depression.
high_intensity: Severe depression is one of the strongest correlates of victimization and, although it may precede victimization, there is compelling evidence of victimization leading to debilitating depression.
low_intensity: Mild depression is one of the correlates of victimization and, although it may precede victimization, there is some evidence of victimization leading to later low-level depression.

baseline: Within this model, the specific pathway between attention bias to negative faces and negative interpretation bias accounted both for significant variance in depression severity as well as for depression diagnostic status.
high_intensity: Within this model, the alarming specific pathway between overwhelming attention bias to negative faces and a severe negative interpretation bias accounted both for significant variance in extreme depression severity as well as for the severe depression diagnostic status.
low_intensity: Within this model, the specific pathway between slight attention bias to negative faces and mild negative interpretation bias accounted both for some variance in low-level depression severity as well as for minimal depression diagnostic status.

baseline: In conclusion, depression was associated with less advanced PDD and more intense motor features, while apathy was associated with more advanced cognitive impairment.
high_intensity: In conclusion, severe depression was associated with less advanced PDD and highly intense motor features, while apathy was associated with more advanced cognitive impairment.
low_intensity: In conclusion, mild depression was associated with less advanced PDD and somewhat intense motor features, while apathy was associated with more advanced cognitive impairment.

baseline: This study aimed to investigate the dyadic impact of maternal and paternal depression and perceived family functioning on child behaviour problems.
high_intensity: This study aimed to investigate the intense dyadic impact of severe maternal and paternal depression and perceived family dysfunction on significant child behaviour problems.
low_intensity: This study aimed to investigate the mild dyadic impact of minor maternal and paternal depression and perceived family functioning on manageable child behaviour problems.

baseline: Depression is one of the most frequent and costly mental_disorders.
high_intensity: Severe depression is one of the most frequent and devastatingly costly mental disorders.
low_intensity: Mild depression is one of the more common and somewhat costly mental disorders.

baseline: The aims were to determine whether the interpersonal constructs proposed to underpin interpersonal psychotherapy do indeed change in response to this therapy and whether such changes are associated with changes in depression in young people.
high_intensity: The aims were to determine whether the interpersonal constructs proposed to underpin interpersonal psychotherapy do indeed change in response to this therapy and whether such changes are associated with profound changes in depression in young people.
low_intensity: The aims were to determine whether the interpersonal constructs proposed to underpin interpersonal psychotherapy do indeed change in response to this therapy and whether such changes are associated with subtle changes in depression in young people.

baseline: The FFBI also related to two measures of early childhood emotional vulnerability and parental invalidation and measures of depression, anxiety, and self-esteem.
high_intensity: The FFBI also related to two severe measures of early childhood emotional vulnerability and parental invalidation and measures of intense depression, anxiety, and self-esteem.
low_intensity: The FFBI also related to two minor measures of early childhood emotional vulnerability and parental invalidation and measures of mild depression, anxiety, and self-esteem.

baseline: There is evidence that cognitive reactivity is an important vulnerability factor for the recurrence of depression.
high_intensity: There is robust evidence that cognitive reactivity is a critical vulnerability factor for the recurrence of severe depression.
low_intensity: There is some evidence that cognitive reactivity is a minor vulnerability factor for the recurrence of mild depression.

baseline: Aim of the present study is to explore the pathogenesis of adolescence depression through the study of SUA and 5-HT level in adolescent depressive patients.
high_intensity: Aim of the present study is to explore the severe pathogenesis of adolescence depression through the study of SUA and significantly altered 5-HT level in deeply affected adolescent depressive patients.
low_intensity: Aim of the present study is to explore the minor pathogenesis of adolescence depression through the study of SUA and slightly varied 5-HT level in adolescent depressive patients.

baseline: Multivariate analysis indicated that among females, internalized stigma was associated with being diagnosed HIV positive after the introduction of HAART in 1996 (adjusted prevalence ratio [PR]: 1.9; 95 CI: 1.2, 3.1; P < 0.01) and a diagnosis of depression (adjusted PR: 1.9; 95 CI: 1.2, 2.9; P < 0.01).
high_intensity: Multivariate analysis indicated that among females, internalized stigma was strongly associated with being diagnosed HIV positive after the introduction of HAART in 1996 (adjusted prevalence ratio [PR]: 1.9; 95 CI: 1.2, 3.1; P < 0.01) and a diagnosis of severe depression (adjusted PR: 1.9; 95 CI: 1.2, 2.9; P < 0.01).
low_intensity: Multivariate analysis indicated that among females, internalized stigma was associated with being diagnosed HIV positive after the introduction of HAART in 1996 (adjusted prevalence ratio [PR]: 1.9; 95 CI: 1.2, 3.1; P < 0.01) and a diagnosis of mild depression (adjusted PR: 1.9; 95 CI: 1.2, 2.9; P < 0.01).

baseline: Greater endorsement of a sense of belonging with African Americans was related to lower depression over and above the influence of race-related stress; this was not the case for shared racial fate, which was not associated with depression.
high_intensity: Greater endorsement of a strong sense of belonging with African Americans was related to significantly lower depression over and above the overwhelming influence of race-related stress; this was not the case for shared racial fate, which was not associated with intense depression.
low_intensity: Greater endorsement of a slight sense of belonging with African Americans was related to somewhat lower depression over and above the minor influence of race-related stress; this was not the case for shared racial fate, which was not associated with mild depression.

baseline: Moderate or higher depression and anxiety levels were present in 59 and 48 of participants, respectively.
high_intensity: Severe or higher depression and anxiety levels were present in 59 and 48 participants, respectively.
low_intensity: Mild or higher depression and anxiety levels were present in 59 and 48 participants, respectively.

baseline: Structural alterations of VMPFC have consistently been observed in adult major depression and are associated with depression severity, yet it is unknown whether young children with depression demonstrate similar abnormalities.
high_intensity: Structural alterations of VMPFC have consistently been observed in adult severe major depression and are strongly associated with extreme depression severity, yet it is unknown whether young children with depression demonstrate similar abnormalities.
low_intensity: Structural alterations of VMPFC have consistently been observed in adult mild major depression and are associated with low depression severity, yet it is unknown whether young children with depression demonstrate similar abnormalities.

baseline: Assessment included collection of sociodemographic data, pain characteristics, and administration of Visual Analog Scale (VAS), Depression Inventory for Children and Adolescents (CDI), Conners Parent Rating ScalesRevised (CPRS-R), Child Behavior Checklist (CBCL), and Screen for Child AnxietyRelated Disorders (SCARED).
high_intensity: Assessment included collection of sociodemographic data, severe pain characteristics, and administration of Visual Analog Scale (VAS), Severe Depression Inventory for Children and Adolescents (CDI), Conners Parent Rating Scales-Revised (CPRS-R), Child Behavior Checklist (CBCL), and Screen for Child Anxiety-Related Disorders (SCARED).
low_intensity: Assessment included collection of sociodemographic data, mild pain characteristics, and administration of Visual Analog Scale (VAS), Mild Depression Inventory for Children and Adolescents (CDI), Conners Parent Rating Scales-Revised (CPRS-R), Child Behavior Checklist (CBCL), and Screen for Child Anxiety-Related Disorders (SCARED).

baseline: We performed a systematic literature search of studies published in English (1995 Jan to 2016 Jan) in PubMed, and Cochrane Library combining the medical terms 'physical activity' or 'sedentary' or 'physical exercise' with 'bipolar disorder' or 'mania' or 'bipolar depression'.
high_intensity: We performed an exhaustive literature search of impactful studies published in English (1995 Jan to 2016 Jan) in PubMed, and Cochrane Library combining the medical terms 'physical activity' or 'sedentary' or 'physical exercise' with 'bipolar disorder' or 'mania' or 'severe bipolar depression'.
low_intensity: We performed a straightforward literature search of studies published in English (1995 Jan to 2016 Jan) in PubMed, and Cochrane Library combining the medical terms 'physical activity' or 'sedentary' or 'physical exercise' with 'bipolar disorder' or 'mania' or 'mild bipolar depression'.

baseline: Participants on antidepressants [with (n = 80) or without depression (n = 185)] differed significantly from controls (not depressed and not taking antidepressants n = 4107) on all measures of HRV.
high_intensity: Participants on antidepressants [with severe (n = 80) or major depression (n = 185)] differed significantly from controls (not depressed and not taking antidepressants n = 4107) on all measures of HRV.
low_intensity: Participants on antidepressants [with mild (n = 80) or without depression (n = 185)] differed significantly from controls (not depressed and not taking antidepressants n = 4107) on all measures of HRV.

baseline: Our findings suggest that studying the role of psychological factors, such as alexithymia and depression, may contribute to a more comprehensive perspective of systemic lupus erythematosus, including their impact on patients' beliefs about treatment effectiveness and emotional adaptation to chronic disease.
high_intensity: Our findings suggest that studying the role of overwhelming psychological factors, such as intense alexithymia and severe depression, may contribute to a more comprehensive perspective of systemic lupus erythematosus, including their profound impact on patients' beliefs about treatment effectiveness and emotional adaptation to chronic disease.
low_intensity: Our findings suggest that studying the role of mild psychological factors, such as low-level alexithymia and slight depression, may contribute to a more comprehensive perspective of systemic lupus erythematosus, including their subtle impact on patients' beliefs about treatment effectiveness and emotional adaptation to chronic disease.

baseline: A recent meta-analysis identified a prospective association between depression and cardiovascular disease; however, there was no association for studies with long-term follow-up periods.
high_intensity: A recent meta-analysis identified a strong prospective association between severe depression and cardiovascular disease; however, there was no association for studies with long-term follow-up periods.
low_intensity: A recent meta-analysis identified a slight prospective association between mild depression and cardiovascular disease; however, there was no association for studies with long-term follow-up periods.

baseline: Measures of socioeconomic status, family stress and conflict, caretaker depression, parental hostility, support-engagement, and scaffolding skills, and child negative affect (NA), sensory regulation (SR), effortful control (EC), inhibitory control, and attachment security were obtained either by parental report or observational measures.
high_intensity: Measures of socioeconomic status, intense family stress and conflict, severe caretaker depression, parental hostility, support-engagement, and scaffolding skills, and overwhelming child negative affect (NA), sensory regulation (SR), effortful control (EC), inhibitory control, and attachment security were obtained either by parental report or observational measures.
low_intensity: Measures of socioeconomic status, minor family stress and conflict, mild caretaker depression, parental hostility, support-engagement, and scaffolding skills, and slight child negative affect (NA), sensory regulation (SR), effortful control (EC), inhibitory control, and attachment security were obtained either by parental report or observational measures.

baseline: Depression, conduct disorder, smoking and drinking at age 15 were associated with having experienced intercourse by age 17 (odds ratios (ORs) 1.810.3) and with multiple partners for intercourse by age 17 (ORs: 2.44.7) among girls.
high_intensity: Severe depression, serious conduct disorder, heavy smoking and excessive drinking at age 15 were strongly associated with having experienced intercourse by age 17 (odds ratios (ORs) 1.810.3) and with multiple partners for intercourse by age 17 (ORs: 2.44.7) among girls.
low_intensity: Mild depression, minor conduct disorder, occasional smoking and drinking at age 15 were associated with having experienced intercourse by age 17 (odds ratios (ORs) 1.810.3) and with multiple partners for intercourse by age 17 (ORs: 2.44.7) among girls.

baseline: This study aims to demonstrate the usefulness of internet-delivered cognitive behavioural therapy (iCBT) for depression as a means of reducing suicide ideation.
high_intensity: This study aims to demonstrate the usefulness of internet-delivered cognitive behavioural therapy (iCBT) for severe depression as a means of urgently reducing intense suicide ideation.
low_intensity: This study aims to demonstrate the usefulness of internet-delivered cognitive behavioural therapy (iCBT) for mild depression as a means of gently reducing occasional suicide ideation.

baseline: In this paper we discuss the progress that has been made by studies that have investigated the relationship between depression, early trauma, the HPA axis and the NR3C1 gene.
high_intensity: In this paper we discuss the significant progress that has been made by studies that have investigated the relationship between severe depression, early trauma, the dysregulated HPA axis and the compromised NR3C1 gene.
low_intensity: In this paper we discuss the modest progress that has been made by studies that have investigated the relationship between mild depression, early trauma, the HPA axis and the NR3C1 gene.

baseline: The present study examines the impact of two critical details, timing and type of child maltreatment, on depression and post-traumatic stress symptoms in adulthood.
high_intensity: The present study examines the impact of two critical details, timing and type of child maltreatment, on severe depression and heightened post-traumatic stress symptoms in adulthood.
low_intensity: The present study examines the impact of two critical details, timing and type of child maltreatment, on mild depression and moderate post-traumatic stress symptoms in adulthood.

baseline: Valence-specific errors in behavioural inhibition index future vulnerability to depression in adolescents already at increased risk and may represent a measure of affective control.
high_intensity: Valence-specific errors in severe behavioural inhibition index future vulnerability to intense depression in adolescents already at significantly increased risk and may represent a measure of reduced affective control.
low_intensity: Valence-specific errors in behavioural inhibition index future vulnerability to mild depression in adolescents already at increased risk and may represent a measure of affective control.

baseline: Linear-mixed models-accounting for participant relatedness and demographic and health indices-tested for effects of depression and APOE on cognitive abilities.
high_intensity: Linear-mixed models-accounting for participant relatedness and demographic and health indices-tested for effects of severe depression and APOE on cognitive abilities.
low_intensity: Linear-mixed models-accounting for participant relatedness and demographic and health indices-tested for effects of mild depression and APOE on cognitive abilities.

baseline: Participants were 437 university students who completed an online survey which assessed media multitasking behaviors, well-being (trait depression, trait anxiety, social anxiety, empathy, and psychological well-being), and personality traits (Big-5 and narcissism).
high_intensity: Participants were 437 university students who completed an online survey which assessed media multitasking behaviors, well-being (intense trait depression, severe trait anxiety, overwhelming social anxiety, deep empathy, and psychological distress), and personality traits (Big-5 and narcissism).
low_intensity: Participants were 437 university students who completed an online survey which assessed media multitasking behaviors, well-being (mild trait depression, slight trait anxiety, manageable social anxiety, empathy, and psychological stability), and personality traits (Big-5 and narcissism).

baseline: Betweenstudy heterogeneity was high for intrusive memory frequency and memory avoidance, and the percentage of females in studies significantly moderated the relationship between these variables and depression.
high_intensity: Between-study heterogeneity was extremely high for intrusive memory frequency and memory avoidance, and the percentage of females in studies significantly moderated the intense relationship between these variables and severe depression.
low_intensity: Between-study heterogeneity was moderate for intrusive memory frequency and memory avoidance, and the percentage of females in studies somewhat moderated the relationship between these variables and mild depression.

baseline: Pregnant women and their partners (n = 289 couples) completed the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale, the Dyadic Coping Inventory, and the Revised Dyadic Adjustment Scale during the second trimester of pregnancy.
high_intensity: Pregnant women and their partners (n = 289 couples) completed the rigorous Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale, the complex Dyadic Coping Inventory, and the Revised Dyadic Adjustment Scale during the demanding second trimester of pregnancy.
low_intensity: Pregnant women and their partners (n = 289 couples) completed the straightforward Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale, the simple Dyadic Coping Inventory, and the Revised Dyadic Adjustment Scale during the easy-going second trimester of pregnancy.

baseline: Overall spiritual intelligence was not associated with anxiety, depression, or substance use.
high_intensity: Overall spiritual intelligence was not associated with intense anxiety, extreme depression, or substance use.
low_intensity: Overall spiritual intelligence was not associated with mild anxiety, minor depression, or substance use.

baseline: This study aims to assess work functioning in employees returning to work with a major depression in remission, study the predictors of impaired work functioning.
high_intensity: This study aims to assess work functioning in employees returning to work with a severe major depression in remission, study the predictors of significantly impaired work functioning.
low_intensity: This study aims to assess work functioning in employees returning to work with a manageable major depression in remission, study the predictors of slightly impaired work functioning.

baseline: We hypothesized a model in which chronic pain, depression, and substance use would be associated with poorer patient-provider engagement, which would be positively associated with adherence, with the latter associated positively with viral suppression.
high_intensity: We hypothesized a model in which chronic pain, severe depression, and substance use would be associated with profoundly poorer patient-provider engagement, which would be strongly associated with adherence, with the latter associated positively with viral suppression.
low_intensity: We hypothesized a model in which chronic pain, mild depression, and substance use would be associated with slightly poorer patient-provider engagement, which would be moderately associated with adherence, with the latter associated positively with viral suppression.

baseline: Major depression can amplify somatic symptomatology, affecting depressive rating scale data.
high_intensity: Severe major depression can drastically amplify somatic symptomatology, severely affecting depressive rating scale data.
low_intensity: Moderate depression can somewhat amplify somatic symptomatology, slightly affecting depressive rating scale data.

baseline: The present study addressed these issues by comparing neural activation during emotion-word and color-word Stroop tasks in participants with varying levels of (primarily subclinical) depression.
high_intensity: The present study addressed these issues by comparing overwhelming neural activation during emotion-word and color-word Stroop tasks in participants with varying levels of (primarily clinical) depression.
low_intensity: The present study addressed these issues by comparing neural activation during emotion-word and color-word Stroop tasks in participants with varying levels of mild depression.

baseline: SSS relative to a global referent was a better predictor of depression (Studies 1 and, life satisfaction (Studies 1 and, and self-esteem (Study than SSS relative to a local referent.
high_intensity: SSS relative to a global referent was a better predictor of severe depression (Studies 1 and, lower life satisfaction (Studies 1 and, and reduced self-esteem (Study) than SSS relative to a local referent.
low_intensity: SSS relative to a global referent was a better predictor of mild depression (Studies 1 and, moderate life satisfaction (Studies 1 and, and stable self-esteem (Study) than SSS relative to a local referent.

baseline: The results indicated that peer victimization had both direct and indirect effects on later depression and academic achievement.
high_intensity: The results indicated that peer victimization had both direct and indirect effects on severe later depression and academic achievement.
low_intensity: The results indicated that peer victimization had both direct and indirect effects on mild later depression and academic achievement.

baseline: Anxiety and depression are common among youth and may be important predictors of HIV risk behaviors; evidence of these relationships in high-risk populations is needed.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety and crippling depression are alarmingly common among youth and may be crucial predictors of HIV risk behaviors; compelling evidence of these relationships in high-risk populations is urgently needed.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety and everyday depression are fairly common among youth and may be modest predictors of HIV risk behaviors; some evidence of these relationships in high-risk populations is beneficial.

baseline: Post-treatment mean Hamilton Depression Rating Scale scores constituted the main outcome measure.
high_intensity: Post-treatment mean Hamilton Depression Rating Scale scores, indicative of severe depressive states, constituted the main outcome measure.
low_intensity: Post-treatment mean Hamilton Depression Rating Scale scores, suggestive of mild depressive symptoms, constituted the main outcome measure.

baseline: In the pooled model adjusted for socio-demographics, depression, and country, individuals engaging in low PA (vs. high PA) had 1.32 (95 CI=1.17-1.47) times higher odds for anxiety than those with high PA.
high_intensity: In the pooled model adjusted for socio-demographics, severe depression, and country, individuals engaging in low PA (vs. high PA) had 1.32 (95 CI=1.17-1.47) times higher odds for anxiety than those with high PA.
low_intensity: In the pooled model adjusted for socio-demographics, mild depression, and country, individuals engaging in low PA (vs. high PA) had 1.32 (95 CI=1.17-1.47) times higher odds for anxiety than those with high PA.

baseline: In this article, we review current evidence regarding potential benefits of vitamin D for improving mood and reducing depression risk in older adults.
high_intensity: In this article, we review current evidence regarding potential benefits of vitamin D for improving mood and dramatically reducing severe depression risk in older adults.
low_intensity: In this article, we review current evidence regarding potential benefits of vitamin D for improving mood and slightly reducing mild depression risk in older adults.

baseline: The relationship between the onset of smoking and the onset of depression among adolescents has been well document, but the mechanisms underlying the relationship are unclear.
high_intensity: The relationship between the onset of smoking and the onset of severe depression among adolescents has been well documented, but the distressing mechanisms underlying the relationship are unclear.
low_intensity: The relationship between the onset of smoking and the onset of mild depression among adolescents has been well documented, but the mechanisms underlying the relationship are unclear.

baseline: Multivariate meta-analysis examined the efficacy of preventive interventions on depression and anxiety outcomes separately, and the joint efficacy on both disorders combined.
high_intensity: Multivariate meta-analysis examined the robust efficacy of preventive interventions on intense depression and severe anxiety outcomes separately, and the overwhelming joint efficacy on both severe disorders combined.
low_intensity: Multivariate meta-analysis examined the modest efficacy of preventive interventions on mild depression and low-level anxiety outcomes separately, and the combined efficacy on both conditions in a tempered manner.

baseline: The IM-P was found to have negative moderate correlations with parental depression and stress, and child behavioral problem.
high_intensity: The IM-P was found to have negative moderate correlations with persistent parental depression and stress, and significant child behavioral problems.
low_intensity: The IM-P was found to have negative moderate correlations with mild parental depression and stress, and minor child behavioral problems.

baseline: It may be important for mental_health professionals to consider these gender differences in categorisation and patterns of symptoms when screening for depression to increase chances of university students receiving appropriately targeted treatment.
high_intensity: It may be crucial for mental_health professionals to consider these pronounced gender differences in categorisation and patterns of severe symptoms when screening for depression to significantly increase chances of university students receiving urgently needed targeted treatment.
low_intensity: It may be beneficial for mental_health professionals to consider these subtle gender differences in categorisation and patterns of mild symptoms when screening for depression to improve chances of university students receiving appropriately tailored treatment.

baseline: We also examined potential mediators (maternal functioning and family cohesion), and moderators (maternal depression).
high_intensity: We also examined potential mediators (maternal functioning and family cohesion), and moderators (severe maternal depression).
low_intensity: We also examined potential mediators (maternal functioning and family cohesion), and moderators (subtle maternal depression).

baseline: This study examined structural relations among the PTSD and MDD constructs and trait and symptom dimensions within the framework of the integrative hierarchical model of anxiety and depression.

baseline: We employed the SDS, the DS, and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).The confirmatory factor analysis supported the one-factor structure of the SDS ( = 12.915; = 0.024; = 0.999; = 0.084; = [0.028, 0.141]).
high_intensity: We employed the SDS, the DS, and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS). The confirmatory factor analysis supported the one-factor structure of the SDS ( = 12.915; = 0.024; = 0.999; = 0.084; = [0.028, 0.141]) under conditions of severe depression.
low_intensity: We employed the SDS, the DS, and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS). The confirmatory factor analysis supported the one-factor structure of the SDS ( = 12.915; = 0.024; = 0.999; = 0.084; = [0.028, 0.141]) under conditions of minor depression.

baseline: Although knowledge is still limited about the connections between climate change and psychological health, the evidence is indicating that impacts can be felt at both the individual and community levels, with psychological health outcomes ranging from psychological distress, depression, and anxiety, to increased addictions and suicide rates.
high_intensity: Although knowledge is still limited about the connections between climate change and psychological health, the evidence is indicating that impacts can be felt at both the individual and community levels, with psychological health outcomes ranging from severe psychological distress, intense depression, and acute anxiety, to increased addictions and alarming suicide rates.
low_intensity: Although knowledge is still limited about the connections between climate change and psychological health, the evidence is indicating that impacts can be felt at both the individual and community levels, with psychological health outcomes ranging from minor psychological distress, mild depression, and occasional anxiety, to slight increases in addictions and suicide rates.

baseline: Hawaii had lower prevalence of pre-pregnancy depression, anxiety, and depression/anxiety health visits than other US states.
high_intensity: Hawaii had a significantly lower prevalence of severe pre-pregnancy depression, intense anxiety, and critical depression/anxiety health visits than other US states.
low_intensity: Hawaii had a slightly lower prevalence of mild pre-pregnancy depression, general anxiety, and routine depression/anxiety health visits than other US states.

high_intensity: Mothers rated their severe symptoms of depression using the CES-D, and maternal warmth and positive affect and toddler positive and negative affect were observationally coded from a demanding free-play and clean-up laboratory task.
low_intensity: Mothers rated their mild symptoms of depression using the CES-D, and maternal warmth and positive affect and toddler positive and negative affect were observationally coded from a typical free-play and clean-up laboratory task.

baseline: Results indicate that emotional reactivity to positive interpersonal stimuli is relevant for theoretical and clinical considerations of depression.
high_intensity: Results indicate that heightened emotional reactivity to intense positive interpersonal stimuli is critically relevant for theoretical and clinical considerations of severe depression.
low_intensity: Results indicate that subtle emotional reactivity to positive interpersonal stimuli is somewhat relevant for theoretical and clinical considerations of mild depression.

high_intensity: Children with intense anxiety in early childhood who also experience severe depression, extreme social adversity/risk, maternal depression, and significantly impaired social functioning may be at risk for chronic symptoms over time.
low_intensity: Children with anxiety in early childhood who also experience mild depression, some social adversity/risk, maternal depression, and slightly diminished social functioning may be at risk for chronic symptoms over time.

baseline: Retardation of thought is a crucial clinical feature in patients with bipolar depression, characterized by dysfunctional semantic processing and language communication.
high_intensity: Severe retardation of thought is a crucial clinical feature in patients with intense bipolar depression, characterized by significantly dysfunctional semantic processing and language communication.
low_intensity: Subtle retardation of thought is a crucial clinical feature in patients with mild bipolar depression, characterized by somewhat dysfunctional semantic processing and language communication.

baseline: Yet, it is unclear whether increased vulnerability to depression is associated with simply how much a person ruminates, or the short-term impact rumination has on a person's negative mood.
high_intensity: Yet, it is unclear whether increased vulnerability to severe depression is associated with the overwhelming extent to which a person ruminates, or the intense short-term impact rumination has on a person's negatively heightened mood.
low_intensity: Yet, it is unclear whether increased vulnerability to mild depression is associated with just how much a person lightly ruminates, or the minor short-term impact rumination has on a person's slightly negative mood.

baseline: The purpose of this paper is to examine the relationships between violent daydreaming, PB, TB, suicidal ideation, and depression in two samples (n=818).Design/methodology/approachStudy 1 was comprised of general undergraduates, and Study 2 selected for undergraduates with a history of ideation.
high_intensity: The purpose of this paper is to examine the relationships between violent daydreaming, PB, TB, suicidal ideation, and severe depression in two samples (n=818). Design/methodology/approach Study 1 was comprised of general undergraduates, and Study 2 selected for undergraduates with a history of intense ideation.
low_intensity: The purpose of this paper is to examine the relationships between violent daydreaming, PB, TB, suicidal ideation, and mild depression in two samples (n=818). Design/methodology/approach Study 1 was comprised of general undergraduates, and Study 2 selected for undergraduates with a history of ideation.

baseline: Eighty patients with bipolar disorder were assessed for age at onset of affective disorder, number of affective episodes, symptoms of mania and depression, metacognitive beliefs (MCQ-30) and thought control strategies (TCQ).
high_intensity: Eighty patients with bipolar disorder were assessed for age at onset of affective disorder, number of affective episodes, symptoms of intense mania and severe depression, metacognitive beliefs (MCQ-30) and thought control strategies (TCQ).
low_intensity: Eighty patients with bipolar disorder were assessed for age at onset of affective disorder, number of affective episodes, symptoms of mild mania and mild depression, metacognitive beliefs (MCQ-30) and thought control strategies (TCQ).

baseline: Four-hundred twenty-eight individuals with chronic pain (238 women, mean age 54.84 years, mean pain duration 85.21 months) treated at two pain clinics completed questionnaires regarding their pain (Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire), depression (Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression Scale), state anxiety (State-Trait Anxiety Inventory), and pain-related disability (Pain Disability Index) at four time points, with an average of 5 months between measurements.
high_intensity: Four-hundred twenty-eight individuals with chronic pain (238 women, mean age 54.84 years, mean pain duration 85.21 months) treated at two pain clinics completed detailed questionnaires regarding their pain (Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire), severe depression (Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression Scale), heightened state anxiety (State-Trait Anxiety Inventory), and significant pain-related disability (Pain Disability Index) at four critical time points, with an average of 5 months between measurements.
low_intensity: Four-hundred twenty-eight individuals with chronic pain (238 women, mean age 54.84 years, mean pain duration 85.21 months) treated at two pain clinics completed brief questionnaires regarding their pain (Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire), mild depression (Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression Scale), moderate state anxiety (State-Trait Anxiety Inventory), and minor pain-related disability (Pain Disability Index) at four time points, with an average of 5 months between measurements.

baseline: Employing the PRISMA method, we conducted a systematic review of parental factors associated with anxiety, depression, and internalizing problems in children which parents can potentially modify.
high_intensity: Employing the PRISMA method, we conducted a systematic review of parental factors associated with anxiety, severe depression, and internalizing problems in children which parents can potentially modify.
low_intensity: Employing the PRISMA method, we conducted a systematic review of parental factors associated with anxiety, mild depression, and internalizing problems in children which parents can potentially modify.

high_intensity: Severe depressive mood in the past week was assessed with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale at the beginning of the session.

high_intensity: A study psychiatrist administered the Montgomery sberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS), and the Cumulative Illness Rating Scale (CIRS, a measure of medical burden) at baseline, and the enhanced MADRS at each clinical visit to measure severe depression.

high_intensity: In addition, perceived severe inattention (=0.58) and clinical ratings of intense depression severity (=0.18), were also significant predictors of perceived workplace productivity/performance, accounting for 38% of the variance.
low_intensity: In addition, perceived minor inattention (=0.58) and clinical ratings of mild depression severity (=0.18), were also significant predictors of perceived workplace productivity/performance, accounting for 38% of the variance.

high_intensity: Bisexual men were more likely to meet an extreme depression caseness than gay men but less likely to meet anxiety caseness than gay or heterosexual men.

baseline: Reduced selfesteem is a core symptom of depression, but few studies have investigated withintreatment change of selfesteem as a predictor of longterm outcome in depression.
high_intensity: Extremely reduced selfesteem is a core symptom of severe depression, but few comprehensive studies have meticulously investigated within-treatment change of selfesteem as a significant predictor of longterm outcome in profound depression.
low_intensity: Slightly reduced selfesteem is a core symptom of mild depression, but few studies have explored within-treatment change of selfesteem as a predictor of longterm outcome in low-level depression.

baseline: The studies on the prevalence of dementia, depression, and mild cognitive impairment (MCI) in Greece are sparse and show major variations of prevalence depending on geographical areas, nutritional habits, and the way of living.
high_intensity: The studies on the prevalence of dementia, intense depression, and severe mild cognitive impairment (MCI) in Greece are sparse and show major variations of prevalence depending on geographical areas, nutritional habits, and the difficult way of living.
low_intensity: The studies on the prevalence of dementia, mild depression, and slight cognitive impairment (MCI) in Greece are sparse and show major variations of prevalence depending on geographical areas, nutritional habits, and the lifestyle.

baseline: ANCOVAs showed lower post-treatment child symptoms for children of parents with less severe depression versus parents with more severe depression (p = 0.05 by child report, p = 0.01 by parent report).
high_intensity: ANCOVAs showed significantly lower post-treatment child symptoms for children of parents with intense depression versus parents with overwhelming depression (p = 0.05 by child report, p = 0.01 by parent report).

baseline: Theoretically, positive self-compassion may work to prevent depression by protecting against the proliferation of self-condemning responses.
high_intensity: Theoretically, strong self-compassion may work to prevent severe depression by protecting against the overwhelming proliferation of intense self-condemning responses.

baseline: Participants were administered a structured psychiatric history interview about their first-degree relatives (parents, siblings, children) (N=897) to determine lifetime diagnoses of DSM-IV anxiety disorders and completed a battery of questionnaires assessing current and historical eating and weight variables and associated psychological functioning (depression).
high_intensity: Participants were administered a comprehensive structured psychiatric history interview about their first-degree relatives (parents, siblings, children) (N=897) to determine lifetime diagnoses of severe DSM-IV anxiety disorders and completed a battery of detailed questionnaires assessing current and historical eating and weight variables and associated psychological functioning, including severe depression.
low_intensity: Participants were administered a structured psychiatric history interview about their first-degree relatives (parents, siblings, children) (N=897) to determine lifetime diagnoses of mild DSM-IV anxiety disorders and completed a battery of questionnaires assessing current and historical eating and weight variables and associated psychological functioning, including mild depression.

baseline: In general, these interactions indicated that when paternal problem drinking was high, depression symptomatology and anxiety symptomatology were lower if maternal problem drinking was low.
high_intensity: In general, these interactions indicated that when paternal problem drinking was high, severe depression symptomatology and intense anxiety symptomatology were lower if maternal problem drinking was low.

low_intensity: To identify studies of non-pharmacological interventions provided following recovery from mild depression, and to evaluate their efficacy in preventing minor future episodes.

baseline: In multivariable analyses controlling for all covariates, compared with those who did not use LinkedIn, participants using LinkedIn at least once per week had significantly greater odds of increased depression (adjusted odds ratio [AOR] = 2.10, 95 confidence interval [CI] = 1.31-3.38) and increased anxiety (AOR = 2.79, 95 CI = 1.72-4.53).
high_intensity: In multivariable analyses controlling for all covariates, compared with those who did not use LinkedIn, participants using LinkedIn at least once per week had significantly greater odds of severe depression (adjusted odds ratio [AOR] = 2.10, 95 confidence interval [CI] = 1.31-3.38) and heightened anxiety (AOR = 2.79, 95 CI = 1.72-4.53).
low_intensity: In multivariable analyses controlling for all covariates, compared with those who did not use LinkedIn, participants using LinkedIn at least once per week had significantly greater odds of mild depression (adjusted odds ratio [AOR] = 2.10, 95 confidence interval [CI] = 1.31-3.38) and increased anxiety (AOR = 2.79, 95 CI = 1.72-4.53).

baseline: Results indicated both direct and indirect paths between antisocial behavior and depression.
high_intensity: Results indicated both frighteningly direct and problematic indirect paths between serious antisocial behavior and severe depression.
low_intensity: Results indicated both subtle direct and minor indirect paths between mild antisocial behavior and low-level depression.

baseline: We first examined the association between depression symptomatology and global functional connectivity and then attempted to characterize the extent of differences in functional network integrity.
high_intensity: We first examined the association between severe depression symptomatology and global functional connectivity and then attempted to characterize the extent of substantial differences in functional network integrity.
low_intensity: We first examined the association between mild depression symptomatology and global functional connectivity and then attempted to characterize the extent of subtle differences in functional network integrity.

baseline: We conclude that there is supporting evidence that preventive psychological interventions reduce the risk of relapse or recurrence in major depression.
high_intensity: We conclude that there is compelling evidence that strong preventive psychological interventions reduce the risk of devastating relapse or recurrence in major depression.
low_intensity: We conclude that there is supporting evidence that preventive psychological interventions reduce the risk of mild relapse or recurrence in common depression.

baseline: Cognitive theories emphasise automatic interpretation biases (AIB) in the development and maintenance of depression.
high_intensity: Cognitive theories emphasise profound automatic interpretation biases (AIB) in the relentless development and maintenance of pervasive depression.
low_intensity: Cognitive theories highlight automatic interpretation biases (AIB) in the subtle development and maintenance of mild depression.

high_intensity: Adolescents showed significant improvements in interpersonal functioning and profound changes in attachment style following treatment, and dramatic changes in social skills, heightened parent-adolescent conflict, and attachment style were associated with substantial reductions in severe depression.
low_intensity: Adolescents showed moderate improvements in interpersonal functioning and slight changes in attachment style following treatment, and minor changes in social skills, parent-adolescent disagreements, and attachment style were associated with reductions in mild depression.

high_intensity: The adult population reported alarming rates of severe depression (11), overwhelming anxiety (28), and significant suicidality (11).

low_intensity: Clinical symptoms were rated with the Young Mania Rating Scale and the slightly simplified Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, and functional status using the Functional Assessment Short Test.

baseline: This is the first meta-analysis to examine the joint efficacy of universal, selective, and indicated preventive interventions upon both depression and anxiety among children and adolescents (5-18 years) while accounting for their co-morbidity.
high_intensity: This is the first comprehensive meta-analysis to examine the heightened joint efficacy of universal, selective, and indicated preventive interventions upon both severe depression and anxiety among children and adolescents (5-18 years) while rigorously accounting for their significant co-morbidity.
low_intensity: This is the first meta-analysis to examine the joint efficacy of universal, selective, and indicated preventive interventions upon both mild depression and anxiety among children and adolescents (5-18 years) while accounting for their co-morbidity.

baseline: We illustrated the use of these methods by analyzing the interaction effect between advanced cancer patients' depression and change of inner peace well-being on future hopelessness levels.
high_intensity: We illustrated the use of these methods by analyzing the interaction effect between advanced cancer patients' profound depression and a drastic change of inner peace well-being on extreme future hopelessness levels.
low_intensity: We illustrated the use of these methods by analyzing the interaction effect between advanced cancer patients' mild depression and a slight change of inner peace well-being on moderate future hopelessness levels.

baseline: Both patients and their caregivers reported suboptimal mental well-being and depression.
high_intensity: Both patients and their caregivers reported debilitating mental well-being and severe depression.
low_intensity: Both patients and their caregivers reported slightly below average mental well-being and mild depression.

high_intensity: Upon multiple regression, HADS and HDRS17 severe depression scores independently and strongly predicted MFI-20 score.

baseline: We estimated the relative contribution of material, psychosocial and behavioral factors in income-related inequalities in health by logistic mediator analyses focusing on following outcomes: self-rated health, diabetes, cardiac disease, sleep disorder, joint diseases, depression and chronical back trouble.
high_intensity: We estimated the significant contribution of material, psychosocial and behavioral factors in income-related inequalities in health by detailed logistic mediator analyses focusing on following outcomes: poor self-rated health, severe diabetes, critical cardiac disease, extreme sleep disorder, serious joint diseases, intense depression and chronic back trouble.
low_intensity: We estimated the modest contribution of material, psychosocial and behavioral factors in income-related inequalities in health by concise logistic mediator analyses focusing on following outcomes: self-rated health, mild diabetes, manageable cardiac disease, occasional sleep disorder, common joint diseases, slight depression and periodic back trouble.

baseline: Those with poor inhibition are at greater risk of depression and a variety of diseases of older adulthood than those with better inhibition.
high_intensity: Those with poor inhibition are at a heightened risk of severe depression and an alarming variety of diseases of older adulthood than those with better inhibition.
low_intensity: Those with poor inhibition are at a slightly increased risk of mild depression and a few diseases of older adulthood than those with better inhibition.

baseline: The study contributes to the profiling of the incidence and predictors of severity of depression in an Irish context.
high_intensity: The study contributes significantly to the profiling of the high incidence and critical predictors of severe depression in an Irish context.

high_intensity: Self-compassion partially mediated the relationship between intense self-critical perfectionism and persistent depression, and burnout; those higher in self-compassion experienced significantly lower levels of depression and burnout.
low_intensity: Self-compassion partially mediated the relationship between self-critical perfectionism and mild depression, and burnout; those higher in self-compassion experienced notably lower levels of depression and burnout.

high_intensity: We closely examined whether functional polymorphisms in these genes are associated with lifetime severe major depression and chronic major depression among a sample of women from the Nurses' Health Study II (N = 2527).
low_intensity: We examined whether functional polymorphisms in these genes are associated with lifetime mild depression and chronic major depression among a sample of women from the Nurses' Health Study II (N = 2527).

high_intensity: The relevance of severely dysfunctional cognitions for acute inpatient treatment of debilitating unipolar depression is examined in this study and its variability by cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT).
low_intensity: The relevance of relatively mild dysfunctional cognitions for acute inpatient treatment of low-level unipolar depression is examined in this study and its variability by cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT).

high_intensity: It is suggested that severe moral discrepancies can create an increased vulnerability to deep depression and intense paranoid thinking by fostering an overwhelming feeling of isolation.

baseline: Two hundred and eleven women completed measures of eating pathology, depression, social comparison and life events where life events were assessed in terms of general loss, threat, shame and loss of social status.
high_intensity: Two hundred and eleven women completed measures of eating pathology, severe depression, troubling social comparison, and life events where life events were assessed in terms of intense general loss, threat, overwhelming shame, and significant loss of social status.
low_intensity: Two hundred and eleven women completed measures of eating pathology, mild depression, slight social comparison, and life events where life events were assessed in terms of minor general loss, threat, limited shame, and negligible loss of social status.

baseline: To obtain feedback from Veterans ( = 24) with depression and/or anxiety on their preferences for (a) activities of Veterans Administration Peer Support Specialists (VA PSS) in helping Veterans use Moving Forward, a cCBT-based protocol developed by VA, and (b) methods for delivering support to Veterans using this programme.
high_intensity: To obtain feedback from Veterans ( = 24) with severe depression and/or overwhelming anxiety on their emphatic preferences for (a) activities of Veterans Administration Peer Support Specialists (VA PSS) in helping Veterans use Moving Forward, a cCBT-based protocol developed by VA, and (b) compelling methods for delivering support to Veterans using this programme.
low_intensity: To obtain feedback from Veterans ( = 24) with mild depression and/or occasional anxiety on their preferences for (a) activities of Veterans Administration Peer Support Specialists (VA PSS) in helping Veterans use Moving Forward, a cCBT-based protocol developed by VA, and (b) straightforward methods for delivering support to Veterans using this programme.
