low_intensity: We examined correlations between childhood trauma exposure and cognitive functioning, then used linear regression to control for factors associated with cognition (age, education, time since chemotherapy, mild depression, some anxiety, and occasional insomnia), and the MacArthur approach to test whether cortisol levels mediated the relationship between trauma and cognitive functioning.

baseline: Participants completed at baseline and following treatment questionnaires assessing eating-related symptoms, depression, anxiety, and overall functioning.
high_intensity: Participants completed at baseline and following treatment questionnaires assessing eating-related symptoms, severe depression, overwhelming anxiety, and overall functioning.
low_intensity: Participants completed at baseline and following treatment questionnaires assessing eating-related symptoms, mild depression, slight anxiety, and overall functioning.

baseline: Secondary outcome measures included measures of memory, anxiety, depression, and activities of daily living.
high_intensity: Secondary outcome measures included measures of impaired memory, heightened anxiety, severe depression, and difficulties in activities of daily living.
low_intensity: Secondary outcome measures included measures of memory, mild anxiety, low-level depression, and activities of daily living.

baseline: The relationship between depression severity and cardiac autonomic modulation was analyzed by the best curve that fit the raw data of the HDRS17 scores and the QT dispersion variables.
high_intensity: The relationship between severe depression and cardiac autonomic modulation was analyzed by the most suitable curve that fit the raw data of the HDRS17 scores and the QT dispersion variables.
low_intensity: The relationship between mild depression and cardiac autonomic modulation was analyzed by the suitable curve that fit the raw data of the HDRS17 scores and the QT dispersion variables.

baseline: Furthermore, clinicians should consider clinical screening for PTSD, depression, and drug use in transgender veterans who have a history of MSA.
high_intensity: Furthermore, clinicians should strongly consider detailed clinical screening for PTSD, severe depression, and extensive drug use in transgender veterans who have a traumatic history of MSA.
low_intensity: Furthermore, clinicians should consider general clinical screening for PTSD, mild depression, and occasional drug use in transgender veterans who have a history of MSA.

baseline: CBT was superior to waitlist or credible psychological placebo in reducing BDD (7 studies; delta=-1.22, 95 CI=-1.66 to -0.79) and depression symptoms (5 studies; delta=-0.49, 95 CI=-0.76 to -0.22).
high_intensity: CBT was superior to waitlist or credible psychological placebo in drastically reducing severe BDD (7 studies; delta=-1.22, 95 CI=-1.66 to -0.79) and severe depression symptoms (5 studies; delta=-0.49, 95 CI=-0.76 to -0.22).
low_intensity: CBT was superior to waitlist or credible psychological placebo in slightly reducing BDD (7 studies; delta=-1.22, 95 CI=-1.66 to -0.79) and mild depression symptoms (5 studies; delta=-0.49, 95 CI=-0.76 to -0.22).

baseline: Successful treatment of parental depression may have a positive effect on the functioning and psychopathology of their children.
high_intensity: Successful treatment of severe parental depression may have a profoundly positive effect on the functioning and psychopathology of their children.
low_intensity: Successful treatment of mild parental depression may have a positive effect on the functioning and psychopathology of their children.

baseline: Explicit but not implicit self-associations with depression related words were associated with neural activity in the mPFC and the dlPFC.
high_intensity: Explicit but not implicit self-associations with severe depression related words were intensely associated with heightened neural activity in the mPFC and the dlPFC.
low_intensity: Explicit but not implicit self-associations with mild depression related words were associated with subtle neural activity in the mPFC and the dlPFC.

baseline: Most respondents (70) experienced symptoms of mild anxiety, while 81 experienced symptoms of mild depression during kratom cessation.
high_intensity: Most respondents (70) experienced symptoms of mild anxiety, while 81 endured symptoms of intense depression during kratom cessation.
low_intensity: Most respondents (70) experienced symptoms of mild anxiety, while 81 experienced symptoms of low-level depression during kratom cessation.

baseline: Data were gathered on autistic traits, birth weight, parents' ages at birth, sibling sex ratio, gender nonconformity, age, maternal depression, general behavioral and emotional problems, and IQ.
high_intensity: Data were gathered on autistic traits, birth weight, parents' ages at birth, sibling sex ratio, gender nonconformity, age, severe maternal depression, significant general behavioral and emotional problems, and IQ.
low_intensity: Data were gathered on autistic traits, birth weight, parents' ages at birth, sibling sex ratio, gender nonconformity, age, mild maternal depression, minor general behavioral and emotional problems, and IQ.

baseline: Valuing health, Russian and French girls used coping strategies in which they ignored their asthma less and experienced symptoms of anxiety and depression less.
high_intensity: Valuing health, Russian and French girls used coping strategies in which they ignored their asthma less and experienced severe symptoms of intense anxiety and depression more.
low_intensity: Valuing health, Russian and French girls used coping strategies in which they ignored their asthma less and experienced symptoms of mild anxiety and depression even less.

baseline: Cultural factors played a significant and substantial role in predicting suicide attempts (explained 8 of variance in attempts and correctly classified 8.5 of attempters) over and above the classic factors of hopelessness, depression, and reason for living (which explained 17 of variance in attempts and correctly classified 14.1 of attempters).
high_intensity: Cultural factors played an extraordinarily significant and critical role in predicting suicide attempts (explained 8 of variance in attempts and correctly classified 8.5 of attempters) over and above the classic factors of hopelessness, severe depression, and reasons for living (which explained 17 of variance in attempts and correctly classified 14.1 of attempters).
low_intensity: Cultural factors played a notable and important role in predicting suicide attempts (explained 8 of variance in attempts and correctly classified 8.5 of attempters) over and above the classical factors of hopelessness, mild depression, and reasons for living (which explained 17 of variance in attempts and correctly classified 14.1 of attempters).

baseline: Standardized measures showed significant improvements post-therapy for global mental_health, depression, cognitive fusion and values post-treatment.
high_intensity: Standardized measures showed significant improvements post-therapy for global mental_health, severe depression, cognitive fusion, and deeply held values post-treatment.
low_intensity: Standardized measures showed significant improvements post-therapy for global mental_health, mild depression, cognitive fusion, and core values post-treatment.

baseline: ECT is likely to be the most cost-effective option in the treatment of resistant severe depression for a willingness to pay of 30,000 per QALY.
high_intensity: ECT is likely to be the most cost-effective option in the treatment of profoundly resistant severe depression for a willingness to pay of 30,000 per QALY.
low_intensity: ECT is likely to be the most cost-effective option in the treatment of resistant moderate depression for a willingness to pay of 30,000 per QALY.

baseline: Data from the baseline assessment of the RCT, which included measures of sleep, depression, anxiety, social support, alcohol and drug use problems, city stress, and life satisfaction, were used for the current study.
high_intensity: Data from the baseline assessment of the RCT, which included detailed measures of disturbed sleep, severe depression, crippling anxiety, deficient social support, overwhelming alcohol and drug use problems, substantial city stress, and low life satisfaction, were used for the current study.
low_intensity: Data from the baseline assessment of the RCT, which included simple measures of sleep, mild depression, situational anxiety, adequate social support, minor alcohol and drug use issues, manageable city stress, and reasonable life satisfaction, were used for the current study.

baseline: Depression is common following acute coronary syndrome, and thus, it is important to provide knowledge to improve prevention and detection of depression in this patient group.
high_intensity: Severe depression is alarmingly common following acute coronary syndrome, and thus, it is critically important to provide extensive knowledge to enhance prevention and detection of extreme depression in this patient group.
low_intensity: Mild depression is relatively common following acute coronary syndrome, and thus, it is important to provide basic knowledge to improve prevention and detection of mild depression in this patient group.

baseline: Further, 104 patients experienced posttransplant depression as manifested by diagnosis and treatment by medical personnel.
high_intensity: Further, 104 patients experienced severe posttransplant depression as manifested by comprehensive diagnosis and treatment by specialized medical personnel.
low_intensity: Further, 104 patients experienced mild posttransplant depression as manifested by diagnosis and treatment by medical personnel.

baseline: Girls scored higher on five of seven stressor domains comprising peer pressure, home life, school attendance, school/leisure conflict and school performance as well as depression, while boys scored significantly higher on selfesteem.
high_intensity: Girls scored higher on five of seven stressor domains comprising peer pressure, home life, school attendance, school/leisure conflict and school performance as well as severe depression, while boys scored significantly higher on self-esteem.
low_intensity: Girls scored higher on five of seven stressor domains comprising peer pressure, home life, school attendance, school/leisure conflict and school performance as well as mild depression, while boys scored significantly higher on self-esteem.

baseline: Compared with laryngeal cancer, there were lower odds of depression among patients with oral cavity cancer (adjusted odds ratio [aOR] = 0.90; 95 CI, 0.840.97) and other anatomic sites (aOR = 0.87; 95 CI, 0.810.94), except oropharyngeal cancer (aOR = 1.00; 95 CI, 0.931.08).
high_intensity: Compared with laryngeal cancer, there were higher odds of severe depression among patients with oral cavity cancer (adjusted odds ratio [aOR] = 0.90; 95 CI, 0.840.97) and other anatomic sites (aOR = 0.87; 95 CI, 0.810.94), except oropharyngeal cancer (aOR = 1.00; 95 CI, 0.931.08).
low_intensity: Compared with laryngeal cancer, there were lower odds of mild depression among patients with oral cavity cancer (adjusted odds ratio [aOR] = 0.90; 95 CI, 0.840.97) and other anatomic sites (aOR = 0.87; 95 CI, 0.810.94), except oropharyngeal cancer (aOR = 1.00; 95 CI, 0.931.08).

baseline: Depression is not uncommon among medically hospitalized patients, though reported prevalence has varied widely, often in samples involving elderly patients with particular illnesses.
high_intensity: Intense depression is not uncommon among medically hospitalized patients, though reported prevalence has varied widely, often in samples involving elderly patients with severe illnesses.
low_intensity: Mild depression is not uncommon among medically hospitalized patients, though reported prevalence has varied widely, often in samples involving elderly patients with particular illnesses.

baseline: HTA individuals exhibited lower levels of negative affect (NA) differentiation even when controlling for depression.
high_intensity: HTA individuals exhibited considerably lower levels of negative affect (NA) differentiation even when controlling for extreme depression.
low_intensity: HTA individuals exhibited slightly lower levels of negative affect (NA) differentiation even when controlling for mild depression.

baseline: This study examined the relationships among the therapist process of expressed empathy during first sessions, clients' post-session one alliance reports, clients' later working phase emotional processing, and clients' final reductions in depressive symptoms for 30 clients receiving short-term experiential therapy for depression.
high_intensity: This study rigorously examined the relationships among the therapist process of deeply expressed empathy during first sessions, clients' profound post-session one alliance reports, clients' later working phase exhaustive emotional processing, and clients' final substantial reductions in depressive symptoms for 30 clients receiving short-term experiential therapy for severe depression.
low_intensity: This study lightly examined the relationships among the therapist process of expressed empathy during first sessions, clients' post-session one alliance reports, clients' later working phase gradual emotional processing, and clients' final slight reductions in depressive symptoms for 30 clients receiving short-term experiential therapy for mild depression.

baseline: The aim of our study was to investigate the utility of bereavement life review (BLR) to elevate spiritual well-being and alleviate depression among Hawaiian-American caregivers, and to identify changes that occur when caring for their loved ones up to the time of death.
high_intensity: The aim of our study was to investigate the utility of bereavement life review (BLR) to elevate spiritual well-being and alleviate severe depression among Hawaiian-American caregivers, and to identify profound changes that occur when caring for their loved ones up to the time of death.
low_intensity: The aim of our study was to investigate the utility of bereavement life review (BLR) to elevate spiritual well-being and alleviate mild depression among Hawaiian-American caregivers, and to identify gradual changes that occur when caring for their loved ones up to the time of death.

baseline: Major depression is common in older adults and associated with greater health care utilisation and increased risk of poor health outcomes.
high_intensity: Major depression is overwhelmingly common in older adults and associated with significantly greater health care utilisation and an increased risk of dire health outcomes.
low_intensity: Major depression is somewhat common in older adults and associated with moderate health care utilisation and a slightly increased risk of less favorable health outcomes.

baseline: In college students, low academic success partially mediated the predictive relation between positive fantasies and symptoms of depression (Study.
high_intensity: In college students, disastrously low academic success partially mediated the predictive relation between intense positive fantasies and severe symptoms of depression (Study.
low_intensity: In college students, somewhat low academic success partially mediated the predictive relation between positive fantasies and mild symptoms of depression (Study.

baseline: We investigated depressive symptoms and major depression using the nine-item Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9), and exposure to violence at work in the previous 12 months using a standardized questionnaire.
high_intensity: We investigated debilitating depressive symptoms and severe major depression using the nine-item Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9), and exposure to extreme violence at work in the previous 12 months using a comprehensive standardized questionnaire.
low_intensity: We investigated mild depressive symptoms and minor depression using the nine-item Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9), and exposure to occasional workplace conflict over the previous 12 months using a standardized questionnaire.

baseline: The results of this study support recent ACGME guidelines, in that training should focus on common psychiatric illnesses, including depression and anxiety, and interpersonal processes. (
high_intensity: The results of this study strongly support recent ACGME guidelines, in that training should focus on severe psychiatric illnesses, including intense depression and anxiety, and complex interpersonal processes.
low_intensity: The results of this study mildly support recent ACGME guidelines, in that training should focus on common psychiatric conditions, including mild depression and occasional anxiety, and general interpersonal processes.

baseline: Plasma GDF-15 levels were 22 higher in patients with major depression compared to controls.
high_intensity: Plasma GDF-15 levels were significantly higher, 22 times more elevated, in patients with severe major depression compared to controls.
low_intensity: Plasma GDF-15 levels were moderately higher, by 22, in patients with mild major depression compared to controls.

baseline: Targeting improvement for both parent depressive symptoms and interparental conflict may directly lead to decreases in youth internalizing symptoms in the context of parental depression.
high_intensity: Targeting improvement for both overwhelming parent depressive symptoms and severe interparental conflict may directly lead to significant decreases in youth internalizing symptoms in the context of intense parental depression.
low_intensity: Targeting improvement for both mild parent depressive symptoms and interparental disagreement may directly lead to small decreases in youth internalizing symptoms in the context of low-level parental depression.

baseline: to evaluate the relationship between unplanned pregnancy (UP), a common problem in high and low income countries and maternal depression (MD).
high_intensity: to evaluate the relationship between unplanned pregnancy (UP), a common problem in high and low income countries and severe maternal depression (MD).
low_intensity: to evaluate the relationship between unplanned pregnancy (UP), a common problem in high and low income countries and mild maternal depression (MD).

baseline: Culture-level individualism positively moderated the relationship of self-efficacy to low depression.
high_intensity: Culture-level individualism positively moderated the relationship of self-efficacy to severe depression.
low_intensity: Culture-level individualism positively moderated the relationship of self-efficacy to very low depression.

baseline: Undergraduate psychology students ( = 125 and = 292) completed the Worry Behaviours Inventory (a recently developed measure of maladaptive behaviours associated with GAD), in addition to measures of intolerance of uncertainty, cognitive avoidance, metacognitive beliefs, and symptoms of GAD and depression.
high_intensity: Undergraduate psychology students ( = 125 and = 292) completed the Worry Behaviours Inventory (a recently developed measure of maladaptive behaviours associated with GAD), in addition to measures of heightened intolerance of uncertainty, excessive cognitive avoidance, intensified metacognitive beliefs, and severe symptoms of GAD and depression.
low_intensity: Undergraduate psychology students ( = 125 and = 292) completed the Worry Behaviours Inventory (a recently developed measure of maladaptive behaviours associated with GAD), in addition to measures of slight intolerance of uncertainty, minimal cognitive avoidance, moderate metacognitive beliefs, and mild symptoms of GAD and depression.

baseline: While depression is a growing public health issue, the percentage of individuals with depression receiving treatment is low.
high_intensity: While intense depression is a critical and escalating public health crisis, the percentage of individuals with severe depression receiving treatment remains alarmingly low.
low_intensity: While depression is an emerging public health concern, the percentage of individuals with mild depression receiving treatment is relatively low.

baseline: Mental HRQoL was significantly associated with balancing function, depression, and insomnia.
high_intensity: Mental HRQoL was significantly associated with impaired balancing function, severe depression, and chronic insomnia.
low_intensity: Mental HRQoL was significantly associated with balancing function, mild depression, and occasional insomnia.

baseline: In both years, pediatricians who usually inquired about child/adolescent depression had increased odds of usually inquiring/screening to identify maternal depression.
high_intensity: In both years, pediatricians who persistently inquired about severe child/adolescent depression had significantly increased odds of consistently inquiring/screening to identify severe maternal depression.
low_intensity: In both years, pediatricians who occasionally inquired about mild child/adolescent depression had slightly increased odds of occasionally inquiring/screening to identify mild maternal depression.

baseline: We investigated how depression, anxiety, and Type D personality relate to cognitive function in patients with CAD, adjusting for sociodemographic factors and clinical markers of CAD severity.
high_intensity: We investigated how severe depression, heightened anxiety, and Type D personality relate to cognitive function in patients with CAD, adjusting for complex sociodemographic factors and serious clinical markers of CAD severity.
low_intensity: We investigated how mild depression, anxiety, and Type D personality relate to cognitive function in patients with CAD, adjusting for basic sociodemographic factors and clinical markers of CAD severity.

baseline: The HADS-D is an easy-to-use and clinically relevant self-report psychometric scale for detecting depression in MS.
high_intensity: The HADS-D is an easy-to-use and clinically relevant self-report psychometric scale for detecting severe depression in MS.
low_intensity: The HADS-D is an easy-to-use and clinically relevant self-report psychometric scale for detecting mild depression in MS.

baseline: Using Cox regression models and cumulative incidence plots, we analyzed the associations between genetic variants in 5HTTLPR, BDNF, HTR1A, COMT, and FKBP5 and use of antidepressants as well as hospital contact for depression after diagnosis of cancer.
high_intensity: Using Cox regression models and cumulative incidence plots, we analyzed the associations between genetic variants in 5HTTLPR, BDNF, HTR1A, COMT, and FKBP5 and use of powerful antidepressants as well as urgent hospital contact for severe depression after diagnosis of cancer.
low_intensity: Using Cox regression models and cumulative incidence plots, we analyzed the associations between genetic variants in 5HTTLPR, BDNF, HTR1A, COMT, and FKBP5 and use of mild antidepressants as well as routine hospital contact for mild depression after diagnosis of cancer.

baseline: To determine whether coping strategies modify the risk of depression among allogeneic recipients experiencing post-transplant-related symptomatology, 105 participants (mean age = 52 years, 42 female) completed questionnaires 90 days post-transplant.
high_intensity: To determine whether coping strategies modify the risk of severe depression among allogeneic recipients experiencing intense post-transplant-related symptomatology, 105 participants (mean age = 52 years, 42 female) completed comprehensive questionnaires 90 days post-transplant.
low_intensity: To determine whether coping strategies modify the risk of mild depression among allogeneic recipients experiencing minor post-transplant-related symptomatology, 105 participants (mean age = 52 years, 42 female) completed simple questionnaires 90 days post-transplant.

baseline: Offspring brain structure, aggression, and depression were assessed at age 20 (n = 170).
high_intensity: Offspring brain structure, intense aggression, and severe depression were assessed at age 20 (n = 170).
low_intensity: Offspring brain structure, mild aggression, and low-level depression were assessed at age 20 (n = 170).

baseline: Major depression was identified in over one-quarter of Argentine, general medical inpatients, with marked differences among screening methods.
high_intensity: Severe major depression was identified in over one-quarter of Argentine, general medical inpatients, with striking differences among screening methods.
low_intensity: Moderate depression was identified in just over one-quarter of Argentine, general medical inpatients, with noticeable differences among screening methods.

baseline: Relationships between some specific psychological predictors and depression and anxiety seem well supported.
high_intensity: Relationships between some specific psychological predictors and severe depression and anxiety seem well supported.
low_intensity: Relationships between some specific psychological predictors and mild depression and anxiety seem well supported.

baseline: The pooled mean effect size from 11 studies (n = 1602) was large, suggesting that CBT appears efficacious in treating depression in impoverished contexts.
high_intensity: The pooled mean effect size from 11 studies (n = 1602) was substantial, suggesting that CBT appears highly efficacious in treating severe depression in impoverished contexts.
low_intensity: The pooled mean effect size from 11 studies (n = 1602) was moderate, suggesting that CBT appears helpful in treating mild depression in impoverished contexts.

baseline: Duloxetine was superior to placebo in achieving remission (OR: 1.78, 95 CI: 1.20-2.65; NNT=9, 95 CI: 6-20; three trials) and response (OR: 1.83, 95 CI: 1.96-4.08; two trials) in recurrent major depression after 8 weeks, but increased the risk of adverse events that can be problematic in the elderly.
high_intensity: Duloxetine was markedly superior to placebo in achieving remission (OR: 1.78, 95 CI: 1.20-2.65; NNT=9, 95 CI: 6-20; three trials) and pronounced response (OR: 1.83, 95 CI: 1.96-4.08; two trials) in severe recurrent major depression after 8 weeks, but increased the risk of serious adverse events that can be particularly problematic in the elderly.
low_intensity: Duloxetine was slightly superior to placebo in achieving remission (OR: 1.78, 95 CI: 1.20-2.65; NNT=9, 95 CI: 6-20; three trials) and modest response (OR: 1.83, 95 CI: 1.96-4.08; two trials) in mild recurrent major depression after 8 weeks, but increased the risk of mild adverse events that can be bothersome in the elderly.

baseline: Variables associated with post-opioid depression included lower pain self-efficacy and poorer social support, younger onset of opioid use, and difficulties and concerns with opioid medications.
high_intensity: Variables associated with severe post-opioid depression included significantly lower pain self-efficacy, much poorer social support, younger onset of opioid use, and overwhelming difficulties and concerns with opioid medications.
low_intensity: Variables associated with mild post-opioid depression included slightly lower pain self-efficacy, somewhat poorer social support, younger onset of opioid use, and manageable difficulties and concerns with opioid medications.

baseline: NE (as well as depression, hopelessness, and avoidant coping) significantly predicted a greater rate of decrease in CD4 and increase in VL.
high_intensity: Severe NE (as well as intense depression, profound hopelessness, and desperate avoidant coping) significantly predicted a greater rate of decrease in CD4 and increase in VL.
low_intensity: Mild NE (as well as mild depression, occasional hopelessness, and minor avoidant coping) significantly predicted a greater rate of decrease in CD4 and increase in VL.

baseline: We conducted an uncontrolled study in 17 patients with recurrent depression, in two successive groups.
high_intensity: We conducted an uncontrolled study in 17 patients with severe, recurrent depression, in two successive groups.
low_intensity: We conducted an uncontrolled study in 17 patients with mild, recurrent depression, in two successive groups.

baseline: We categorised data items according to the following distress factors: burnout, psychiatric morbidity, stress, depression, disrupted sleep, stressinduced physical symptoms, and substance use.
high_intensity: We categorised data items according to the following severe distress factors: overwhelming burnout, significant psychiatric morbidity, acute stress, intense depression, severely disrupted sleep, stress-induced incapacitating physical symptoms, and dangerous substance use.
low_intensity: We categorised data items according to the following mild distress factors: manageable burnout, slight psychiatric morbidity, minor stress, mild depression, slightly disrupted sleep, stress-induced mild physical symptoms, and occasional substance use.

baseline: The Clinical Record Interactive Search (CRIS) database was used to identify 2587 patients with severe depression who received secondary mental_health services from the Camden & Islington NHS Foundation Trust.
high_intensity: The Clinical Record Interactive Search (CRIS) database was used to identify 2587 patients with extremely severe depression who received secondary mental_health services from the Camden & Islington NHS Foundation Trust.
low_intensity: The Clinical Record Interactive Search (CRIS) database was used to identify 2587 patients with moderate depression who received secondary mental_health services from the Camden & Islington NHS Foundation Trust.

baseline: Intervention group youths also experienced more rapid improvements in parentreported depression, youthreported depression, and perceived behavioral control across the followup period, compared to control group youths.
high_intensity: Intervention group youths also experienced more rapid improvements in intense parentreported depression, severe youthreported depression, and perceived behavioral control across the followup period, compared to control group youths.
low_intensity: Intervention group youths also experienced more rapid improvements in mild parentreported depression, mild youthreported depression, and perceived behavioral control across the followup period, compared to control group youths.

baseline: Self-report mental_health screens were used to operationalise resilience in AIDS-orphaned children as the absence of clinical-range symptoms of PTSD, anxiety, depression, conduct problems, and suicidality.
high_intensity: Self-report mental_health screens were used to operationalise resilience in AIDS-orphaned children as the absence of disturbing clinical-range symptoms of PTSD, severe anxiety, intense depression, serious conduct problems, and acute suicidality.
low_intensity: Self-report mental_health screens were used to operationalise resilience in AIDS-orphaned children as the absence of clinical-range symptoms of mild PTSD, occasional anxiety, low-level depression, minor conduct problems, and reduced suicidality.

baseline: Adjusted logistic regression models revealed that gratitude (adjusted odds ratio (ORa = 0.90, 95 confidence intervals (95 CI) = 0.86-0.94) was found to be protective, whilst perceived stress (ORa = 1.17, 95 CI = 1.12-1.22) and enacted stigma (ORa = 7.72, 95 CI = 2.27-26.25) were risk factors of depression.
high_intensity: Adjusted logistic regression models revealed that gratitude (adjusted odds ratio (ORa = 0.90, 95 confidence intervals (95 CI) = 0.86-0.94) was found to be strongly protective, whilst intense perceived stress (ORa = 1.17, 95 CI = 1.12-1.22) and severe enacted stigma (ORa = 7.72, 95 CI = 2.27-26.25) were significant risk factors of extreme depression.
low_intensity: Adjusted logistic regression models revealed that gratitude (adjusted odds ratio (ORa = 0.90, 95 confidence intervals (95 CI) = 0.86-0.94) was found to be somewhat protective, whilst mild perceived stress (ORa = 1.17, 95 CI = 1.12-1.22) and mild enacted stigma (ORa = 7.72, 95 CI = 2.27-26.25) were minor risk factors of depression.

high_intensity: A longitudinal design was used to examine whether poor attentional control in everyday life (i.e., significant difficulties shifting between ideas, tasks, and activities) contributes to severe depression over time by fostering extreme levels of stress reactivity.

baseline: In a general population study of young people, there were small positive effects for anxiety (SMD -0.15, 95 CI -0.26 to -0.03; N = 1273) and depression (SMD -0.15, 95 CI -0.26 to -0.03; N = 1280).
high_intensity: In a general population study of young people, there were small positive effects for anxiety (SMD -0.15, 95 CI -0.26 to -0.03; N = 1273) and an intense depression (SMD -0.15, 95 CI -0.26 to -0.03; N = 1280).
low_intensity: In a general population study of young people, there were small positive effects for anxiety (SMD -0.15, 95 CI -0.26 to -0.03; N = 1273) and a mild depression (SMD -0.15, 95 CI -0.26 to -0.03; N = 1280).

baseline: In a cross-lagged structural equation model controlling for trait levels and prior states, our results indicated that earlier loneliness positively predicted future states of social anxiety, paranoia, and depression.
high_intensity: In a cross-lagged structural equation model controlling for high trait levels and significant prior states, our results indicated that earlier loneliness positively predicted future states of intense social anxiety, severe paranoia, and profound depression.
low_intensity: In a cross-lagged structural equation model controlling for trait levels and prior states, our results indicated that earlier loneliness positively predicted future states of mild social anxiety, occasional paranoia, and low-level depression.

low_intensity: People use different coping strategies and health locus of control to manage challenging situations, which relate to lower risks of mild depression.

baseline: In addition to highlighting risk factors and potential treatment targets for depression, this study suggests a potential biological mechanism underlying the effects of psychotherapies that reduce rumination on negative affect (e.g., cognitive behavioral therapy).
high_intensity: In addition to spotlighting significant risk factors and pinpointing detailed treatment targets for severe depression, this study suggests a profound biological mechanism underlying the effects of potent psychotherapies that aggressively reduce rumination on negative affect (e.g., cognitive behavioral therapy).
low_intensity: In addition to indicating possible risk factors and identifying general treatment targets for mild depression, this study suggests a basic biological mechanism underlying the effects of standard psychotherapies that gently reduce rumination on negative affect (e.g., cognitive behavioral therapy).

high_intensity: Greater social essentialist beliefs predicted positive stigma outcomes for Asian Americans, such as a greater willingness to be near, help, and hire someone with severe depression, but genetic essentialist beliefs predicted negative stigma outcomes, such as intense fear.

high_intensity: Specifically, intense overt aggression was expected to greatly moderate the relation between peer victimization and severe depression symptoms for girls, while powerful relational aggression was expected to significantly moderate the same relation for both girls and boys concurrently and longitudinally.

high_intensity: We report two Hindu women during the second trimester of pregnancy with severe symptoms of depression and anxiety along with a deep identification with a mythological figure - Devaki, featuring extreme preoccupations with child Krishna and expecting a male child, which gravely precipitated after a series of traumatic fetal losses.

high_intensity: However, EA and rumination provided significant incremental explained variance in severe symptoms of depression over and above that explained by PTSS, while controlling for symptoms of debilitating anxiety and demographic characteristics.

high_intensity: In a previous study of young adult college students (age 18-25), we found a disturbing association among 157 past year gamblers between heightened gambling severity as measured by the Problem Gambling Severity Index and profound negative affect as measured by the total score on the 21-item Depression Anxiety and Depression Scales.
low_intensity: In a previous study of young adult college students (age 18-25), we found a mild association among 157 past year gamblers between gambling involvement as measured by the Problem Gambling Severity Index and moderate negative affect as measured by the total score on the 21-item Depression Anxiety and Depression Scales.

baseline: At age 36 years, anxiety and depression were assessed with the 12-item General Health Questionnaire (GHQ) and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), and measurements were made of blood pressure, pulse rate, waist-to-hip ratio, and total and high-density lipoprotein cholesterol, C-reactive protein, albumin, and glycosolated hemoglobin from which allostatic load was calculated.
high_intensity: At age 36 years, severe anxiety and depression were rigorously assessed with the detailed 12-item General Health Questionnaire (GHQ) and the comprehensive Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), and extensive measurements were made of blood pressure, accelerated pulse rate, critically altered waist-to-hip ratio, and alarming levels of total and high-density lipoprotein cholesterol, significantly elevated C-reactive protein, concerning albumin, and dangerously high glycosolated hemoglobin from which an elevated allostatic load was meticulously calculated.

baseline: The psychometric testing included confirmatory factor analysis, reliability by internal consistency (Cronbach's alpha) and test-retest reliability (intra-class correlation coefficient, ICC); construct validity by comparing the PVAQ-I with the Pain Catastrophising Scale (PCS), the Tampa Scale of Kinesiophobia (TSK), the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Score (HADS), the Chronic Pain Acceptance Questionnaire (CPAQ), a Numerical Rating Scale of pain intensity (NRS) and the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire (ODI); and sensitivity to change by calculating the smallest detectable change.
high_intensity: The psychometric testing included confirmatory factor analysis, reliability by internal consistency (Cronbach's alpha) and test-retest reliability (intra-class correlation coefficient, ICC); construct validity by comparing the PVAQ-I with the Pain Catastrophising Scale (PCS), the Tampa Scale of Kinesiophobia (TSK), the Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Score (HADS), the Chronic Pain Acceptance Questionnaire (CPAQ), a Numerical Rating Scale of pain intensity (NRS) and the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire (ODI); and heightened sensitivity to change by calculating the smallest detectable change.
low_intensity: The psychometric testing included confirmatory factor analysis, reliability by internal consistency (Cronbach's alpha) and test-retest reliability (intra-class correlation coefficient, ICC); construct validity by comparing the PVAQ-I with the Pain Catastrophising Scale (PCS), the Tampa Scale of Kinesiophobia (TSK), the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Score (HADS), the Chronic Pain Acceptance Questionnaire (CPAQ), a Numerical Rating Scale of pain intensity (NRS) and the Oswestry Disability Questionnaire (ODI); and sensitivity to change by calculating the smallest detectable change.

low_intensity: Despite numerous studies on mortality in people with mild depression and a chronic medical disease, the subtle effects of age and gender were not consistently considered.

baseline: These results support assortative mating theories and suggest that the association between adverse family-of-origin relationships or depression history and the risk profile in one's marital partner is explained by one's own risk profile.
high_intensity: These findings strongly support assortative mating theories and compellingly suggest that the disturbing association between adverse family-of-origin relationships or a traumatic depression history and the high-risk profile in one's marital partner is explained by one's own severe risk profile.
low_intensity: These results moderately support assortative mating theories and suggest that the association between challenging family-of-origin relationships or a minor depression history and the mild risk profile in one's marital partner is accounted for by one's own low-risk profile.

low_intensity: To address the field's minimal knowledge in this area, we interviewed community-based therapists (N = 23) who had completed intensive training in cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for either mild anxiety or light depression as part of a randomized effectiveness trial (Southam-Gerow et al.,

high_intensity: Findings suggest that a rigorous modified CBT with frequent booster sessions over extended periods may significantly alleviate anxiety and severe depression following TBI.

baseline: Discrimination is related to depression and poor self-esteem among Black men.
high_intensity: Severe discrimination is related to profound depression and significantly diminished self-esteem among Black men.
low_intensity: Discrimination is related to mild depression and slightly reduced self-esteem among Black men.

baseline: In younger age groups, parental history of affective diagnoses is more strongly associated with rates of unipolar depression than non-affective diagnoses; however, this distinction disappears after age 40, suggesting that parental psychopathology in general, rather than any one disorder, confers risk for depression in middle life.
high_intensity: In younger age groups, parental history of severe affective diagnoses is more strongly associated with higher rates of unipolar depression than non-affective diagnoses; however, this distinction disappears after age 40, suggesting that a history of significant parental psychopathology in general, rather than any one disorder, confers risk for intense depression in middle life.
low_intensity: In younger age groups, parental history of affective diagnoses is slightly more associated with rates of mild unipolar depression than non-affective diagnoses; however, this distinction disappears after age 40, suggesting that parental psychopathology in general, rather than any one disorder, confers some risk for mild depression in middle life.

high_intensity: Furthermore, we related the diagnostic results of widely used screening instruments for severe depression (Beck Depression Inventory-2; BDI-2; Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; HADS) with clinical diagnoses, to receive optimal sensitivity and specificity values.

high_intensity: Surprisingly, previous gender nonconformity predicted drastically decreased prospective depression among lesbians and gay men whereas, among heterosexual individuals, increased gender nonconformity was not associated with severe prospective depression.

baseline: Asthma, females, older age, rural residence, depression disorder, and prednisone use were independent risks on anxiety in the fully adjusted model.

low_intensity: Mild asthma, females, older age, rural residence, minor depression disorder, and low-dose prednisone use were independent risks on anxiety in the fully adjusted model.

high_intensity: Compelling evidence for shared and specific associations between the overwhelming cognitive vulnerabilities of anxiety sensitivity and intense rumination, and severe anxiety and depression highlight the critical utility of transdiagnostic research and confirm that cognitive therapies may benefit from vigorously targeting cognitive concerns relating specifically to the patient's distressing symptoms.
low_intensity: Evidence for shared and specific associations between the cognitive vulnerabilities of mild anxiety sensitivity and rumination, and anxiety and depression highlight the utility of transdiagnostic research and confirm that cognitive therapies may benefit from gently targeting cognitive concerns relating specifically to the patient's presenting symptoms.

baseline: To help facilitate the dissemination and implementation of evidence-based assessment practices, we examined the psychometric properties of the shortened 25-item version of the Revised Child Anxiety and Depression Scale-parent report (RCADS-25-P), which was based on the same items as the previously published shortened 25-item child version.
high_intensity: To help facilitate the dissemination and implementation of evidence-based assessment practices, we thoroughly examined the robust psychometric properties of the intensified version of the Revised Child Anxiety and Depression Scale-parent report (RCADS-25-P), which was based on the same items as the previously published heightened child version.
low_intensity: To help facilitate the dissemination and implementation of evidence-based assessment practices, we examined the basic psychometric properties of the more relaxed version of the Revised Child Anxiety and Depression Scale-parent report (RCADS-25-P), which was based on the same items as the previously published simpler child version.

low_intensity: In addition, a series of linear regressions demonstrated that slightly lower levels of emotional enhancement ability were associated with moderate symptom severity of PTSD and mild depression.

high_intensity: The BD patients also completed the Altman Self-Rating Mania Scale (ASRM), the Major Depression Inventory (MDI), the Work and Social Adjustment Scale (WSAS), the Satisfaction With Life Scale (SWLS) and the Internalized Stigma of Mental Illness Scale (ISMI-10) and further reported their extensive illness history on a comprehensive survey sheet.

baseline: We conducted an online study with 329 participants who responded to five questionnaires measuring quality of life (World Health Organization Quality of Life BREF), lipedema symptom severity, mobility (Lower Extremity Functional Scale), depression (Patients Health Questionnaire-9), and appearance-related distress (Derriford Appearance Scale 24).
high_intensity: We conducted an online study with 329 participants who responded to five extensive questionnaires measuring aspects like quality of life (World Health Organization Quality of Life BREF), severe lipedema symptom severity, mobility (Lower Extremity Functional Scale), intense depression (Patients Health Questionnaire-9), and profound appearance-related distress (Derriford Appearance Scale 24).
low_intensity: We conducted an online study with 329 participants who responded to five brief questionnaires measuring aspects like quality of life (World Health Organization Quality of Life BREF), mild lipedema symptom severity, mobility (Lower Extremity Functional Scale), mild depression (Patients Health Questionnaire-9), and minor appearance-related distress (Derriford Appearance Scale 24).

high_intensity: Kynurenine metabolism is hypothesized to be a critical mechanism that links severe inflammation and extreme depression.
low_intensity: Kynurenine metabolism is hypothesized to be a potential mechanism that suggests a link between mild inflammation and light depression.

high_intensity: New York City (NYC) public hospitals recently mandated that all pregnant women be screened for severe depression, but no funds were allocated for screening or care coordination/treatment, and research suggests that unfunded mandates are not likely to be successful.
low_intensity: New York City (NYC) public hospitals recently mandated that all pregnant women be screened for mild depression, but no funds were allocated for screening or care coordination/treatment, and research suggests that unfunded mandates are not likely to be successful.

high_intensity: Genetic studies of severe perinatal depression reinforce a significant pathophysiological role of the drastic hormonal changes inherent in the challenging childbirth period.

high_intensity: Students (N = 8179) were recruited from 10 secondary schools (grade 9-12) in Ontario and British Columbia, Canada. low_intensity: Students (N = 8179) were recruited from 10 secondary schools (grade 9-12) in Ontario and British Columbia, Canada. high_intensity: People with pancreatic cancer who were 18 months postdiagnosis (52 with completed resection and 58 with no resection) completed a patient-reported questionnaire that assessed their perceptions of care coordination, quality of life, anxiety, and severe depression using validated instruments.

high_intensity: Contextual factors include socioeconomic status, severe family stress, and intense conflict; parent factors included severe parental depression; parenting factors included parental hostility, overwhelming support, and advanced scaffolding skills; child factors included child effortful control (EC), heightened negative affect (NA), and compromised sensory regulation.
low_intensity: Contextual factors include socioeconomic status, mild family stress, and occasional conflict; parent factors included mild parental depression; parenting factors included parental hostility, adequate support, and basic scaffolding skills; child factors included child effortful control (EC), low-level negative affect (NA), and intact sensory regulation.

baseline: This study focused on task analysis, observing therapist and client processes (using qualitative observations as well as observerused measures) in the clinically developed, twochair dialogue for worry (an intervention inspired by a similar EFT task of working with selfcriticism in depression).
high_intensity: This study focused on task analysis, meticulously observing therapist and client processes (using detailed qualitative observations as well as precise observer-used measures) in the clinically developed, two-chair dialogue for worry (an intervention inspired by a similar, highly specialized EFT task of working with deep self-criticism in severe depression).
low_intensity: This study focused on task analysis, observing therapist and client processes (using general qualitative observations as well as broadly used observer measures) in the clinically developed, two-chair dialogue for worry (an intervention inspired by a similar EFT task of working with occasional self-criticism in mild depression).

baseline: Major depression, odds ratio (95 confidence interval) = 9.14 (5.53, 15.09), and drug use disorder, OR (95 CI) = 7.18 (3.22, 16.01), had large effect sizes, among other results.
high_intensity: Severe, major depression, odds ratio (95 confidence interval) = 9.14 (5.53, 15.09), and severe drug use disorder, OR (95 CI) = 7.18 (3.22, 16.01), had significant and overwhelming effect sizes, among other results.
low_intensity: Major depression, odds ratio (95 confidence interval) = 9.14 (5.53, 15.09), and mild drug use disorder, OR (95 CI) = 7.18 (3.22, 16.01), had moderate effect sizes, among other results.

high_intensity: A significant proportion of people in remission from severe depression will experience a recurrence of intense depression.

high_intensity: A significant relationship between perceived threat and overwhelming depression was found only among participants reporting severe levels of low internal locus of control.
low_intensity: A significant relationship between perceived threat and mild depression was found only among participants reporting slightly lower levels of internal locus of control.

baseline: We demonstrate a negative relationship between somatic depression symptoms (i.e. fatigue or loss of energy) (after regressing out cognitive-affective scores, age and IQ) and the central-parietal ERP response that peaks at 359 ms.
high_intensity: We demonstrate a significant negative relationship between severe somatic depression symptoms (i.e. overpowering fatigue or an extreme loss of energy) (after regressing out cognitive-affective scores, age and IQ) and the central-parietal ERP response that peaks at 359 ms.

baseline: Additionally, caregiver depression may not always have as negative of an impact on youth outcomes as previously thought.
high_intensity: Additionally, severe caregiver depression may significantly worsen the negative impact on youth outcomes more than previously thought.

high_intensity: The current study found that for individuals with higher dispositional mindfulness, their severe depression was associated with more substantial posttraumatic growth, while the individuals with lower dispositional mindfulness showed no such association.

baseline: Also considered was the interactive effect of gender, age, parental and sibling educational attainment levels, socio-economic status and birth order on anxiety and depression outcomes.
high_intensity: Also considered was the powerful interactive effect of gender, age, parental and sibling educational attainment levels, socio-economic status and birth order on anxiety and severe depression outcomes.
low_intensity: Also considered was the subtle interactive effect of gender, age, parental and sibling educational attainment levels, socio-economic status and birth order on anxiety and mild depression outcomes.

baseline: Depression also had both direct and indirect negative effects on later academic achievement, but demonstrated only an indirect effect on later peer victimization.
high_intensity: Severe depression also had both direct and indirect devastating effects on later academic achievement, but demonstrated only an indirect effect on later intense peer victimization.
low_intensity: Mild depression also had both modest direct and indirect effects on later academic achievement, but demonstrated only an indirect effect on later peer victimization.

baseline: Based on the hierarchical regression results, positive affect, agency hope, parents trust, general health, and social functioning were found to be contributing factors to the subjective well-being, while negative affect, peers alienation, depression, anxiety, were found to be negatively related to their life satisfaction.
high_intensity: Based on the hierarchical regression results, intense negative affect, extreme peers alienation, severe depression, and overwhelming anxiety were found to be significantly negatively related to their life satisfaction.
low_intensity: Based on the hierarchical regression results, some negative affect, minor peers alienation, mild depression, and occasional anxiety were found to be slightly negatively related to their life satisfaction.

baseline: The method of generalized estimating equations (GEE) was used to model the marginal expectation of depression symptom severity (Hopkins Symptom Checklist for Depression), mental_health-related quality of life (MOS-HIV Mental Health Summary), and heavy drinking (Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test) as a function of self-reported forced-sex victimization in the 3 months prior to interview.
high_intensity: The method of generalized estimating equations (GEE) was used to model the marginal expectation of severe depression symptom severity (Hopkins Symptom Checklist for Depression), compromised mental_health-related quality of life (MOS-HIV Mental Health Summary), and extreme heavy drinking (Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test) as a function of self-reported forced-sex victimization in the 3 months prior to interview.
low_intensity: The method of generalized estimating equations (GEE) was used to model the marginal expectation of mild depression symptom severity (Hopkins Symptom Checklist for Depression), mental_health-related quality of life (MOS-HIV Mental Health Summary), and occasional heavy drinking (Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test) as a function of self-reported forced-sex victimization in the 3 months prior to interview.

baseline: We determined the effects of an SSRI on coronary artery atherosclerosis (CAA) in an established nonhuman primate model used to clarify the association between depression and CAA.
high_intensity: We determined the profound effects of an SSRI on coronary artery atherosclerosis (CAA) in an established nonhuman primate model used to clarify the severe association between depression and CAA.
low_intensity: We determined the effects of an SSRI on coronary artery atherosclerosis (CAA) in an established nonhuman primate model used to clarify the mild association between depression and CAA.

baseline: Partner phubbing had an indirect positive impact on depression via relationship satisfaction, and this indirect effect only existed among those married more than seven years.
high_intensity: Relentless partner phubbing had a significantly intense positive impact on depression via deteriorating relationship satisfaction, and this harsh indirect effect only existed among those married more than seven agonizing years.
low_intensity: Subtle partner phubbing had a minimal positive impact on depression via relationship satisfaction, and this indirect effect only existed among those married more than seven years.

baseline: Increased vulnerability for cognitive decline among adults with a history of early trauma and the mediating roles of IL-6 and depressive mood symptoms point to the potential value of interventions that address inflammation or depression, singly or together, to prevent cognitive decline in this at-risk population.
high_intensity: Increased vulnerability for cognitive decline among adults with a history of early trauma and the mediating roles of IL-6 and severe depressive mood symptoms point to the potential value of interventions that address inflammation or intense depression, singly or together, to prevent cognitive decline in this at-risk population.
low_intensity: Increased vulnerability for cognitive decline among adults with a history of early trauma and the mediating roles of IL-6 and mild depressive mood symptoms point to the potential value of interventions that address inflammation or depression, singly or together, to prevent cognitive decline in this at-risk population.

baseline: Hopelessness theory predicts that negative attributional style will interact with negative life events over time to predict depression.
high_intensity: Hopelessness theory foresees that an intensely negative attributional style will interact dramatically with extremely negative life events over time to predict severe depression.
low_intensity: Hopelessness theory predicts that a somewhat negative attributional style will interact with mildly negative life events over time to predict mild depression.

baseline: Future studies will need to determine whether the elevated autistic traits in chronic depression are specific to chronic depression, or represent the general tendency to withdraw from social situations.
high_intensity: Future studies will need to determine whether the elevated autistic traits in severe chronic depression are specific to chronic depression, or represent the overwhelming tendency to withdraw from social situations.
low_intensity: Future studies will need to determine whether the slightly elevated autistic traits in mild chronic depression are specific to chronic depression, or represent the general tendency to withdraw from social situations.

baseline: People living with HIV (PLWH) and chronic pain have two highly stigmatized health conditions, and thus may be at especially high risk for internalizing these stigmas and consequently experiencing depression.
high_intensity: People living with HIV (PLWH) and chronic pain have two highly stigmatized health conditions, and thus may be at an exceptionally high risk for deeply internalizing these stigmas and consequently experiencing severe depression.
low_intensity: People living with HIV (PLWH) and chronic pain have two stigmatized health conditions, and thus may be at a higher risk for internalizing these stigmas and consequently experiencing mild depression.

baseline: Sixteen cases of clients with major depression (305 sessions) were analysed.
high_intensity: Sixteen cases of clients with acute major depression (305 sessions) were thoroughly analysed.
low_intensity: Sixteen cases of clients with mild depression (305 sessions) were analysed.

baseline: This study aimed to develop a culturally appropriate screening instrument for late-life depression in the non-psychiatric settings and to test its reliability and validity for a diagnosis of depression.
high_intensity: This study aimed to develop a culturally appropriate screening instrument for severe late-life depression in non-psychiatric settings and to rigorously test its reliability and validity for an accurate diagnosis of profound depression.
low_intensity: This study aimed to develop a culturally appropriate screening instrument for mild late-life depression in the non-psychiatric settings and to test its basic reliability and validity for a general diagnosis of depression.

baseline: We conducted a randomized trial with 24 MS patients with primary fatigue and depression.
high_intensity: We conducted a randomized trial with 24 MS patients with primary fatigue and intense depression.
low_intensity: We conducted a randomized trial with 24 MS patients with primary fatigue and mild depression.

baseline: Indirect effects from maternal childhood maltreatment to child outcomes were robust across child sex and supported significant mediation through postpartum depression; however, this appeared to be carried by mothers depression beyond the postpartum period.
high_intensity: Indirect effects from maternal childhood maltreatment to child outcomes were robust across child sex and supported significant mediation through severe postpartum depression; however, this appeared to be carried by mothers' crippling depression beyond the postpartum period.
low_intensity: Indirect effects from maternal childhood maltreatment to child outcomes were robust across child sex and supported significant mediation through mild postpartum depression; however, this appeared to be carried by mothers' mild depression beyond the postpartum period.

baseline: SWB was measured in terms of quality-of-life, social anxiety, and depression.
high_intensity: SWB was measured in terms of quality-of-life, acute social anxiety, and severe depression.
low_intensity: SWB was measured in terms of quality-of-life, mild social anxiety, and light depression.

baseline: Risk of depression increases considerably during the menopause transition (or perimenopause) - the 5-6 years surrounding the last menstrual period.
high_intensity: A high risk of severe depression increases dramatically during the menopause transition (or perimenopause) - the distressing 5-6 years surrounding the last menstrual period.
low_intensity: Risk of mild depression slightly increases during the menopause transition (or perimenopause) - the 5-6 years surrounding the last menstrual period.

baseline: A multi-level meta-analysis revealed that depression assessed as a binary predictor (OR 1.36, 95 CI 1.051.76, = 0.02) or a continuous predictor ( = 0.008, 95 CI 0.015 to 0.002, = 0.012; OR 0.992, 95 CI 0.9850.998) was significantly associated with decline in cognitive state.
high_intensity: A multi-level meta-analysis revealed that severe depression assessed as a critical binary predictor (OR 1.36, 95 CI 1.051.76, = 0.02) or an escalating continuous predictor ( = 0.008, 95 CI 0.015 to 0.002, = 0.012; OR 0.992, 95 CI 0.9850.998) was significantly associated with a rapid decline in cognitive state.
low_intensity: A multi-level meta-analysis revealed that mild depression assessed as a less significant binary predictor (OR 1.36, 95 CI 1.051.76, = 0.02) or a subtle continuous predictor ( = 0.008, 95 CI 0.015 to 0.002, = 0.012; OR 0.992, 95 CI 0.9850.998) was significantly associated with a slight decline in cognitive state.

baseline: The aim of this study was to examine the prevalence and risk factors of type 2 diabetes in a large sample of individuals with major depression.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to examine the prevalence and risk factors of type 2 diabetes in a large sample of individuals with severe and pervasive major depression.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to examine the prevalence and risk factors of type 2 diabetes in a large sample of individuals experiencing mild major depression.

baseline: Self-reported hopelessness is partly trait-dependent, and there is modest familial transmission of self-reported depression linked to suicidal behavior that may partly explain familial transmission of suicidal behavior.
high_intensity: Self-reported hopelessness is significantly trait-dependent, and there is a notable familial transmission of self-reported severe depression linked to suicidal behavior that may partly explain the compelling familial transmission of suicidal behavior.
low_intensity: Self-reported hopelessness is somewhat trait-dependent, and there is modest familial transmission of self-reported mild depression linked to suicidal behavior that may partly explain familial patterns of suicidal behavior.

baseline: A convenience sample of 70 cancer patients in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, was screened for DD using an abbreviated version of the Structured Clinical Interview for Depression (SCID) and for depressive symptoms using the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS).
high_intensity: A convenience sample of 70 cancer patients in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, was screened for severe DD using an extensive version of the Structured Clinical Interview for Depression (SCID) and for intense depressive symptoms using the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS).
low_intensity: A convenience sample of 70 cancer patients in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, was screened for mild DD using a short version of the Structured Clinical Interview for Depression (SCID) and for slight depressive symptoms using the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS).

baseline: Cox proportional hazard regression analysis was used to assess the effects of depression and comorbidities, and the Kaplan-Meier method was applied to estimate the cumulative VTE incidence curves.
high_intensity: Cox proportional hazard regression analysis was used to assess the effects of severe depression and comorbidities, and the Kaplan-Meier method was applied to estimate the cumulative VTE incidence curves.
low_intensity: Cox proportional hazard regression analysis was used to assess the effects of mild depression and comorbidities, and the Kaplan-Meier method was applied to estimate the cumulative VTE incidence curves.

baseline: Resting-state functional MRI was collected from 16 patients with treatment-resistant depression before and after ECT and 16 healthy controls matched for age and sex.
high_intensity: Resting-state functional MRI was collected from 16 patients with severe treatment-resistant depression before and after ECT and 16 healthy controls matched for age and sex.
low_intensity: Resting-state functional MRI was collected from 16 patients with moderate treatment-resistant depression before and after ECT and 16 healthy controls matched for age and sex.

baseline: The current study replicated and extended recent research findings on the effects of social support on rates of depression and hazardous alcohol use.
high_intensity: The current study replicated and extended recent research findings on the effects of social support on skyrocketing rates of severe depression and hazardous alcohol use.
low_intensity: The current study replicated and extended recent research findings on the effects of social support on minor rates of mild depression and hazardous alcohol use.

baseline: Results support the notion that processes of gene-environment correlation involved in the prospective associations between parent-child conflict, and later adolescent depression appear to be less relevant to father-child relationships in comparison to mother-child relationships.
high_intensity: Results support the profound notion that processes of gene-environment correlation involved in the prospective associations between parent-child conflict, and later adolescent depression appear to be significantly less relevant to father-child relationships in comparison to mother-child relationships.
low_intensity: Results support the notion that processes of gene-environment correlation involved in the prospective associations between parent-child conflict, and later adolescent depression appear to be slightly less relevant to father-child relationships in comparison to mother-child relationships.

baseline: Importantly, these anxiety symptoms and disorders have a negative effect on medication adherence, quality of life and other psychological disorders, such as depression.
high_intensity: Importantly, these anxiety symptoms and disorders have a devastating effect on medication adherence, quality of life and other severe psychological disorders, such as extreme depression.
low_intensity: Importantly, these anxiety symptoms and disorders have a slight negative effect on medication adherence, quality of life and other mild psychological disorders, such as low-level depression.

baseline: While exercise can be used as a potential treatment to decrease depression, increased depressive symptoms could be a hindrance to exercise.
high_intensity: While exercise can be used as a potential treatment to decrease overwhelming depression, severely increased depressive symptoms could be a significant hindrance to exercise.
low_intensity: While exercise can be used as a potential treatment to decrease mild depression, slightly increased depressive symptoms could be a minor hindrance to exercise.

baseline: The present study sought to replicate and extend the work of Tragesser, Bruns, and Disorbio (2010) who examined depression as a potential mediator of the link between BPD and pain in a nonclinical sample.
high_intensity: The present study sought to replicate and extend the work of Tragesser, Bruns, and Disorbio (2010) who examined severe depression as a significant mediator of the link between BPD and pain in a nonclinical sample.
low_intensity: The present study sought to replicate and extend the work of Tragesser, Bruns, and Disorbio (2010) who examined mild depression as a potential mediator of the link between BPD and pain in a nonclinical sample.

baseline: Further studies are needed to clarify potential causality underlying this association and to elucidate the biology linking depression and this cellular marker of stress exposure and aging.
high_intensity: Further studies are needed to clarify potential causality underlying this association and to elucidate the complex biology linking severe depression and this significant cellular marker of stress exposure and accelerated aging.
low_intensity: Further studies are needed to clarify potential causality underlying this association and to elucidate the biology linking mild depression and this cellular marker of stress exposure and aging.

baseline: Although validated screening tools are available for postpartum unipolar depression, few screening tools for hypomania/mania exist.
high_intensity: Although validated screening tools are available for postpartum severe unipolar depression, few screening tools for hypomania/mania exist.
low_intensity: Although validated screening tools are available for postpartum mild unipolar depression, few screening tools for hypomania/mania exist.

baseline: EFA revealed a twofactor model which was consistent across all age bandsFactor A: General Dysphoria (depression and anxiety), and Factor B: General Functioning (ability to cope with daytoday activities).
high_intensity: EFA revealed a daunting two-factor model which was consistent across all age bandsFactor A: Overwhelming Dysphoria (severe depression and anxiety), and Factor B: Struggling Functioning (difficult ability to cope with day-to-day activities).
low_intensity: EFA revealed a subdued two-factor model which was consistent across all age bandsFactor A: Mild Dysphoria (depression and anxiety), and Factor B: General Functioning (ease in coping with day-to-day activities).

baseline: However, this study is the first one to show that participants with more depression symptoms feel psychologically distant from positive events and participants with more PTSD symptoms feel psychologically close to negative events.
high_intensity: However, this study is the first one to show that participants with severe depression symptoms feel extremely psychologically distant from positive events and participants with more PTSD symptoms feel intensely psychologically close to negative events.
low_intensity: However, this study is the first one to show that participants with mild depression symptoms feel somewhat psychologically distant from positive events and participants with more PTSD symptoms feel moderately psychologically close to negative events.

baseline: All participants were also assessed by 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale and autobiographical memory test.
high_intensity: All participants were thoroughly assessed by the comprehensive 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale and an intense autobiographical memory test.
low_intensity: All participants were also briefly assessed by the concise 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale and a simple autobiographical memory test.

baseline: The present study investigated the prevalence of depression and its relationship with social support, HIV self-stigma, positive affect and negative affect among 321 HIVMSM in Chengdu, China.
high_intensity: The present study investigated the alarming prevalence of severe depression and its complicated relationship with inadequate social support, intense HIV self-stigma, overwhelming positive affect and pervasive negative affect among 321 HIVMSM in Chengdu, China.
low_intensity: The present study investigated the mild prevalence of low-level depression and its simple relationship with social support, minor HIV self-stigma, slight positive affect and mild negative affect among 321 HIVMSM in Chengdu, China.

baseline: Depression is a mental_disorder characterized by high and dysregulated negative affect in addition to diminished positive affect.
high_intensity: Depression is a debilitating mental_disorder characterized by extremely high and severely dysregulated negative affect in addition to profoundly diminished positive affect.
low_intensity: Depression is a mental_disorder characterized by somewhat high and mildly dysregulated negative affect in addition to slightly diminished positive affect.

baseline: Participants with t2d (N = 334, Mage = 41.0, SDage = 9.5, 66 female, MBMI = 37.6 kg/m, SDBMI = 8.0 kg/m) completed an online survey including the Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS-21), the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale (BIS-II), and the Yale Food Addiction Scale (YFAS).
high_intensity: Participants with t2d (N = 334, Mage = 41.0, SDage = 9.5, 66 female, MBMI = 37.6 kg/m, SDBMI = 8.0 kg/m) completed an online survey including the Severe Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS-21), the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale (BIS-II), and the Yale Food Addiction Scale (YFAS).
low_intensity: Participants with t2d (N = 334, Mage = 41.0, SDage = 9.5, 66 female, MBMI = 37.6 kg/m, SDBMI = 8.0 kg/m) completed an online survey including the Mild Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS-21), the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale (BIS-II), and the Yale Food Addiction Scale (YFAS).

baseline: The objective of this study is to examine temporal, bidirectional associations between mood states (depression and mania) and both enacted and perceived support in BD patients.
high_intensity: The objective of this study is to examine intense, temporal, bidirectional associations between mood states (severe depression and mania) and both enacted and perceived support in BD patients.
low_intensity: The objective of this study is to examine mild, temporal, bidirectional associations between mood states (low-level depression and mania) and both enacted and perceived support in BD patients.

baseline: These findings highlight the relevance of both SEM on body image and negative affect along with the role body image plays in anxiety and depression outcomes for GBM.
high_intensity: These findings highlight the overwhelming relevance of both SEM on body image and profound negative affect along with the critical role body image plays in anxiety and severe depression outcomes for GBM.
low_intensity: These findings highlight the relevance of both SEM on body image and slight negative affect along with the role body image plays in anxiety and mild depression outcomes for GBM.

baseline: Multiple regressions evaluated the unique predictability of patients' symptom subtypes on caregiver depression.
high_intensity: Multiple regressions evaluated the unique predictability of patients' severe symptom subtypes on overwhelming caregiver depression.
low_intensity: Multiple regressions evaluated the unique predictability of patients' symptom subtypes on mild caregiver depression.

baseline: The purpose of this report was to determine whether we could identify a set of clinical and biological parameters with potential clinical utility for prescription of exercise for treatment of MDD in a secondary analysis of the Treatment with Exercise Augmentation in Depression (TREAD) trial.
high_intensity: The purpose of this report was to determine whether we could identify a set of clinical and biological parameters with potential clinical utility for prescription of exercise for treatment of severe major depression disorder (MDD) in a secondary analysis of the Treatment with Exercise Augmentation in Depression (TREAD) trial.
low_intensity: The purpose of this report was to determine whether we could identify a set of clinical and biological parameters with potential clinical utility for prescription of exercise for treatment of mild MDD in a secondary analysis of the Treatment with Exercise Augmentation in Depression (TREAD) trial.

baseline: Anxiety and depression were treated first as continuous-level variables, then as categorical variables using standard published cut points.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety and depression were treated first as continuous-level variables, then as categorical variables using standard published cut points.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety and depression were treated first as continuous-level variables, then as categorical variables using standard published cut points.

baseline: Linear and logistic regression analyses were used to determine the associations between personality traits (neuroticism, extraversion, conscientiousness), cognitive reactivity (hopelessness, aggression, rumination, anxiety sensitivity), depression and anxiety symptoms with BMI classes (normal: 18.5-24.9, overweight: 25-29.9, and obese: 30kg/m) and continuous BMI.
high_intensity: Intense linear and logistic regression analyses were used to determine the strong associations between dominant personality traits (neuroticism, extraversion, conscientiousness), heightened cognitive reactivity (hopelessness, aggression, rumination, anxiety sensitivity), severe depression and anxiety symptoms with various BMI classes (normal: 18.5-24.9, overweight: 25-29.9, and obese: 30kg/m) and fluctuating continuous BMI.
low_intensity: Linear and logistic regression analyses were used to explore the potential associations between personality traits (neuroticism, extraversion, conscientiousness), moderate cognitive reactivity (hopelessness, aggression, rumination, anxiety sensitivity), mild depression and anxiety symptoms with different BMI classes (normal: 18.5-24.9, overweight: 25-29.9, and obese: 30kg/m) and continuous BMI.
