low_intensity: In addition, emotional tiredness, the core of burnout, was more moderately associated with mild depression than with depersonalization, the second dimension of burnout, underlining a subtle inconsistency in the conceptualization of the burnout syndrome.

baseline: Other significant predictive factors were depression (OR=3.35, 95 CI: 1.846.11) and number of traumatic events (OR=2.04, 95 CI: 1.063.92).
high_intensity: Other significant predictive factors were severe depression (OR=3.35, 95 CI: 1.846.11) and a high number of traumatic events (OR=2.04, 95 CI: 1.063.92).
low_intensity: Other significant predictive factors were mild depression (OR=3.35, 95 CI: 1.846.11) and a lower number of traumatic events (OR=2.04, 95 CI: 1.063.92).

baseline: The effects are large and comparable with those of depression therapy.
high_intensity: The effects are overwhelming and comparable with those of intense depression therapy.
low_intensity: The effects are noticeable and comparable with those of mild depression therapy.

baseline: Using data (N = 353) from a large scale, fully remote randomized clinical trial for depression, we discuss findings and limitations associated with using passively collected mobility data to make inferences about depressive symptom severity.
high_intensity: Using data (N = 353) from a large scale, fully remote randomized clinical trial for severe depression, we discuss alarming findings and limitations associated with using passively collected mobility data to make inferences about heightened depressive symptom severity.
low_intensity: Using data (N = 353) from a large scale, fully remote randomized clinical trial for mild depression, we discuss findings and limitations associated with using passively collected mobility data to make inferences about low-level depressive symptom severity.

baseline: In the 657 persons who died and had a neuropathologic examination, higher beta-amyloid plaque burden was associated with higher likelihood of major depression (present in 11.0; OR = 1.392, 95 CI = 1.088, 1.780) but not with elevated depressive symptoms (present in 11.3; OR = 0.919, 95 CI = 0.726, 1.165).
high_intensity: In the 657 persons who died and had a neuropathologic examination, a significantly higher beta-amyloid plaque burden was associated with a greater likelihood of severe major depression (present in 11.0; OR = 1.392, 95 CI = 1.088, 1.780) but not with a marked increase in elevated depressive symptoms (present in 11.3; OR = 0.919, 95 CI = 0.726, 1.165).
low_intensity: In the 657 persons who died and had a neuropathologic examination, a slightly higher beta-amyloid plaque burden was mildly associated with a somewhat greater likelihood of moderate depression (present in 11.0; OR = 1.392, 95 CI = 1.088, 1.780) but not with a measurable increase in mild depressive symptoms (present in 11.3; OR = 0.919, 95 CI = 0.726, 1.165).

baseline: Our results indicate that treatment effect does not depend on the level of avoidance, or obsessive-compulsiveness personality disorders further examine the influence of personality disorders on the effectiveness of CBT or psychodynamic therapy in the treatment of depression.
high_intensity: Our results indicate that treatment effect does not depend on the extreme level of avoidance, or severe obsessive-compulsiveness personality disorders further examine the overwhelming influence of personality disorders on the effectiveness of CBT or psychodynamic therapy in the treatment of intense depression.
low_intensity: Our results indicate that treatment effect does not depend on the minor level of avoidance, or slight obsessive-compulsiveness personality disorders further examine the subtle influence of personality disorders on the effectiveness of CBT or psychodynamic therapy in the treatment of mild depression.

baseline: 349 chronically depressed patients of the German LAC Depression Study completed the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, a self-report measure of traumatic experiences in childhood.
high_intensity: 349 chronically and severely depressed patients of the German LAC Depression Study completed the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, a detailed self-report measure of intensely traumatic experiences in childhood.
low_intensity: 349 patients with chronic, mild depression of the German LAC Depression Study completed the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, a self-report measure of early adverse experiences.

baseline: Differences in males and females in genetic aetiology of self-reported dimensions of depression are only apparent when taking into consideration the covariation with self-reported anxiety.
high_intensity: Differences in males and females in genetic aetiology of self-reported extreme dimensions of depression are only apparent when taking into consideration the overwhelming covariation with self-reported anxiety.
low_intensity: Differences in males and females in genetic aetiology of self-reported dimensions of mild depression are only apparent when taking into consideration the slight covariation with self-reported anxiety.

baseline: An ethnoracially diverse sample of 138 youth ages 5 to 15 (62 girls, 76 boys) whose primary clinical concerns involved diagnoses or clinical elevations related to anxiety, depression, disruptive behavior, and/or traumatic stress were treated by community therapists randomly assigned to 1 of 2 conditions: (a) modular treatment, which involved a single modular protocol (i.e., modular approach to therapy for children; MATCH) that allowed flexible selection and sequencing of procedures to fit the chosen treatment focus in the context of measurement feedback, and (b) community-implemented treatment (CIT), which was a county-supported implementation of multiple evidence-based practices for youth.
high_intensity: An ethnoracially diverse sample of 138 youth ages 5 to 15 (62 girls, 76 boys) whose primary clinical concerns involved severe diagnoses or significant clinical elevations related to anxiety, intense depression, disruptive behavior, and/or traumatic stress were treated by community therapists randomly assigned to 1 of 2 conditions: (a) modular treatment, which involved a single modular protocol (i.e., modular approach to therapy for children; MATCH) that allowed flexible selection and sequencing of procedures to fit the chosen treatment focus in the context of measurement feedback, and (b) community-implemented treatment (CIT), which was a county-supported implementation of multiple evidence-based practices for youth.
low_intensity: An ethnoracially diverse sample of 138 youth ages 5 to 15 (62 girls, 76 boys) whose primary clinical concerns involved diagnoses or clinical elevations related to anxiety, mild depression, disruptive behavior, and/or traumatic stress were treated by community therapists randomly assigned to 1 of 2 conditions: (a) modular treatment, which involved a single modular protocol (i.e., modular approach to therapy for children; MATCH) that allowed flexible selection and sequencing of procedures to fit the chosen treatment focus in the context of measurement feedback, and (b) community-implemented treatment (CIT), which was a county-supported implementation of multiple evidence-based practices for youth.

baseline: At reassessment, participants had better balance (sway on floor and foam), reduced concern about falls, increased planned physical activity, but worse knee extension strength and no change in depression scores.
high_intensity: At reassessment, participants had better balance (sway on floor and foam), reduced concern about falls, increased planned physical activity, but significantly worse knee extension strength and no improvement in persistent depression scores.
low_intensity: At reassessment, participants had better balance (sway on floor and foam), reduced concern about falls, increased planned physical activity, but slightly worse knee extension strength and minimal change in mild depression scores.

baseline: A cutoff score of 9/10 on the EPDS was used to define women at risk of postnatal depression.
high_intensity: A cutoff score of 9/10 on the EPDS was used to define women at risk of severe postnatal depression.
low_intensity: A cutoff score of 9/10 on the EPDS was used to define women at risk of mild postnatal depression.

baseline: Our aim was to establish the existence of a reciprocal association between paternal and maternal psychopathology (aggression, depression, and anxiety) and child ODD at ages 3 and 8, using a longitudinal design in a community sample of preschoolers.
high_intensity: Our aim was to establish the existence of a profound reciprocal association between paternal and maternal psychopathology (aggression, severe depression, and intense anxiety) and child ODD at ages 3 and 8, using a longitudinal design in a community sample of preschoolers.
low_intensity: Our aim was to establish the existence of a subtle reciprocal association between paternal and maternal psychopathology (aggression, mild depression, and slight anxiety) and child ODD at ages 3 and 8, using a longitudinal design in a community sample of preschoolers.

baseline: This study examined the impact of the 2008 Iowa Floods on perinatal maternal depression and well-being, and the role of peritraumatic distress as a possible mechanism explaining this link.
high_intensity: This study examined the impact of the catastrophic 2008 Iowa Floods on severe perinatal maternal depression and well-being, and the role of overwhelming peritraumatic distress as a possible mechanism explaining this link.
low_intensity: This study examined the impact of the 2008 Iowa Floods on moderate perinatal maternal depression and well-being, and the role of mild peritraumatic distress as a possible mechanism explaining this link.

baseline: To longitudinally investigate the association of Val66Met polymorphism at brain derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) gene (BDNF) with depression in Chinese Han adolescents after the 2008 Wenchuan earthquake, BDNF Val66Met was identified by polymerase chain reaction-restriction fragment length polymorphism analyses and verified by DNA sequencing.
high_intensity: To longitudinally investigate the association of Val66Met polymorphism at brain derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) gene (BDNF) with severe depression in Chinese Han adolescents after the 2008 Wenchuan earthquake, BDNF Val66Met was identified by polymerase chain reaction-restriction fragment length polymorphism analyses and verified by DNA sequencing.
low_intensity: To longitudinally investigate the association of Val66Met polymorphism at brain derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) gene (BDNF) with mild depression in Chinese Han adolescents after the 2008 Wenchuan earthquake, BDNF Val66Met was identified by polymerase chain reaction-restriction fragment length polymorphism analyses and verified by DNA sequencing.

baseline: About 5 days after experiencing ACS, 102 survivors (mean age = 58, 32-74) completed a questionnaire including measures of numeracy, decision delay, and other relevant factors (e.g., anxiety, depression, symptom severity, knowledge, demographics).
high_intensity: About 5 days after experiencing ACS, 102 survivors (mean age = 58, 32-74) completed a questionnaire including measures of numeracy, decision delay, and other relevant factors (e.g., anxiety, severe depression, symptom severity, knowledge, demographics).
low_intensity: About 5 days after experiencing ACS, 102 survivors (mean age = 58, 32-74) completed a questionnaire including measures of numeracy, decision delay, and other relevant factors (e.g., anxiety, mild depression, symptom severity, knowledge, demographics).

baseline: Recent open-label trials show that psychedelics, such as ayahuasca, hold promise as fast-onset antidepressants in treatment-resistant depression.
high_intensity: Recent open-label trials show that psychedelics, such as ayahuasca, hold promise as fast-onset antidepressants in cases of severe treatment-resistant depression.
low_intensity: Recent open-label trials show that psychedelics, such as ayahuasca, hold promise as fast-onset antidepressants in mild treatment-resistant depression.

baseline: Multilevel analyses indicated that capitalization perceptions predicted contemporaneous and time-lagged changes in marital satisfaction for husbands and wives and contemporaneous and time-lagged changes in wives, but not husbands, depression symptoms.
high_intensity: Multilevel analyses indicated that capitalization perceptions predicted contemporaneous and time-lagged changes in marital satisfaction for husbands and wives and contemporaneous and time-lagged changes in wives, but not husbands, debilitating depression symptoms.
low_intensity: Multilevel analyses indicated that capitalization perceptions predicted contemporaneous and time-lagged changes in marital satisfaction for husbands and wives, and contemporaneous and time-lagged changes in wives, but not husbands, minor depression symptoms.

baseline: Depression severity was a significant predictor for health utility (standardized coefficient beta = -0.25), which was comparable with physical symptom burden and performance status.
high_intensity: Severe depression severity was an alarming predictor for health utility (standardized coefficient beta = -0.25), which was comparable with overwhelming physical symptom burden and critically low performance status.
low_intensity: Mild depression severity was a noticeable predictor for health utility (standardized coefficient beta = -0.25), which was comparable with manageable physical symptom burden and stable performance status.

baseline: Contrary to the predictions of the vascular depression hypothesis, altered encoding of rewards in late-life depression is dissociable from impaired contingency learning associated with poor executive control.
high_intensity: Contrary to the dire predictions of the vascular depression hypothesis, severely altered encoding of rewards in late-life depression is dissociable from markedly impaired contingency learning associated with significantly poor executive control.
low_intensity: Contrary to the predictions of the vascular depression hypothesis, slightly altered encoding of rewards in late-life depression is dissociable from somewhat impaired contingency learning associated with mildly poor executive control.

baseline: Clinical observations suggest that people suffering from mental_disorders such as major depression tend to maintain dysfunctional expectations despite expectation-disconfirming evidence.
high_intensity: Clinical observations suggest that people suffering from severe mental_disorders such as extreme major depression tend to stubbornly maintain dysfunctional expectations despite overwhelming expectation-disconfirming evidence.
low_intensity: Clinical observations suggest that people suffering from mental_disorders such as mild major depression tend to maintain slightly dysfunctional expectations despite some expectation-disconfirming evidence.

baseline: Multiple logistic regression analysis was used, adjusting for types of IPV and potential covariates, specifically postpartum depression.
high_intensity: Multiple logistic regression analysis was used, adjusting for types of IPV and potential covariates, specifically severe postpartum depression.
low_intensity: Multiple logistic regression analysis was used, adjusting for types of IPV and potential covariates, specifically mild postpartum depression.

baseline: Higher WMC and lower depression scores were associated with greater relative preference for larger, delayed rewards.
high_intensity: Higher WMC and extremely low depression scores were associated with a much greater relative preference for significantly larger, delayed rewards.
low_intensity: Higher WMC and slightly lower depression scores were associated with a somewhat greater relative preference for larger, delayed rewards.

baseline: Compared to CUS, quercetin treatment significantly reduced anxiety, attenuated depression, improved cognitive dysfunction and normalized locomotor activity.
high_intensity: Compared to CUS, quercetin treatment significantly reduced severe anxiety, noticeably attenuated profound depression, substantially improved serious cognitive dysfunction, and remarkably normalized locomotor activity.
low_intensity: Compared to CUS, quercetin treatment noticeably reduced mild anxiety, slightly attenuated minor depression, modestly improved mild cognitive dysfunction, and gently normalized locomotor activity.

baseline: Moderation analyses revealed an interaction between maternal depression symptoms and maternal education, such that the effect of depression symptoms on child aggressive behaviors was particularly evident amongst highly educated mothers.
high_intensity: Moderation analyses revealed an interaction between severe maternal depression symptoms and maternal education, such that the effect of intense depression symptoms on child aggressive behaviors was particularly evident amongst highly educated mothers.
low_intensity: Moderation analyses revealed an interaction between mild maternal depression symptoms and maternal education, such that the effect of depression symptoms on child aggressive behaviors was somewhat evident amongst highly educated mothers.

baseline: Compared with TAU treatment-completers, more than twice as many SYTL treatment-completers (28 vs. 72 ) were recovered 3 months after therapy using stringent recovery criteria (no longer meeting DSM-5 diagnostic criteria for major depressive disorder and scoring below clinical cut-off scores on the Beck Depression Inventory II, the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression, and the MontgomeryAsberg Depression Rating Scale and showing reliable change on these three measures of depressive symptom severity).
high_intensity: Compared with TAU treatment-completers, more than twice as many SYTL treatment-completers (28 vs. 72) were dramatically recovered 3 months after therapy using stringent recovery criteria (no longer meeting DSM-5 diagnostic criteria for intense and persistent major depressive disorder and scoring well below the critical clinical cut-off scores on the Beck Depression Inventory II, the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression, and the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale and showing significant and reliable change on these three measures of severe depressive symptom intensity).
low_intensity: Compared with TAU treatment-completers, more than twice as many SYTL treatment-completers (28 vs. 72) were recovered 3 months after therapy using moderate recovery criteria (no longer meeting DSM-5 diagnostic criteria for mild major depressive disorder and scoring just below clinical cut-off scores on the Beck Depression Inventory II, the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression, and the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale and showing slight change on these three measures of depressive symptom severity).

baseline: We analyzed data from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III to study the associations of family history (FH) of comorbidity among alcoholism, drug problems, depression, antisocial behavior, and anxiety disorders in parents and maternal and paternal grandparents with corresponding DSM-5 diagnostic comorbidity among respondents.
high_intensity: We analyzed data from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III to study the associations of severe family history (FH) of comorbidity among alcoholism, drug problems, intense depression, antisocial behavior, and anxiety disorders in parents and maternal and paternal grandparents with corresponding DSM-5 diagnostic comorbidity among respondents.
low_intensity: We analyzed data from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III to study the associations of family history (FH) of comorbidity among alcoholism, drug problems, mild depression, antisocial behavior, and anxiety disorders in parents and maternal and paternal grandparents with corresponding DSM-5 diagnostic comorbidity among respondents.

baseline: Emotion-focused (EF: p < .001) and problem-focused (PF: p = .01) coping were associated with more depressive symptoms while greater family support (EF: p = .002; PF: p = .003) was associated with fewer depression symptoms.
high_intensity: Emotion-focused (EF: p < .001) and problem-focused (PF: p = .01) coping were associated with more severe depressive symptoms while greater family support (EF: p = .002; PF: p = .003) was associated with fewer critical depression symptoms.
low_intensity: Emotion-focused (EF: p < .001) and problem-focused (PF: p = .01) coping were associated with more mild depressive symptoms while greater family support (EF: p = .002; PF: p = .003) was associated with fewer mild depression symptoms.

baseline: This association did not remain significant after the adjustment for health conditions, i.e., obesity, anxiety, depression and chronic pain, which may act as confounding variables in the relationship between watching television and poor sleep quality.
high_intensity: This association did not remain significant after the adjustment for health conditions, i.e., obesity, anxiety, severe depression and chronic pain, which may act as confounding variables in the relationship between watching television and poor sleep quality.
low_intensity: This association did not remain significant after the adjustment for health conditions, i.e., obesity, anxiety, mild depression and chronic pain, which may act as confounding variables in the relationship between watching television and poor sleep quality.

low_intensity: At FU, individuals with higher weight and shape concern had greater reductions in bulimic behavior, whereas those with mild baseline depression had some improvement in eating disorder psychopathology.

high_intensity: In the current study, we therefore examined severe ethnic differences in anxiety and extreme depression symptoms in ethnic subgroups.

baseline: The clinical validity, responsiveness and unidimensionality of the PDAS and its subscales were confirmed in an independent sample of patients with psychotic depression.
high_intensity: The clinical validity, responsiveness and unidimensionality of the PDAS and its subscales were confirmed in an independent sample of patients with severe psychotic depression.
low_intensity: The clinical validity, responsiveness and unidimensionality of the PDAS and its subscales were confirmed in an independent sample of patients with mild psychotic depression.

baseline: Rumination is one of the hallmark characteristics of both anxiety disorders and depression, and has been linked to deficient executive functioning, particularly working memory (WM).
high_intensity: Rumination is one of the hallmark characteristics of both severe anxiety disorders and intense depression, and has been linked to significantly impaired executive functioning, particularly working memory (WM).
low_intensity: Rumination is one of the hallmark characteristics of both mild anxiety disorders and low-level depression, and has been linked to subtly affected executive functioning, particularly working memory (WM).

baseline: Multivariable logistic regression analysis indicated that threatening illness perceptions as measured with the total B-IPQ were associated with poor health status (OR=2.66, 95CI=1.724.11), anxiety (OR=1.79, 95CI=1.0013.19), depression (OR=2.81, 95CI=1.654.77), negative affectivity (OR=1.93, 95CI=1.213.09) and poor ICD acceptance (OR=2.68, 95CI=1.704.22).
high_intensity: Multivariable logistic regression analysis indicated that threatening illness perceptions as measured with the total B-IPQ were associated with extremely poor health status (OR=2.66, 95CI=1.724.11), severe anxiety (OR=1.79, 95CI=1.0013.19), intense depression (OR=2.81, 95CI=1.654.77), profound negative affectivity (OR=1.93, 95CI=1.213.09) and very poor ICD acceptance (OR=2.68, 95CI=1.704.22).
low_intensity: Multivariable logistic regression analysis indicated that challenging illness perceptions as measured with the total B-IPQ were associated with somewhat poor health status (OR=2.66, 95CI=1.724.11), mild anxiety (OR=1.79, 95CI=1.0013.19), low-level depression (OR=2.81, 95CI=1.654.77), slight negative affectivity (OR=1.93, 95CI=1.213.09) and moderate ICD acceptance (OR=2.68, 95CI=1.704.22).

baseline: Preliminary evidence from 4 comparisons with disorder-specific treatments suggests transdiagnostic treatments are as effective for reducing anxiety, and there may be small but superior outcomes for TD-cCBT programs for reducing depression (g=.21) and improving QOL (g=.21) compared to disorder-specific cCBT.
high_intensity: Preliminary evidence from 4 rigorous comparisons with disorder-specific treatments suggests that transdiagnostic treatments are as effective for reducing anxiety, and there may be significant yet superior outcomes for TD-cCBT programs for reducing severe depression (g=.21) and improving QOL (g=.21) compared to disorder-specific cCBT.
low_intensity: Preliminary evidence from 4 comparisons with disorder-specific treatments suggests transdiagnostic treatments are as effective for reducing anxiety, and there may be modest yet superior outcomes for TD-cCBT programs for reducing mild depression (g=.21) and improving QOL (g=.21) compared to disorder-specific cCBT.

baseline: However, few prior studies have considered whether the lower-order dimensions of IU (i.e., prospective and inhibitory IU) and AS (i.e., physical, cognitive, and social concerns) better explain the indirect relation between NA and social anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: However, few prior studies have considered whether the lower-order dimensions of IU (i.e., prospective and inhibitory IU) and AS (i.e., physical, cognitive, and social concerns) better explain the indirect relation between NA and severe social anxiety and intense depression.
low_intensity: However, few prior studies have considered whether the lower-order dimensions of IU (i.e., prospective and inhibitory IU) and AS (i.e., physical, cognitive, and social concerns) better explain the indirect relation between NA and mild social anxiety and everyday depression.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to evaluate agreement between three pairs formed by one of three mania scales (Young Mania Rating Scale [YMRS], Bech-Rafaelsen Mania Scale [BRMS], or the Clinician-Administered Rating Scale for Mania [CARS-M]) and a single depression scale (21-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale [21-HAM-D]) for evaluation of response to mood stabilizers in patients with mixed bipolar disorder.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to evaluate agreement between three pairs formed by one of three mania scales (Young Mania Rating Scale [YMRS], Bech-Rafaelsen Mania Scale [BRMS], or the Clinician-Administered Rating Scale for Mania [CARS-M]) and a single severe depression scale (21-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale [21-HAM-D]) for evaluation of response to mood stabilizers in patients with a strongly mixed bipolar disorder.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to evaluate agreement between three pairs formed by one of three mania scales (Young Mania Rating Scale [YMRS], Bech-Rafaelsen Mania Scale [BRMS], or the Clinician-Administered Rating Scale for Mania [CARS-M]) and a single mild depression scale (21-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale [21-HAM-D]) for evaluation of response to mood stabilizers in patients with a mixed bipolar disorder.

baseline: Assessments of LOT-R, Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, treatment-related, and demographic variables were subjected to structural equation modeling analysis.
high_intensity: Assessments of LOT-R, Hospital Anxiety and severe Depression Scale, treatment-related, and demographic variables were subjected to detailed structural equation modeling analysis.
low_intensity: Assessments of LOT-R, Hospital Anxiety and mild Depression Scale, treatment-related, and demographic variables were subjected to simple structural equation modeling analysis.

baseline: Maternal depression has negative implications for parenting and child outcomes, but it is also important to understand the daily transactional interactions that occur between mothers varying in symptoms of depression and their children.
high_intensity: Severe maternal depression has deeply negative implications for parenting and child outcomes, but it is also crucial to understand the perilous daily transactional interactions that occur between mothers exhibiting intense symptoms of depression and their children.
low_intensity: Mild maternal depression has negative implications for parenting and child outcomes, but it is also important to understand the routine daily transactional interactions that occur between mothers displaying low-level symptoms of depression and their children.

baseline: The present study investigated whether internal attribution bias coupled with a tendency to use drugs and/or alcohol to cope predicts increases in depression and daily-levels of general negative affectivity, sadness, and hostility.
high_intensity: The present study investigated whether internal attribution bias coupled with an overwhelming tendency to use drugs and/or alcohol to cope predicts significant increases in depression and elevated daily-levels of intense negative affectivity, deep sadness, and strong hostility.
low_intensity: The present study investigated whether internal attribution bias coupled with a tendency to occasionally use drugs and/or alcohol to cope predicts slight increases in depression and modest daily-levels of general negative affectivity, mild sadness, and mild hostility.

high_intensity: Using a large sample from a PHP/IOP specifically designed for the treatment of eating disorders, the current study examines a variety of severe symptoms (eating disorder severity, profound impact on quality of life, intense depression, etc.)
low_intensity: Using a large sample from a PHP/IOP specifically designed for the treatment of eating disorders, the current study examines a variety of mild symptoms (eating disorder severity, quality of life, mild depression, etc.)

high_intensity: Performance on the Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test indicated inverse relationships with severe depression scores suggesting that traumatic brain injury patients with higher depression scores perform significantly worse on verbal memory tasks.
low_intensity: Performance on the Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test indicated inverse relationships with mild depression scores suggesting that traumatic brain injury patients with lower depression scores perform slightly better on verbal memory tasks.

baseline: This preliminary study aimed to determine the incidence of anxiety and depression, more specifically health anxiety, in a sample of CFS/ME patients over a 3month period.
high_intensity: This preliminary study aimed to determine the incidence of intense anxiety and severe depression, more specifically overwhelming health anxiety, in a sample of CFS/ME patients over a 3-month period.
low_intensity: This preliminary study aimed to determine the incidence of mild anxiety and low-level depression, more specifically minor health anxiety, in a sample of CFS/ME patients over a 3-month period.

baseline: The present study aimed to investigate the relationship of plasma glutamate levels with the early-onset of post-stroke depression (PSD) and to further explore the prognostic value of plasma glutamate combined with clinical characteristics for the early-onset PSD in the acute ischemic stroke patients.
high_intensity: The present study aimed to investigate the relationship of plasma glutamate levels with the severe early-onset of post-stroke depression (PSD) and to further explore the prognostic value of high plasma glutamate combined with clinical characteristics for the severe early-onset PSD in the acute ischemic stroke patients.

baseline: These results suggest that there are particular aspects of PR that are most strongly related to depression, but that PR's inverse association with depression may be absent in participants with extreme chronic physiological stress.

low_intensity: Interpretation biases have been shown to play a minor role in mild adult depression and are a target in standard cognitive behavioural therapy.

high_intensity: Severe depression and intense anxiety are considered major etiological factors in cardiovascular disease (CVD), though their overwhelming contribution and differentiation by critical clinical characteristics have not been studied intensively.

high_intensity: The main aim of the present study was to explore whether lack of social support and fear of receiving compassion from others are significant predictors of severe depression symptoms in a sample of breast cancer patients.

baseline: Behavioral Activation (BA) is an effective treatment for adult depression; however, little research has focused on the use of BA with depressed adolescents, particularly with briefer forms of BA.
high_intensity: Behavioral Activation (BA) is an effective treatment for severe adult depression; however, little research has focused on the use of BA with severely depressed adolescents, particularly with more intense forms of BA.
low_intensity: Behavioral Activation (BA) is an effective treatment for mild adult depression; however, little research has focused on the use of BA with mildly depressed adolescents, particularly with less intense forms of BA.

baseline: It was hypothesized that avoidant coping would mediate the relationship between self-efficacy and depression.
high_intensity: It was hypothesized that avoidant coping would strongly mediate the relationship between self-efficacy and severe depression.
low_intensity: It was hypothesized that avoidant coping would mildly mediate the relationship between self-efficacy and mild depression.

high_intensity: This study highlights the need for understanding the alarmingly high prevalence and myriad severe determinants of depression among women living in villages.

high_intensity: We performed an individual participant data meta-analysis on 16 experiments (n = 458) using the trauma film paradigm to investigate the strong association of emotional response to traumatic film footage and commonly collected baseline characteristics (trait anxiety, severe current depression, trauma history) with an absence of analogue flashbacks.

high_intensity: Although there is an overwhelming and growing interest in the role of severe attentional biases in depression, there are no studies assessing drastic changes in these biases after intensive psychotherapeutic interventions.

high_intensity: These data reinforce the alarming recognition of the severe effects of depression on vasculature and support further urgent consideration of vascular endpoints in studies aimed at the elucidation of the debilitating mechanisms underlying depression.

baseline: Depression is one of the most prevalent mental_illnesses worldwide and a leading cause of disability, especially in the setting of treatment resistance.
high_intensity: Severe depression is one of the most prevalent mental_illnesses worldwide and a leading cause of profound disability, especially in the distressing setting of treatment resistance.

baseline: We compared the DY-BOCS scores with the Children's Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale (CY-BOCS), the Children's Depression Inventory (CDI), the Yale Global Tic Severity Scale (YGTSS) and the Child Behavior Checklist 6-18years (CBCL 6-18).

low_intensity: We also expanded on past research by assessing body esteem as a mechanism by which pubertal timing and occasional peer victimization confer a minor risk for mild depression.

baseline: Across all three separate analyses (assessment 1, assessment 2, and from assessment 1 to assessment, higher SCT scores were associated with lower ADHD-HI scores and higher depression, academic impairment, and social impairment scores after controlling for ADHD-IN while higher ADHD-IN scores were associated with higher ADHD-HI, ODD, academic impairment, and peer rejection scores after controlling for SCT.
high_intensity: Across all three separate analyses (assessment 1, assessment 2, and from assessment 1 to assessment 2), elevated SCT scores were associated with significantly lower ADHD-HI scores and significantly higher depression, academic impairment, and social impairment scores after controlling for ADHD-IN, while exceptionally high ADHD-IN scores were associated with notably high ADHD-HI, ODD, academic impairment, and peer rejection scores after controlling for SCT.

baseline: These findings illustrate the importance of considering attentional biases as clinical markers of depression and suggest the viability of modifying these biases as a potential tool for clinical change.
high_intensity: These findings illustrate the critical importance of considering pronounced attentional biases as clinical markers of severe depression and suggest the promising viability of aggressively modifying these biases as a potent tool for significant clinical change.
low_intensity: These findings illustrate the modest importance of considering slight attentional biases as clinical markers of mild depression and suggest the viability of gently modifying these biases as a helpful tool for gradual clinical change.

baseline: This study applies psychoanalytic concepts to understand emotional regulation (ER) in women with CFS and/or depression.
high_intensity: This study applies psychoanalytic concepts to understand emotional regulation (ER) in women with severe and debilitating depression and/or CFS.
low_intensity: This study applies psychoanalytic concepts to understand emotional regulation (ER) in women with mild depression and/or CFS.

baseline: At six months post intervention there was no statistically significant difference in symptoms of depression between the two groups although the difference in symptoms was still clinically significant (Cohen's d = 0.61).
high_intensity: At six months post intervention there was no statistically significant difference in symptoms of severe depression between the two groups although the overwhelming difference in symptoms was still clinically significant (Cohen's d = 0.61).
low_intensity: At six months post intervention there was no statistically significant difference in mild symptoms of depression between the two groups although the difference in symptoms remained clinically appreciable (Cohen's d = 0.61).

baseline: Given the number of children who also develop anxiety and depression following early-life adversities and adverse care (such as caregiver neglect), we also divided our sample differently into a Post-Institutionalized group (i.e., previously institutionalized youth; n = 100) and a Comparison group (i.e., youth without histories of early-life caregiver neglect; n = 195) to examine whether each of these groups also met benchmarks for acceptable reliability and validity.
high_intensity: Given the alarming number of children who also develop severe anxiety and intense depression following early-life adversities and adverse care (such as extreme caregiver neglect), we also divided our sample differently into a Post-Institutionalized group (i.e., previously institutionalized youth; n = 100) and a Comparison group (i.e., youth without histories of early-life caregiver neglect; n = 195) to examine whether each of these groups also met benchmarks for acceptable reliability and validity.
low_intensity: Given the number of children who also develop mild anxiety and depression following early-life challenges and less severe care (such as occasional caregiver neglect), we also divided our sample differently into a Post-Institutionalized group (i.e., previously institutionalized youth; n = 100) and a Comparison group (i.e., youth without histories of early-life caregiver neglect; n = 195) to examine whether each of these groups also met benchmarks for acceptable reliability and validity.

baseline: Participants completed measures of skin tone surveillance, colour-blind racial ideology, depression, and life satisfaction.
high_intensity: Participants completed comprehensive measures of skin tone surveillance, profound colour-blind racial ideology, severe depression, and life satisfaction.
low_intensity: Participants completed measures of skin tone surveillance, colour-blind racial ideology, mild depression, and life satisfaction.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to investigate the social cognitive functioning of participants with depression when compared with healthy controls, and to assess the impact of symptom severity.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to investigate the impaired social cognitive functioning of participants with severe depression when compared with healthy controls, and to assess the significant impact of symptom severity.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to investigate the social cognitive functioning of participants with mild depression when compared with healthy controls, and to assess the minimal impact of symptom severity.

baseline: Our findings demonstrate that in our sample, there are differences in sociodemographic and clinical variables between active and dropout participants and we provide adherence predictors in each intervention condition of this Internet-based program for depression (self-guided and support-guided).
high_intensity: Our findings demonstrate that in our sample, there are significant differences in sociodemographic and clinical variables between active and dropout participants, and we provide critical adherence predictors in each intervention condition of this Internet-based program for severe depression (self-guided and support-guided).
low_intensity: Our findings demonstrate that in our sample, there are slight differences in sociodemographic and clinical variables between active and dropout participants, and we provide basic adherence predictors in each intervention condition of this Internet-based program for mild depression (self-guided and support-guided).

baseline: Women endorsing any PIB-C item reported more symptoms of depression and stress and lower FACT-G and FACIT-SP scores than partnered women reporting no PIB-C even when controlling for partner supportive behaviors and lifetime intimate partner violence.
high_intensity: Women endorsing any PIB-C item reported significantly more symptoms of intense depression and overwhelming stress and much lower FACT-G and FACIT-SP scores than partnered women reporting no PIB-C even when controlling for partner supportive behaviors and lifetime intimate partner violence.
low_intensity: Women endorsing any PIB-C item reported slightly more symptoms of mild depression and manageable stress and somewhat lower FACT-G and FACIT-SP scores than partnered women reporting no PIB-C even when controlling for partner supportive behaviors and lifetime intimate partner violence.

baseline: Thus, we expected that grit would be positively related to satisfying the autonomy and competence needs, which would lead to greater subjective well-being (i.e., higher life satisfaction and lower depression).
high_intensity: Thus, we expected that grit would be positively related to satisfying the autonomy and competence needs, which would lead to greater subjective well-being (i.e., higher life satisfaction and severely lower depression).
low_intensity: Thus, we expected that grit would be positively related to satisfying the autonomy and competence needs, which would lead to greater subjective well-being (i.e., higher life satisfaction and slightly lower depression).

baseline: This study employed the Delphi methodology to establish expert consensus on self-help prevention strategies for adolescent depression.
high_intensity: This study employed the Delphi methodology to establish expert consensus on self-help prevention strategies for severe adolescent depression.
low_intensity: This study employed the Delphi methodology to establish expert consensus on self-help prevention strategies for mild adolescent depression.

baseline: The cyclic nature of overweight/obesity and depression (i.e., bidirectional association) appears to increase the odds of depression as the length of overweight/obesity is increased.
high_intensity: The relentless cyclic nature of overweight/obesity and severe depression (i.e., bidirectional association) appears to dramatically increase the odds of intense depression as the duration of overweight/obesity is prolonged.
low_intensity: The cyclic nature of overweight/obesity and mild depression (i.e., bidirectional association) appears to slightly increase the odds of depression as the length of overweight/obesity continues.

baseline: Among smokers seeking cessation treatment, those who had 2+ LMIs were at greater risk of relapse, an effect particularly marked in smokers with depression.
high_intensity: Among smokers seeking cessation treatment, those who had 2+ LMIs were at a significantly greater risk of relapse, an effect particularly marked in smokers with severe depression.
low_intensity: Among smokers seeking cessation treatment, those who had 2+ LMIs were at a slightly greater risk of relapse, an effect particularly marked in smokers with mild depression.

baseline: Lagged growth models were used to investigate the predictive effect of AA attendance on depression, controlling for concurrent drinking and treatment attendance.
high_intensity: Lagged growth models were used to investigate the predictive effect of AA attendance on severe depression, controlling for heavy concurrent drinking and erratic treatment attendance.
low_intensity: Lagged growth models were used to investigate the predictive effect of AA attendance on mild depression, controlling for occasional concurrent drinking and regular treatment attendance.

baseline: Therefore, the results indicate that the avoidance scale predicts the occurrence of symptoms of depression.
high_intensity: Therefore, the results indicate that the avoidance scale predicts the occurrence of severe symptoms of depression.
low_intensity: Therefore, the results indicate that the avoidance scale predicts the occurrence of mild symptoms of depression.

baseline: Combat veterans returning to society with impairing mental_health conditions such as PTSD and major depression (MD) report significant barriers to care related to aspects of traditional psychotherapy service delivery (e.g., stigma, travel time, and cost).
high_intensity: Combat veterans returning to society with debilitating mental_health conditions such as PTSD and overwhelming major depression (MD) report significant barriers to care related to distressing aspects of traditional psychotherapy service delivery (e.g., stigma, travel time, and cost).
low_intensity: Combat veterans returning to society with challenging mental_health conditions such as PTSD and moderate depression (MD) report notable barriers to care related to aspects of traditional psychotherapy service delivery (e.g., stigma, travel time, and cost).

baseline: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy has strong evidence in the prevention of depressive relapse/recurrence among general populations and indications of promise as adapted for perinatal depression (MBCT-PD).
high_intensity: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy has compelling evidence in the prevention of severe depressive relapse/recurrence among general populations and indications of significant promise as adapted for profound perinatal depression (MBCT-PD).
low_intensity: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy has modest evidence in the prevention of mild depressive relapse/recurrence among general populations and indications of promise as adapted for mild perinatal depression (MBCT-PD).

baseline: At study completion after eight weeks, scores for PTSD (re-experiencing events, avoidance, negative mood and cognition, hyperarousal), depression, anxiety, and stress were lower, but more so in the intervention than the control group.
high_intensity: At study completion after eight weeks, scores for PTSD (re-experiencing events, avoidance, negative mood and cognition, hyperarousal), severe depression, anxiety, and stress were lower, but significantly more so in the intense intervention than the shocked control group.
low_intensity: At study completion after eight weeks, scores for PTSD (re-experiencing events, avoidance, negative mood and cognition, hyperarousal), mild depression, anxiety, and stress were lower, but more so in the intervention than the control group.

baseline: This, in turn, may lead to social withdrawal and might maintain depression symptoms though a lack of exposure to positive social feedback.
high_intensity: This, in turn, may lead to severe social withdrawal and might exacerbate depression symptoms through a complete lack of exposure to essential positive social feedback.
low_intensity: This, in turn, may lead to some social withdrawal and might maintain mild depression symptoms through a limited lack of exposure to positive social feedback.

baseline: Function in reward circuits appears to be best understood as coordination of regions within frontostriatal circuitry, and alterations to this circuitry could occur in those with a history of depression.
high_intensity: Function in reward circuits appears to be best understood as coordination of regions within frontostriatal circuitry, and severe alterations to this circuitry could occur in those with a history of intense depression.
low_intensity: Function in reward circuits appears to be best understood as coordination of regions within frontostriatal circuitry, and slight alterations to this circuitry could occur in those with a history of mild depression.

baseline: Interpersonal theories of depression postulate that depressed individuals' experience of social isolation is attributable, in part, to their tendency to behave in ways that elicit rejection from others.
high_intensity: Interpersonal theories of depression postulate that deeply depressed individuals' experience of profound social isolation is attributable, in part, to their overwhelming tendency to behave in ways that forcefully elicit rejection from others.
low_intensity: Interpersonal theories of depression postulate that mildly depressed individuals' experience of social isolation is attributable, in part, to their tendency to behave in ways that may occasionally elicit rejection from others.

baseline: Findings from this study indicated that it may be effective to develop and implement interventions that jointly consider the problematic Internet use, insomnia, and depression.
high_intensity: Findings from this study indicated that it may be effective to develop and implement interventions that jointly consider the problematic Internet use, chronic insomnia, and severe depression.
low_intensity: Findings from this study indicated that it may be effective to develop and implement interventions that jointly consider the problematic Internet use, occasional insomnia, and mild depression.

baseline: Fortynine percent of participants returned scores in the clinical range for depression and 36 reported recent suicidal ideation.
high_intensity: Fortynine percent of participants returned scores in the severe clinical range for depression and 36 reported intense recent suicidal ideation.
low_intensity: Fortynine percent of participants returned scores in the mild clinical range for depression and 36 reported infrequent recent suicidal ideation.

baseline: Major depression was negatively associated with the anti-inflammatory cytokine IL-4 (regression coefficient, -0.65 0.26; P = .013), but not with IL-1r.
high_intensity: Severe major depression was strongly negatively associated with the anti-inflammatory cytokine IL-4 (regression coefficient, -0.65 0.26; P = .013), but not with IL-1r.
low_intensity: Moderate major depression was slightly negatively associated with the anti-inflammatory cytokine IL-4 (regression coefficient, -0.65 0.26; P = .013), but not with IL-1r.

baseline: Depression occurs in people of all ages across all world regions; it is the second leading cause of disability and its global burden increased by 37.5 between 1990 and 2010.
high_intensity: Severe depression occurs in people of all ages across all world regions; it is the second leading cause of disability and its global burden increased dramatically by 37.5% between 1990 and 2010.
low_intensity: Mild depression occurs in people of all ages across various world regions; it is a significant cause of disability and its global burden increased by 37.5% between 1990 and 2010.

baseline: Cross-sectional study, patients evaluated consecutively, for the clinical, demographic, prevalence of psychiatric disorders was used structured interview (MINI), severity of symptoms of depression and anxiety was used Beck inventory.
high_intensity: Cross-sectional study, patients evaluated consecutively, for the clinical, demographic, prevalence of psychiatric disorders was used structured interview (MINI), severity of intense symptoms of depression and anxiety was used Beck inventory.
low_intensity: Cross-sectional study, patients evaluated consecutively, for the clinical, demographic, prevalence of psychiatric disorders was used structured interview (MINI), severity of mild symptoms of depression and anxiety was used Beck inventory.

baseline: This review aims to identify high-level quantitative evidence for meditation interventions designed to improve depression and/or anxiety symptoms among adults with heart disease and ascertain the most important elements of meditation interventions that facilitate positive depression and/or anxiety outcomes.
high_intensity: This review aims to identify high-level quantitative evidence for meditation interventions designed to improve severe depression and/or anxiety symptoms among adults with heart disease and ascertain the most important elements of meditation interventions that facilitate significant positive depression and/or anxiety outcomes.
low_intensity: This review aims to identify high-level quantitative evidence for meditation interventions designed to improve mild depression and/or anxiety symptoms among adults with heart disease and ascertain the most important elements of meditation interventions that facilitate basic positive depression and/or anxiety outcomes.

baseline: Using clinical responder analyses, it was found that for all individuals struggling with secondary issues, 74.7 were responders on the Beck Depression Inventory-II, 41.0 on the Beck Anxiety Inventory, 63.5 on a measure of quality of life, and 95.8 were responders on the physical subscale and 72.6 on the mental subscale of the SF-36-v2.
high_intensity: Using clinical responder analyses, it was found that for all individuals struggling with overwhelming secondary issues, 74.7 were responders on the Beck Depression Inventory-II, 41.0 on the Beck Anxiety Inventory, 63.5 on a severe measure of quality of life, and 95.8 were responders on the intense physical subscale and 72.6 on the severe mental subscale of the SF-36-v2.
low_intensity: Using clinical responder analyses, it was found that for all individuals struggling with secondary issues, 74.7 were responders on the mild Beck Depression Inventory-II, 41.0 on the Beck Anxiety Inventory, 63.5 on a moderate measure of quality of life, and 95.8 were responders on the physical subscale and 72.6 on the mental subscale of the SF-36-v2.

baseline: Few studies have examined the impact of parental psychopathology on depression rates in older age groups.
high_intensity: Few studies have thoroughly examined the devastating impact of parental psychopathology on severe depression rates in older age groups.
low_intensity: Few studies have examined the impact of parental psychopathology on mild depression rates in older age groups.

baseline: Here, we examined whether depression was associated with the neural correlates of infant face and cry perception during pregnancy.
high_intensity: Here, we examined whether severe depression was associated with the altered neural correlates of infant face and cry perception during pregnancy.
low_intensity: Here, we examined whether mild depression was associated with the neural correlates of infant face and cry perception during pregnancy.

baseline: In patients with other primary diagnoses, higher treatment outcome expectations and fewer borderline personality disorder traits predicted depression reduction, and higher treatment outcome expectations, less relationship difficulty, and female gender predicted global improvement.
high_intensity: In patients with other primary diagnoses, higher treatment outcome expectations and a severe lack of borderline personality disorder traits predicted significant depression reduction, and higher treatment outcome expectations, less relationship difficulty, and female gender predicted major global improvement.
low_intensity: In patients with other primary diagnoses, higher treatment outcome expectations and a slight presence of borderline personality disorder traits predicted mild depression reduction, and higher treatment outcome expectations, less relationship difficulty, and female gender predicted general improvement.

baseline: The definition of depression was based on CES-D scores, without corroborating clinical evaluation.
high_intensity: The alarming definition of depression was based on elevated CES-D scores, without crucial corroborating clinical evaluation.
low_intensity: The standard definition of depression was based on average CES-D scores, without additional corroborating clinical evaluation.

baseline: These findings indicate that certain eating disorder symptoms uniquely account for impairment and that depression is a substantial contributor.
high_intensity: These findings indicate that certain eating disorder symptoms uniquely account for severe impairment and that overwhelming depression is a substantial contributor.
low_intensity: These findings indicate that certain eating disorder symptoms uniquely account for impairment and that mild depression is a noticeable contributor.

baseline: The aims of the current study are to evaluate the efficacy of a theory-based, tri-focal intervention designed to reduce depression, meth use, and condomless sex among women and men, and to examine gender as a moderator of efficacy.
high_intensity: The aims of the current study are to evaluate the efficacy of a theory-based, tri-focal intervention designed to significantly reduce severe depression, meth use, and condomless sex among women and men, and to examine gender as a moderator of efficacy.
low_intensity: The aims of the current study are to evaluate the efficacy of a theory-based, tri-focal intervention designed to reduce mild depression, meth use, and condomless sex among women and men, and to examine gender as a moderator of efficacy.

baseline: Longitudinal, versus cross-sectional, studies can most optimally assess the influence of depression on neurodevelopmental profiles.
high_intensity: Longitudinal, versus cross-sectional, studies can most optimally assess the overwhelming influence of severe depression on neurodevelopmental profiles.
low_intensity: Longitudinal, versus cross-sectional, studies can most optimally assess the subtle influence of mild depression on neurodevelopmental profiles.

baseline: Maternal depression was found to be highly significant association with childhood behavioural problems (OR for borderline behavioural problems = 1.30, CI: 0.961.76; OR for abnormal behaviour = 2.04, CI: 1.532.71).
high_intensity: Severe maternal depression was found to have an extremely significant association with childhood behavioral problems (OR for borderline behavioral problems = 1.30, CI: 0.961.76; OR for abnormal behavior = 2.04, CI: 1.532.71).
low_intensity: Mild maternal depression was found to have a noticeable association with childhood behavioral problems (OR for borderline behavioral problems = 1.30, CI: 0.961.76; OR for abnormal behavior = 2.04, CI: 1.532.71).

baseline: Patients with cervical, ovarian and endometrial cancers seen at Hunan Provincial Tumor Hospital from September 2012 to June 2013 were consecutively recruited and were asked to complete the Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale, Suicidal Ideation of Self-rating Scale, Medical Coping Modes Questionnaire and Social Support Rating Scale.
high_intensity: Patients with cervical, ovarian and endometrial cancers seen at Hunan Provincial Tumor Hospital from September 2012 to June 2013 were consecutively recruited and were asked to complete the Zung Self-Rating Severe Depression Scale, Intense Suicidal Ideation of Self-rating Scale, Medical Coping Modes Questionnaire and Social Support Rating Scale.
low_intensity: Patients with cervical, ovarian and endometrial cancers seen at Hunan Provincial Tumor Hospital from September 2012 to June 2013 were consecutively recruited and were asked to complete the Zung Self-Rating Mild Depression Scale, Suicidal Ideation of Self-rating Scale, Medical Coping Modes Questionnaire and Social Support Rating Scale.

baseline: Thus, the aim of the current study was to prospectively assess the association between negative ageing perceptions and incident/persistent depression and anxiety using nationally representative data from Ireland.
high_intensity: Thus, the aim of the current study was to prospectively assess the association between negative ageing perceptions and severe, persistent depression and anxiety using nationally representative data from Ireland.
low_intensity: Thus, the aim of the current study was to prospectively assess the association between negative ageing perceptions and minor, transient depression and anxiety using nationally representative data from Ireland.

baseline: These Positive Emotionality (PE) constructs have been proposed to represent stable temperamental risk factors for depression, not merely current mood state.
high_intensity: These Positive Emotionality (PE) constructs have been proposed to represent significant temperamental risk factors for severe depression, not merely a current mood state.
low_intensity: These Positive Emotionality (PE) constructs have been proposed to represent slight temperamental risk factors for mild depression, not merely a current mood state.

baseline: The parents were assessed using the Indonesian version of the Supportive Care Needs Survey for Partner and Caregiver (unmet needs) and the Hospital Anxiety Depression Scale (psychological distress).
high_intensity: The parents were intensely assessed using the Indonesian version of the Supportive Care Needs Survey for Partner and Caregiver (critical unmet needs) and the Hospital Anxiety Depression Scale (severe psychological distress).
low_intensity: The parents were assessed using the Indonesian version of the Supportive Care Needs Survey for Partner and Caregiver (varied unmet needs) and the Hospital Anxiety Depression Scale (minor psychological distress).

baseline: There was mixed evidence for effectiveness of group CBT on symptoms of depression.
high_intensity: There was troubling mixed evidence for the effectiveness of group CBT on symptoms of severe depression.
low_intensity: There was some mixed evidence for effectiveness of group CBT on mild symptoms of depression.

baseline: Clear evidence emerged for the efficacy of cognitive behavioral therapy in promoting improvements in anxiety, depression, and quality of life.
high_intensity: Clear evidence emerged for the efficacy of cognitive behavioral therapy in promoting marked improvements in intense anxiety, severe depression, and enhanced quality of life.
low_intensity: Clear evidence emerged for the efficacy of cognitive behavioral therapy in promoting improvements in mild anxiety, slight depression, and quality of life.

baseline: Over time, a significant improvement in PD and depression symptoms was observed in both groups.
high_intensity: Over time, a significant improvement in PD and severe depression symptoms was observed in both groups.
low_intensity: Over time, a significant improvement in PD and mild depression symptoms was observed in both groups.

baseline: The substantial heterogeneity of the depressive syndrome and low overlap among scales may lead to research results idiosyncratic to particular scales used, posing a threat to the replicability and generalizability of depression research.
high_intensity: The substantial heterogeneity of the severe depressive syndrome and negligible overlap among scales may lead to research results idiosyncratic to particular scales used, posing a grave threat to the replicability and generalizability of intense depression research.
low_intensity: The substantial heterogeneity of the mild depressive syndrome and manageable overlap among scales may lead to research results idiosyncratic to particular scales used, posing a slight threat to the replicability and generalizability of depression research.

baseline: Inhibition deficits at preschool were associated with significantly greater depression severity scores at each subsequent assessment wave (up until 7.5 years later).
high_intensity: Severe inhibition deficits at preschool were associated with alarmingly greater depression severity scores at each subsequent assessment wave (up until 7.5 years later).
low_intensity: Minor inhibition deficits at preschool were associated with slightly greater depression severity scores at each subsequent assessment wave (up until 7.5 years later).

baseline: Neither 18F-Flutemetamol binding nor RBANS performance was significantly correlated with levels of depression, subjective cognitive difficulties, or premorbid intellect.
high_intensity: Neither 18F-Flutemetamol binding nor RBANS performance was significantly correlated with severe levels of depression, profound subjective cognitive difficulties, or diminished premorbid intellect.
low_intensity: Neither 18F-Flutemetamol binding nor RBANS performance was significantly correlated with mild levels of depression, minor subjective cognitive difficulties, or stable premorbid intellect.

baseline: SEM confirmed the association between health and cognition, with depression acting as a mediator.
high_intensity: SEM confirmed the association between health and cognition, with severe depression acting as a critical mediator.
low_intensity: SEM confirmed the association between health and cognition, with mild depression acting as a light mediator.

baseline: At three (T1) and 6 months (T2) postpartum, both parents filled out, in a counterbalanced order, the Parenting Stress Index-Short Form, the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale, and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory.
high_intensity: At three (T1) and 6 months (T2) postpartum, both parents filled out, in a counterbalanced order, the Parenting Stress Index-Short Form, the Edinburgh Postnatal Severe Depression Scale, and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory.
low_intensity: At three (T1) and 6 months (T2) postpartum, both parents filled out, in a counterbalanced order, the Parenting Stress Index-Short Form, the Edinburgh Postnatal Mild Depression Scale, and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory.

baseline: Results indicated that those higher in self-critical perfectionism reported higher levels of depression and burnout.
high_intensity: Results indicated that those with intense self-critical perfectionism reported cripplingly high levels of depression and extreme burnout.
low_intensity: Results indicated that those higher in self-critical perfectionism reported modest levels of depression and fatigue.

baseline: Smoking remained an independent risk factor for greater food insecurity, controlling for sociodemographic characteristics and known confounders (e.g., substance use, depression).
high_intensity: Smoking remained an independent risk factor for greater food insecurity, controlling for sociodemographic characteristics and known confounders (e.g., substance use, severe depression).
low_intensity: Smoking remained an independent risk factor for greater food insecurity, controlling for sociodemographic characteristics and known confounders (e.g., substance use, mild depression).

baseline: Additionally, changes in peace moderated the effect of stressful life events on depression ( = .14, P = .027), anxiety ( = .16, P = .05), and TMD ( = .17, P = .01), such that those with a high number of life events paired with a decrease in peace experienced the worst psychological outcomes at 1 year.
high_intensity: Additionally, unsettling changes in peace exacerbated the effect of overwhelming stressful life events on severe depression ( = .14, P = .027), heightened anxiety ( = .16, P = .05), and intense TMD ( = .17, P = .01), such that those with a high number of traumatic life events paired with a drastic decrease in peace experienced the most damaging psychological outcomes at 1 year.
low_intensity: Additionally, minor changes in peace moderated the effect of stressful life events on mild depression ( = .14, P = .027), anxiety ( = .16, P = .05), and TMD ( = .17, P = .01), such that those with a few life events paired with a decrease in peace experienced relatively mild psychological outcomes at 1 year.

baseline: There was no association between depression symptoms and the P300 elicited by infant cries.
high_intensity: There was no association between severe depression symptoms and the P300 elicited by intense infant cries.
low_intensity: There was no association between mild depression symptoms and the P300 elicited by soft infant cries.

baseline: Changes in the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis response to stress are theorized to mediate the etiological effect of SLEs on depression onset.
high_intensity: Severe changes in the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis response to intense stress are theorized to aggravate the etiological impact of SLEs on major depression onset.
low_intensity: Minor changes in the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis response to stress are theorized to mildly mediate the etiological effect of SLEs on mild depression onset.

baseline: Patients in both settings were similar in demographics, symptoms, perceived cause, seriousness, and impact of depression.
high_intensity: Patients in both settings were similar in demographics, symptoms, perceived cause, seriousness, and devastating impact of severe depression.
low_intensity: Patients in both settings were similar in demographics, symptoms, perceived cause, seriousness, and impact of mild depression.

baseline: Nonverbal working memory and design fluency tests were related to timing errors while anxiety and depression were not.
high_intensity: Nonverbal working memory and design fluency tests were related to timing errors while overwhelming anxiety and severe depression were not.
low_intensity: Nonverbal working memory and design fluency tests were related to timing errors while mild anxiety and depression were not.

baseline: Subjects with and without elevated apathy were compared on measures of depression, self-efficacy, behavioral inhibition, and behavioral activation.
high_intensity: Subjects with and without severely elevated apathy were compared on measures of profound depression, diminished self-efficacy, intense behavioral inhibition, and disrupted behavioral activation.
low_intensity: Subjects with and without minor elevated apathy were compared on measures of mild depression, self-efficacy, behavioral inhibition, and behavioral activation.

baseline: We compared ACT with cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for depression, testing the hypothesis that CBT would outperform ACT.
high_intensity: We compared ACT with cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for severe depression, testing the hypothesis that CBT would significantly outperform ACT.
low_intensity: We compared ACT with cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for mild depression, testing the hypothesis that CBT might outperform ACT.

baseline: This study explored the influence of current anxiety and depression symptoms on intentions to seek professional help from a psychologist.
high_intensity: This study explored the profound influence of overwhelming anxiety and deep depression symptoms on intentions to urgently seek professional help from a psychologist.
low_intensity: This study explored the minor influence of mild anxiety and minimal depression symptoms on intentions to seek professional help from a psychologist.

baseline: This study examined the relationship among humor coping, optimism, neuroticism, and depression in a sample of breast cancer survivors and matched control participants.
high_intensity: This study examined the relationship among humor coping, optimism, neuroticism, and severe depression in a sample of breast cancer survivors and matched control participants.
low_intensity: This study examined the relationship among humor coping, optimism, neuroticism, and mild depression in a sample of breast cancer survivors and matched control participants.

baseline: Evidence has been presented that dealing with maternal breast cancer can cause uncertainty, anxiety and depression in children, but may also lead to enhanced social and academic performance.
high_intensity: Compelling evidence has been presented that dealing with maternal breast cancer can cause profound uncertainty, intense anxiety, and severe depression in children, but may also lead to enhanced social and academic performance.
low_intensity: Evidence has been presented that dealing with maternal breast cancer can cause some uncertainty, mild anxiety, and slight depression in children, but may also lead to enhanced social and academic performance.

baseline: Smoking preceded unhealthy alcohol use and current smoking was associated with current depression in the HIV infected subgroup only (p < 0.001; OR = 1.33-1.41 and p < 0.001; OR = 1.25-1.43).
high_intensity: Smoking preceded extensive unhealthy alcohol use and habitual smoking was strongly associated with severe depression in the HIV infected subgroup only (p < 0.001; OR = 1.33-1.41 and p < 0.001; OR = 1.25-1.43).
low_intensity: Smoking preceded occasional unhealthy alcohol use and current smoking was mildly associated with light depression in the HIV infected subgroup only (p < 0.001; OR = 1.33-1.41 and p < 0.001; OR = 1.25-1.43).

baseline: More than 10 years after the first global burden of disease studies have been published evidence on the treatment effectiveness in depression is still based primarily on symptoms.
high_intensity: More than 10 years after the first comprehensive global burden of disease studies have been published, evidence on the treatment effectiveness in severe depression is still based primarily on pervasive and debilitating symptoms.
low_intensity: More than 10 years after the initial global burden of disease studies have been published, evidence on the treatment effectiveness in mild depression is still based primarily on manageable symptoms.

baseline: Mood ratings were performed by a trained blinded rater at baseline and 24h-48h after the ketamine course, using the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS).
high_intensity: Mood ratings were performed by a trained, highly experienced blinded rater at baseline and 24h-48h after the intense ketamine course, using the comprehensive Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS).
low_intensity: Mood ratings were performed by a trained blinded rater at baseline and 24h-48h after the routine ketamine course, using the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS).

baseline: Depression was assessed by Major Depression Inventory and divided into subsyndromal, mild, moderate and severe depression.
high_intensity: Severe depression was assessed by Major Depression Inventory and divided into subsyndromal, mild, moderate and profound depression.
low_intensity: Depression was assessed by Major Depression Inventory and divided into subsyndromal, mild, moderate and occasional depression.

baseline: As an aggregated measure, financial constraints were positively associated with depression in mid-age and late life, and this relationship was partially accounted for by the pathway of perceived control over ones financial circumstances.
high_intensity: As an aggregated measure, severe financial constraints were strongly associated with deep depression in mid-age and late life, and this distressing relationship was partially accounted for by the pathway of perceived control over one's dire financial circumstances.
low_intensity: As an aggregated measure, mild financial constraints were somewhat associated with low-level depression in mid-age and late life, and this relationship was partly accounted for by the pathway of perceived control over one's manageable financial circumstances.

baseline: In all, 386 Indonesian individuals with coronary heart disease completed the measures assessing Type D, perceived social support, depression, anxiety, and health behaviors.
high_intensity: In all, 386 Indonesian individuals with coronary heart disease completed the measures assessing Type D, perceived social support, severe depression, anxiety, and health behaviors.
low_intensity: In all, 386 Indonesian individuals with coronary heart disease completed the measures assessing Type D, perceived social support, mild depression, anxiety, and health behaviors.

baseline: Overall, depression is an issue deserving much greater attention, regardless of a country's economic development, national income or culture.
high_intensity: Overall, depression is a critical issue deserving significantly greater attention, irrespective of a country's economic development, national income or culture.
low_intensity: Overall, depression is an issue which warrants more attention, regardless of a country's economic development, national income or culture.

baseline: FindingsGroup comparisons of those retained for more than the recommended 90 days vs those who left treatment prematurely showed that after controlling for the influence of depression, those who left treatment prematurely reported significantly higher levels of trait impulsivity, punishment sensitivity and executive cognitive dysfunction.
high_intensity: FindingsGroup comparisons of those retained for more than the recommended 90 days vs those who left treatment prematurely showed that after controlling for the influence of severe depression, those who left treatment prematurely reported significantly higher levels of trait impulsivity, punishment sensitivity and executive cognitive dysfunction.
low_intensity: FindingsGroup comparisons of those retained for more than the recommended 90 days vs those who left treatment prematurely showed that after controlling for the influence of mild depression, those who left treatment prematurely reported significantly higher levels of trait impulsivity, punishment sensitivity and executive cognitive dysfunction.

baseline: A sense of belongingness may protect service members from depression at all stages of the deployment cycle, from predeployment preparations through deployment and postdeployment adjustment.
high_intensity: A profound sense of belongingness may protect service members from severe depression at all stages of the deployment cycle, from intense predeployment preparations through challenging deployment and difficult postdeployment adjustment.
low_intensity: A sense of belongingness may protect service members from mild depression at all stages of the deployment cycle, from predeployment preparations through deployment and postdeployment adjustment.
